translation_en_yusufali: Had Allah willed, He could have easily made you one community ˹of believers˺, but He leaves to stray whoever He wills and guides whoever He wills. And you will certainly be questioned about what you used to do.

text_simple: ولا تتخذوا ايمانكم دخلا بينكم فتزل قدم بعد ثبوتها وتذوقوا السوء بما صددتم عن سبيل الله ولكم عذاب عظيم
translation_en_yusufali: And do not take your oaths as a means of deceiving one another or your feet will slip after they have been firm. Then you will taste the evil ˹consequences˺ of hindering ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah, and you will suffer a tremendous punishment.

text_simple: ولا تشتروا بعهد الله ثمنا قليلا انما عند الله هو خير لكم ان كنتم تعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: And do not trade Allah’s covenant for a fleeting gain. What is with Allah is certainly far better for you, if only you knew.

text_simple: ما عندكم ينفد وما عند الله باق ولنجزين الذين صبروا اجرهم باحسن ما كانوا يعملون
translation_en_yusufali: Whatever you have will end, but whatever Allah has is everlasting. And We will certainly reward the steadfast according to the best of their deeds.

text_simple: من عمل صالحا من ذكر او انثى وهو مؤمن فلنحيينه حياة طيبة ولنجزينهم اجرهم باحسن ما كانوا يعملون
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever does good, whether male or female, and is a believer, We will surely bless them with a good life, and We will certainly reward them according to the best of their deeds.

text_simple: فاذا قرات القران فاستعذ بالله من الشيطان الرجيم
translation_en_yusufali: When you recite the Quran, seek refuge with Allah from Satan, the accursed.

text_simple: انه ليس له سلطان على الذين امنوا وعلى ربهم يتوكلون
translation_en_yusufali: He certainly has no authority over those who believe and put their trust in their Lord.

text_simple: انما سلطانه على الذين يتولونه والذين هم به مشركون
translation_en_yusufali: His authority is only over those who take him as a patron and who—under his influence—associate ˹others˺ with Allah ˹in worship˺.

text_simple: واذا بدلنا اية مكان اية والله اعلم بما ينزل قالوا انما انت مفتر بل اكثرهم لا يعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: When We replace a verse with another—and Allah knows best what He reveals—they say, “You ˹Muḥammad˺ are just a fabricator.” In fact, most of them do not know.

text_simple: قل نزله روح القدس من ربك بالحق ليثبت الذين امنوا وهدى وبشرى للمسلمين
translation_en_yusufali: Say, “The holy spirit has brought it down from your Lord with the truth to reassure the believers, and as a guide and good news for those who submit ˹to Allah˺.”

text_simple: ولقد نعلم انهم يقولون انما يعلمه بشر لسان الذي يلحدون اليه اعجمي وهذا لسان عربي مبين
translation_en_yusufali: And We surely know that they say, “No one is teaching him except a human.” But the man they refer to speaks a foreign tongue, whereas this ˹Quran˺ is ˹in˺ eloquent Arabic.

text_simple: ان الذين لا يؤمنون بايات الله لا يهديهم الله ولهم عذاب اليم
translation_en_yusufali: Surely those who do not believe in Allah’s revelations will never be guided by Allah, and they will suffer a painful punishment.

text_simple: انما يفتري الكذب الذين لا يؤمنون بايات الله واولئك هم الكاذبون
translation_en_yusufali: No one fabricates lies except those who disbelieve in Allah’s revelations, and it is they who are the ˹true˺ liars.

text_simple: من كفر بالله من بعد ايمانه الا من اكره وقلبه مطمئن بالايمان ولكن من شرح بالكفر صدرا فعليهم غضب من الله ولهم عذاب عظيم
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever disbelieves in Allah after their belief—not those who are forced while their hearts are firm in faith, but those who embrace disbelief wholeheartedly—they will be condemned by Allah and suffer a tremendous punishment.

text_simple: ذلك بانهم استحبوا الحياة الدنيا على الاخرة وان الله لا يهدي القوم الكافرين
translation_en_yusufali: This is because they prefer the life of this world over the Hereafter. Surely Allah never guides those who ˹choose to˺ disbelieve.

text_simple: اولئك الذين طبع الله على قلوبهم وسمعهم وابصارهم واولئك هم الغافلون
translation_en_yusufali: They are the ones whose hearts, ears, and eyes are sealed by Allah, and it is they who are ˹truly˺ heedless.

text_simple: لا جرم انهم في الاخرة هم الخاسرون
translation_en_yusufali: Without a doubt, they will be the losers in the Hereafter.

text_simple: ثم ان ربك للذين هاجروا من بعد ما فتنوا ثم جاهدوا وصبروا ان ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who emigrated after being compelled ˹to renounce Islam˺, then struggled ˹in Allah’s cause˺, and persevered, your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ is truly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful after all.

text_simple: يوم تاتي كل نفس تجادل عن نفسها وتوفى كل نفس ما عملت وهم لا يظلمون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Consider˺ the Day ˹when˺ every soul will come pleading for itself, and each will be paid in full for what it did, and none will be wronged.

text_simple: وضرب الله مثلا قرية كانت امنة مطمئنة ياتيها رزقها رغدا من كل مكان فكفرت بانعم الله فاذاقها الله لباس الجوع والخوف بما كانوا يصنعون
translation_en_yusufali: And Allah sets forth the example of a society which was safe and at ease, receiving its provision in abundance from all directions. But its people met Allah’s favours with ingratitude, so Allah made them taste the clutches of hunger and fear for their misdeeds.

text_simple: ولقد جاءهم رسول منهم فكذبوه فاخذهم العذاب وهم ظالمون
translation_en_yusufali: A messenger of their own actually did come to them, but they denied him. So the torment overtook them while they persisted in wrongdoing.

text_simple: فكلوا مما رزقكم الله حلالا طيبا واشكروا نعمت الله ان كنتم اياه تعبدون
translation_en_yusufali: So eat from the good, lawful things which Allah has provided for you, and be grateful for Allah’s favours, if you ˹truly˺ worship Him ˹alone˺.

text_simple: انما حرم عليكم الميتة والدم ولحم الخنزير وما اهل لغير الله به فمن اضطر غير باغ ولا عاد فان الله غفور رحيم
translation_en_yusufali: He has only forbidden you ˹to eat˺ carrion, blood, swine, and what is slaughtered in the name of any other than Allah. But if someone is compelled by necessity—neither driven by desire nor exceeding immediate need—then surely Allah is All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

text_simple: ولا تقولوا لما تصف السنتكم الكذب هذا حلال وهذا حرام لتفتروا على الله الكذب ان الذين يفترون على الله الكذب لا يفلحون
translation_en_yusufali: Do not falsely declare with your tongues, “This is lawful, and that is unlawful,” ˹only˺ fabricating lies against Allah. Indeed, those who fabricate lies against Allah will never succeed.

text_simple: متاع قليل ولهم عذاب اليم
translation_en_yusufali: ˹It is only˺ a brief enjoyment, then they will suffer a painful punishment.

text_simple: وعلى الذين هادوا حرمنا ما قصصنا عليك من قبل وما ظلمناهم ولكن كانوا انفسهم يظلمون
translation_en_yusufali: To the Jews, We have forbidden what We related to you before. We did not wrong them, but it was they who wronged themselves.

text_simple: ثم ان ربك للذين عملوا السوء بجهالة ثم تابوا من بعد ذلك واصلحوا ان ربك من بعدها لغفور رحيم
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who commit evil ignorantly ˹or recklessly˺, then repent afterwards and mend their ways, then your Lord is surely All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

text_simple: ان ابراهيم كان امة قانتا لله حنيفا ولم يك من المشركين
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, Abraham was a model of excellence: devoted to Allah, ˹perfectly˺ upright—not a polytheist—

text_simple: شاكرا لانعمه اجتباه وهداه الى صراط مستقيم
translation_en_yusufali: ˹utterly˺ grateful for Allah’s favours. ˹So˺ He chose him and guided him to the Straight Path.

text_simple: واتيناه في الدنيا حسنة وانه في الاخرة لمن الصالحين
translation_en_yusufali: We blessed him with all goodness in this world, and in the Hereafter he will certainly be among the righteous.

text_simple: ثم اوحينا اليك ان اتبع ملة ابراهيم حنيفا وما كان من المشركين
translation_en_yusufali: Then We revealed to you ˹O Prophet, saying˺: “Follow the faith of Abraham, the upright, who was not one of the polytheists.”

text_simple: انما جعل السبت على الذين اختلفوا فيه وان ربك ليحكم بينهم يوم القيامة فيما كانوا فيه يختلفون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Honouring˺ the Sabbath was ordained only for those who disputed about Abraham. And surely your Lord will judge between them on the Day of Judgment regarding their disputes.

text_simple: ادع الى سبيل ربك بالحكمة والموعظة الحسنة وجادلهم بالتي هي احسن ان ربك هو اعلم بمن ضل عن سبيله وهو اعلم بالمهتدين
translation_en_yusufali: Invite ˹all˺ to the Way of your Lord with wisdom and kind advice, and only debate with them in the best manner. Surely your Lord ˹alone˺ knows best who has strayed from His Way and who is ˹rightly˺ guided.

text_simple: وان عاقبتم فعاقبوا بمثل ما عوقبتم به ولئن صبرتم لهو خير للصابرين
translation_en_yusufali: If you retaliate, then let it be equivalent to what you have suffered. But if you patiently endure, it is certainly best for those who are patient.

text_simple: واصبر وما صبرك الا بالله ولا تحزن عليهم ولا تك في ضيق مما يمكرون
translation_en_yusufali: Be patient ˹O Prophet˺, for your patience is only with Allah’s help. Do not grieve over those ˹who disbelieve˺, nor be distressed by their schemes.

text_simple: ان الله مع الذين اتقوا والذين هم محسنون
translation_en_yusufali: Surely Allah is with those who shun evil and who do good ˹deeds˺.

text_simple: سبحان الذي اسرى بعبده ليلا من المسجد الحرام الى المسجد الاقصى الذي باركنا حوله لنريه من اياتنا انه هو السميع البصير
translation_en_yusufali: Glory be to the One Who took His servant ˹Muḥammad˺ by night from the Sacred Mosque to the Farthest Mosque whose surroundings We have blessed, so that We may show him some of Our signs. Indeed, He alone is the All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

text_simple: واتينا موسى الكتاب وجعلناه هدى لبني اسرائيل الا تتخذوا من دوني وكيلا
translation_en_yusufali: And We gave Moses the Scripture and made it a guide for the Children of Israel, ˹stating:˺ “Do not take besides Me any other Trustee of Affairs

text_simple: ذرية من حملنا مع نوح انه كان عبدا شكورا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹O˺ descendants of those We carried with Noah ˹in the Ark˺! He was indeed a grateful servant.”

text_simple: وقضينا الى بني اسرائيل في الكتاب لتفسدن في الارض مرتين ولتعلن علوا كبيرا
translation_en_yusufali: And We warned the Children of Israel in the Scripture, “You will certainly cause corruption in the land twice, and you will become extremely arrogant.

text_simple: فاذا جاء وعد اولاهما بعثنا عليكم عبادا لنا اولي باس شديد فجاسوا خلال الديار وكان وعدا مفعولا
translation_en_yusufali: When the first of the two warnings would come to pass, We would send against you some of Our servants of great might, who would ravage your homes. This would be a warning fulfilled.

text_simple: ثم رددنا لكم الكرة عليهم وامددناكم باموال وبنين وجعلناكم اكثر نفيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Then ˹after your repentance˺ We would give you the upper hand over them and aid you with wealth and offspring, causing you to outnumber them.

text_simple: ان احسنتم احسنتم لانفسكم وان اساتم فلها فاذا جاء وعد الاخرة ليسوءوا وجوهكم وليدخلوا المسجد كما دخلوه اول مرة وليتبروا ما علوا تتبيرا
translation_en_yusufali: If you act rightly, it is for your own good, but if you do wrong, it is to your own loss. “And when the second warning would come to pass, your enemies would ˹be left to˺ totally disgrace you and enter the Temple ˹of Jerusalem˺ as they entered it the first time, and utterly destroy whatever would fall into their hands.

text_simple: عسى ربكم ان يرحمكم وان عدتم عدنا وجعلنا جهنم للكافرين حصيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Perhaps your Lord will have mercy on you ˹if you repent˺, but if you return ˹to sin˺, We will return ˹to punishment˺. And We have made Hell a ˹permanent˺ confinement for the disbelievers.”

text_simple: ان هذا القران يهدي للتي هي اقوم ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصالحات ان لهم اجرا كبيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Surely this Quran guides to what is most upright, and gives good news to the believers—who do good—that they will have a mighty reward.

text_simple: وان الذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة اعتدنا لهم عذابا اليما
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹it warns˺ those who do not believe in the Hereafter ˹that˺ We have prepared for them a painful punishment.

text_simple: ويدع الانسان بالشر دعاءه بالخير وكان الانسان عجولا
translation_en_yusufali: And humans ˹swiftly˺ pray for evil as they pray for good. For humankind is ever hasty.

text_simple: وجعلنا الليل والنهار ايتين فمحونا اية الليل وجعلنا اية النهار مبصرة لتبتغوا فضلا من ربكم ولتعلموا عدد السنين والحساب وكل شيء فصلناه تفصيلا
translation_en_yusufali: We made the day and night as two signs. So We made the sign of the night devoid of light, and We made the sign of the day ˹perfectly˺ bright, so that you may seek the bounty of your Lord and know the number of years and calculation ˹of time˺. And We have explained everything in detail.

text_simple: وكل انسان الزمناه طائره في عنقه ونخرج له يوم القيامة كتابا يلقاه منشورا
translation_en_yusufali: We have bound every human’s destiny to their neck. And on the Day of Judgment We will bring forth to each ˹person˺ a record which they will find laid open.

text_simple: اقرا كتابك كفى بنفسك اليوم عليك حسيبا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹And it will be said,˺ “Read your record. You ˹alone˺ are sufficient this Day to take account of yourself.”

text_simple: من اهتدى فانما يهتدي لنفسه ومن ضل فانما يضل عليها ولا تزر وازرة وزر اخرى وما كنا معذبين حتى نبعث رسولا
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good. And whoever chooses to stray, it is only to their own loss. No soul burdened with sin will bear the burden of another. And We would never punish ˹a people˺ until We have sent a messenger ˹to warn them˺.

text_simple: واذا اردنا ان نهلك قرية امرنا مترفيها ففسقوا فيها فحق عليها القول فدمرناها تدميرا
translation_en_yusufali: Whenever We intend to destroy a society, We command its elite ˹to obey Allah˺ but they act rebelliously in it. So the decree ˹of punishment˺ is justified, and We destroy it utterly.

text_simple: وكم اهلكنا من القرون من بعد نوح وكفى بربك بذنوب عباده خبيرا بصيرا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We have destroyed after Noah! And sufficient is your Lord as All-Aware and All-Seeing of the sins of His servants.

text_simple: من كان يريد العاجلة عجلنا له فيها ما نشاء لمن نريد ثم جعلنا له جهنم يصلاها مذموما مدحورا
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever desires this fleeting world ˹alone˺, We hasten in it whatever We please to whoever We will; then We destine them for Hell, where they will burn, condemned and rejected.

text_simple: ومن اراد الاخرة وسعى لها سعيها وهو مؤمن فاولئك كان سعيهم مشكورا
translation_en_yusufali: But whoever desires the Hereafter and strives for it accordingly, and is a ˹true˺ believer, it is they whose striving will be appreciated.

text_simple: كلا نمد هؤلاء وهؤلاء من عطاء ربك وما كان عطاء ربك محظورا
translation_en_yusufali: We provide both the former and the latter from the bounty of your Lord. And the bounty of your Lord can never be withheld.

text_simple: انظر كيف فضلنا بعضهم على بعض وللاخرة اكبر درجات واكبر تفضيلا
translation_en_yusufali: See how We have favoured some over others ˹in this life˺, but the Hereafter is certainly far greater in rank and in favour.

text_simple: لا تجعل مع الله الها اخر فتقعد مذموما مخذولا
translation_en_yusufali: Do not set up any other god with Allah, or you will end up condemned, abandoned.

text_simple: وقضى ربك الا تعبدوا الا اياه وبالوالدين احسانا اما يبلغن عندك الكبر احدهما او كلاهما فلا تقل لهما اف ولا تنهرهما وقل لهما قولا كريما
translation_en_yusufali: For your Lord has decreed that you worship none but Him. And honour your parents. If one or both of them reach old age in your care, never say to them ˹even˺ ‘ugh,’ nor yell at them. Rather, address them respectfully.

text_simple: واخفض لهما جناح الذل من الرحمة وقل رب ارحمهما كما ربياني صغيرا
translation_en_yusufali: And be humble with them out of mercy, and pray, “My Lord! Be merciful to them as they raised me when I was young.”

text_simple: ربكم اعلم بما في نفوسكم ان تكونوا صالحين فانه كان للاوابين غفورا
translation_en_yusufali: Your Lord knows best what is within yourselves. If you are righteous, He is certainly All-Forgiving to those who ˹constantly˺ turn to Him.

text_simple: وات ذا القربى حقه والمسكين وابن السبيل ولا تبذر تبذيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Give to close relatives their due, as well as the poor and ˹needy˺ travellers. And do not spend wastefully.

text_simple: ان المبذرين كانوا اخوان الشياطين وكان الشيطان لربه كفورا
translation_en_yusufali: Surely the wasteful are ˹like˺ brothers to the devils. And the Devil is ever ungrateful to his Lord.

text_simple: واما تعرضن عنهم ابتغاء رحمة من ربك ترجوها فقل لهم قولا ميسورا
translation_en_yusufali: But if you must turn them down ˹because you lack the means to give˺—while hoping to receive your Lord’s bounty—then ˹at least˺ give them a kind word.

text_simple: ولا تجعل يدك مغلولة الى عنقك ولا تبسطها كل البسط فتقعد ملوما محسورا
translation_en_yusufali: Do not be so tight-fisted, for you will be blameworthy; nor so open-handed, for you will end up in poverty.

text_simple: ان ربك يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء ويقدر انه كان بعباده خبيرا بصيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Surely your Lord gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills. He is certainly All-Aware, All-Seeing of His servants.

text_simple: ولا تقتلوا اولادكم خشية املاق نحن نرزقهم واياكم ان قتلهم كان خطئا كبيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for them and for you. Surely killing them is a heinous sin.

text_simple: ولا تقربوا الزنا انه كان فاحشة وساء سبيلا
translation_en_yusufali: Do not go near adultery. It is truly a shameful deed and an evil way.

text_simple: ولا تقتلوا النفس التي حرم الله الا بالحق ومن قتل مظلوما فقد جعلنا لوليه سلطانا فلا يسرف في القتل انه كان منصورا
translation_en_yusufali: Do not take a ˹human˺ life—made sacred by Allah—except with ˹legal˺ right. If anyone is killed unjustly, We have given their heirs the authority, but do not let them exceed limits in retaliation, for they are already supported ˹by law˺.

text_simple: ولا تقربوا مال اليتيم الا بالتي هي احسن حتى يبلغ اشده واوفوا بالعهد ان العهد كان مسئولا
translation_en_yusufali: Do not come near the wealth of the orphan—unless intending to enhance it—until they attain maturity. Honour ˹your˺ pledges, for you will surely be accountable for them.

text_simple: واوفوا الكيل اذا كلتم وزنوا بالقسطاس المستقيم ذلك خير واحسن تاويلا
translation_en_yusufali: Give in full when you measure, and weigh with an even balance. That is fairest and best in the end.

text_simple: ولا تقف ما ليس لك به علم ان السمع والبصر والفؤاد كل اولئك كان عنه مسئولا
translation_en_yusufali: Do not follow what you have no ˹sure˺ knowledge of. Indeed, all will be called to account for ˹their˺ hearing, sight, and intellect.

text_simple: ولا تمش في الارض مرحا انك لن تخرق الارض ولن تبلغ الجبال طولا
translation_en_yusufali: And do not walk on the earth arrogantly. Surely you can neither crack the earth nor stretch to the height of the mountains.

text_simple: كل ذلك كان سيئه عند ربك مكروها
translation_en_yusufali: The violation of any of these ˹commandments˺ is detestable to your Lord.

text_simple: ذلك مما اوحى اليك ربك من الحكمة ولا تجعل مع الله الها اخر فتلقى في جهنم ملوما مدحورا
translation_en_yusufali: This is part of the wisdom which your Lord has revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺. And do not set up any other god with Allah ˹O humanity˺, or you will be cast into Hell, blameworthy, rejected.

text_simple: افاصفاكم ربكم بالبنين واتخذ من الملائكة اناثا انكم لتقولون قولا عظيما
translation_en_yusufali: Has your Lord favoured you ˹pagans˺ with sons and taken angels as ˹His˺ daughters? You are truly making an outrageous claim.

text_simple: ولقد صرفنا في هذا القران ليذكروا وما يزيدهم الا نفورا
translation_en_yusufali: We have surely varied ˹the signs˺ in this Quran so perhaps they may be mindful, but it only drives them farther away.

text_simple: قل لو كان معه الهة كما يقولون اذا لابتغوا الى ذي العرش سبيلا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Had there been other gods besides Him—as they claim—then they would have certainly sought a way to ˹challenge˺ the Lord of the Throne.”

text_simple: سبحانه وتعالى عما يقولون علوا كبيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Glorified and Highly Exalted is He above what they claim!

text_simple: تسبح له السماوات السبع والارض ومن فيهن وان من شيء الا يسبح بحمده ولكن لا تفقهون تسبيحهم انه كان حليما غفورا
translation_en_yusufali: The seven heavens, the earth, and all those in them glorify Him. There is not a single thing that does not glorify His praises—but you ˹simply˺ cannot comprehend their glorification. He is indeed Most Forbearing, All-Forgiving.

text_simple: واذا قرات القران جعلنا بينك وبين الذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة حجابا مستورا
translation_en_yusufali: When you ˹O Prophet˺ recite the Quran, We put a hidden barrier between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter.

text_simple: وجعلنا على قلوبهم اكنة ان يفقهوه وفي اذانهم وقرا واذا ذكرت ربك في القران وحده ولوا على ادبارهم نفورا
translation_en_yusufali: We have cast veils over their hearts—leaving them unable to comprehend it—and deafness in their ears. And when you mention your Lord alone in the Quran, they turn their backs in aversion.

text_simple: نحن اعلم بما يستمعون به اذ يستمعون اليك واذ هم نجوى اذ يقول الظالمون ان تتبعون الا رجلا مسحورا
translation_en_yusufali: We know best how they listen to your recitation and what they say privately—when the wrongdoers say, “You would only be following a bewitched man.”

text_simple: انظر كيف ضربوا لك الامثال فضلوا فلا يستطيعون سبيلا
translation_en_yusufali: See how they call you names ˹O Prophet˺! So they have gone so ˹far˺ astray that they cannot find the ˹Right˺ Way.

text_simple: وقالوا ااذا كنا عظاما ورفاتا اانا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا
translation_en_yusufali: And they say ˹mockingly˺, “When we are reduced to bones and ashes, will we really be raised as a new creation?”

text_simple: قل كونوا حجارة او حديدا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹Yes, even if˺ you become stones, or iron

text_simple: او خلقا مما يكبر في صدوركم فسيقولون من يعيدنا قل الذي فطركم اول مرة فسينغضون اليك رءوسهم ويقولون متى هو قل عسى ان يكون قريبا
translation_en_yusufali: or whatever you think is harder to bring to life!” Then they will ask ˹you˺, “Who will bring us back ˹to life˺?” Say, “The One Who created you the first time.” They will then shake their heads at you and ask, “When will that be?” Say, “Perhaps it is soon!”

text_simple: يوم يدعوكم فتستجيبون بحمده وتظنون ان لبثتم الا قليلا
translation_en_yusufali: On the Day He will call you, you will ˹instantly˺ respond by praising Him, thinking you had remained ˹in the world˺ only for a little while.

text_simple: وقل لعبادي يقولوا التي هي احسن ان الشيطان ينزغ بينهم ان الشيطان كان للانسان عدوا مبينا
translation_en_yusufali: Tell My ˹believing˺ servants to say only what is best. Satan certainly seeks to sow discord among them. Satan is indeed a sworn enemy to humankind.

text_simple: ربكم اعلم بكم ان يشا يرحمكم او ان يشا يعذبكم وما ارسلناك عليهم وكيلا
translation_en_yusufali: Your Lord knows you best. He may have mercy on you if He wills, or punish you if He wills. We have not sent you ˹O Prophet˺ as a keeper over them.

text_simple: وربك اعلم بمن في السماوات والارض ولقد فضلنا بعض النبيين على بعض واتينا داوود زبورا
translation_en_yusufali: Your Lord knows best all those in the heavens and the earth. And We have surely favoured some prophets above others, and to David We gave the Psalms.

text_simple: قل ادعوا الذين زعمتم من دونه فلا يملكون كشف الضر عنكم ولا تحويلا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Invoke those you claim ˹to be divine˺ besides Him—they do not have the power to undo harm from you or transfer it ˹to someone else˺.”

text_simple: اولئك الذين يدعون يبتغون الى ربهم الوسيلة ايهم اقرب ويرجون رحمته ويخافون عذابه ان عذاب ربك كان محذورا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Even˺ the closest ˹to Allah˺ of those invoked would be seeking a way to their Lord, hoping for His mercy, and fearing His punishment. Indeed, your Lord’s torment is fearsome.

text_simple: وان من قرية الا نحن مهلكوها قبل يوم القيامة او معذبوها عذابا شديدا كان ذلك في الكتاب مسطورا
translation_en_yusufali: There is not a ˹wicked˺ society that We will not destroy or punish with a severe torment before the Day of Judgment. That is written in the Record.

text_simple: وما منعنا ان نرسل بالايات الا ان كذب بها الاولون واتينا ثمود الناقة مبصرة فظلموا بها وما نرسل بالايات الا تخويفا
translation_en_yusufali: Nothing keeps Us from sending the ˹demanded˺ signs except that they had ˹already˺ been denied by earlier peoples. And We gave Thamûd the she-camel as a clear sign, but they wrongfully rejected it. We only send the signs as a warning.

text_simple: واذ قلنا لك ان ربك احاط بالناس وما جعلنا الرؤيا التي اريناك الا فتنة للناس والشجرة الملعونة في القران ونخوفهم فما يزيدهم الا طغيانا كبيرا
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember, O  Prophet˺ when We told you, “Certainly your Lord encompasses the people.” And We have made what We brought you to see as well as the cursed tree ˹mentioned˺ in the Quran only as a test for the people. We keep warning them, but it only increases them greatly in defiance.

text_simple: واذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لادم فسجدوا الا ابليس قال ااسجد لمن خلقت طينا
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs, who protested, “Should I prostrate to the one You have created from mud?”

text_simple: قال ارايتك هذا الذي كرمت علي لئن اخرتن الى يوم القيامة لاحتنكن ذريته الا قليلا
translation_en_yusufali: Adding, “Do you see this one you honoured above me? If you delay my end until the Day of Judgment, I will certainly take hold of his descendants, except for a few.”

text_simple: قال اذهب فمن تبعك منهم فان جهنم جزاؤكم جزاء موفورا
translation_en_yusufali: Allah responded, “Be gone! Whoever of them follows you, Hell will surely be the reward for all of you—an ample reward.

text_simple: واستفزز من استطعت منهم بصوتك واجلب عليهم بخيلك ورجلك وشاركهم في الاموال والاولاد وعدهم وما يعدهم الشيطان الا غرورا
translation_en_yusufali: And incite whoever you can of them with your voice, mobilize against them all your cavalry and infantry, manipulate them in their wealth and children, and make them promises.” But Satan promises them nothing but delusion.

text_simple: ان عبادي ليس لك عليهم سلطان وكفى بربك وكيلا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Allah added,˺ “You will truly have no authority over My ˹faithful˺ servants.” And sufficient is your Lord as a Guardian.

text_simple: ربكم الذي يزجي لكم الفلك في البحر لتبتغوا من فضله انه كان بكم رحيما
translation_en_yusufali: It is your Lord Who steers the ships for you through the sea, so that you may seek His bounty. Surely He is ever Merciful to you.

text_simple: واذا مسكم الضر في البحر ضل من تدعون الا اياه فلما نجاكم الى البر اعرضتم وكان الانسان كفورا
translation_en_yusufali: When you are touched with hardship at sea, you ˹totally˺ forget all ˹the gods˺ you ˹normally˺ invoke, except Him. But when He delivers you ˹safely˺ to shore, you turn away. Humankind is ever ungrateful.

text_simple: افامنتم ان يخسف بكم جانب البر او يرسل عليكم حاصبا ثم لا تجدوا لكم وكيلا
translation_en_yusufali: Do you feel secure that He will not cause the land to swallow you up, or unleash upon you a storm of stones? Then you will find none to protect you.

text_simple: ام امنتم ان يعيدكم فيه تارة اخرى فيرسل عليكم قاصفا من الريح فيغرقكم بما كفرتم ثم لا تجدوا لكم علينا به تبيعا
translation_en_yusufali: Or do you feel secure that He will not send you back to sea once again, and send upon you a violent storm, drowning you for your denial? Then you will find none to avenge you against Us.

text_simple: ولقد كرمنا بني ادم وحملناهم في البر والبحر ورزقناهم من الطيبات وفضلناهم على كثير ممن خلقنا تفضيلا
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, We have dignified the children of Adam, carried them on land and sea, granted them good and lawful provisions, and privileged them far above many of Our creatures.

text_simple: يوم ندعو كل اناس بامامهم فمن اوتي كتابه بيمينه فاولئك يقرءون كتابهم ولا يظلمون فتيلا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Beware of˺ the Day We will summon every people with their leader. So whoever will be given their record in their right hand will read it ˹happily˺ and will not be wronged ˹even by the width of˺ the thread of a date stone.

text_simple: ومن كان في هذه اعمى فهو في الاخرة اعمى واضل سبيلا
translation_en_yusufali: But whoever is blind ˹to the truth˺ in this ˹world˺ will be blind in the Hereafter, and ˹even˺ far more astray from the ˹Right˺ Way.

text_simple: وان كادوا ليفتنونك عن الذي اوحينا اليك لتفتري علينا غيره واذا لاتخذوك خليلا
translation_en_yusufali: They definitely ˹thought they˺ were about to lure you away from what We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺, hoping that you would attribute something else to Us falsely—and then they would have certainly taken you as a close friend.

text_simple: ولولا ان ثبتناك لقد كدت تركن اليهم شيئا قليلا
translation_en_yusufali: Had We not made you steadfast, you probably would have inclined to them a little

text_simple: اذا لاذقناك ضعف الحياة وضعف الممات ثم لا تجد لك علينا نصيرا
translation_en_yusufali: and then We truly would have made you taste double ˹punishment˺ both in this life and after death, and you would have found no helper against Us.

text_simple: وان كادوا ليستفزونك من الارض ليخرجوك منها واذا لا يلبثون خلافك الا قليلا
translation_en_yusufali: They were about to intimidate you to drive you out of the land ˹of Mecca˺, but then they would not have survived after you ˹had left˺ except for a little while.

text_simple: سنة من قد ارسلنا قبلك من رسلنا ولا تجد لسنتنا تحويلا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹This has been˺ Our way with the messengers We sent before you. And you will never find any change in Our way.

text_simple: اقم الصلاة لدلوك الشمس الى غسق الليل وقران الفجر ان قران الفجر كان مشهودا
translation_en_yusufali: Observe the prayer from the decline of the sun until the darkness of the night and the dawn prayer, for certainly the dawn prayer is witnessed ˹by angels˺.

text_simple: ومن الليل فتهجد به نافلة لك عسى ان يبعثك ربك مقاما محمودا
translation_en_yusufali: And rise at ˹the last˺ part of the night, offering additional prayers, so your Lord may raise you to a station of praise.

text_simple: وقل رب ادخلني مدخل صدق واخرجني مخرج صدق واجعل لي من لدنك سلطانا نصيرا
translation_en_yusufali: And say, “My Lord! Grant me an honourable entrance and an honourable exit and give me a supporting authority from Yourself.”

text_simple: وقل جاء الحق وزهق الباطل ان الباطل كان زهوقا
translation_en_yusufali: And declare, “The truth has come and falsehood has vanished. Indeed, falsehood is bound to vanish.”

text_simple: وننزل من القران ما هو شفاء ورحمة للمؤمنين ولا يزيد الظالمين الا خسارا
translation_en_yusufali: We send down the Quran as a healing and mercy for the believers, but it only increases the wrongdoers in loss.

text_simple: واذا انعمنا على الانسان اعرض وناى بجانبه واذا مسه الشر كان يئوسا
translation_en_yusufali: When We grant people Our favours, they turn away, acting arrogantly. But when touched with evil, they lose all hope.

text_simple: قل كل يعمل على شاكلته فربكم اعلم بمن هو اهدى سبيلا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Everyone acts in their own way. But your Lord knows best whose way is rightly guided.”

text_simple: ويسالونك عن الروح قل الروح من امر ربي وما اوتيتم من العلم الا قليلا
translation_en_yusufali: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the spirit. Say, “Its nature is known only to my Lord, and you ˹O humanity˺ have been given but little knowledge.”

text_simple: ولئن شئنا لنذهبن بالذي اوحينا اليك ثم لا تجد لك به علينا وكيلا
translation_en_yusufali: If We willed, We could have certainly taken away what We have revealed to you ˹O Prophet˺—then you would find none to guarantee its return from Us—

text_simple: الا رحمة من ربك ان فضله كان عليك كبيرا
translation_en_yusufali: had it not been for the mercy of your Lord. Indeed, His favour upon you is immense.

text_simple: قل لئن اجتمعت الانس والجن على ان ياتوا بمثل هذا القران لا ياتون بمثله ولو كان بعضهم لبعض ظهيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If ˹all˺ humans and jinn were to come together to produce the equivalent of this Quran, they could not produce its equal, no matter how they supported each other.”

text_simple: ولقد صرفنا للناس في هذا القران من كل مثل فابى اكثر الناس الا كفورا
translation_en_yusufali: And We have truly set forth every ˹kind of˺ lesson for humanity in this Quran, yet most people persist in disbelief.

text_simple: وقالوا لن نؤمن لك حتى تفجر لنا من الارض ينبوعا
translation_en_yusufali: They challenge ˹the Prophet˺, “We will never believe in you until you cause a spring to gush forth from the earth for us

text_simple: او تكون لك جنة من نخيل وعنب فتفجر الانهار خلالها تفجيرا
translation_en_yusufali: or until you have a garden of palm trees and vineyards, and cause rivers to flow abundantly in it

text_simple: او تسقط السماء كما زعمت علينا كسفا او تاتي بالله والملائكة قبيلا
translation_en_yusufali: or cause the sky to fall upon us in pieces, as you have claimed, or bring Allah and the angels before us, face to face

text_simple: او يكون لك بيت من زخرف او ترقى في السماء ولن نؤمن لرقيك حتى تنزل علينا كتابا نقرؤه قل سبحان ربي هل كنت الا بشرا رسولا
translation_en_yusufali: or until you have a house of gold, or you ascend into heaven—and even then we will not believe in your ascension until you bring down to us a book that we can read.” Say, “Glory be to my Lord! Am I not only a human messenger?”

text_simple: وما منع الناس ان يؤمنوا اذ جاءهم الهدى الا ان قالوا ابعث الله بشرا رسولا
translation_en_yusufali: And nothing has prevented people from believing when guidance comes to them except their protest: “Has Allah sent a human as a messenger?”

text_simple: قل لو كان في الارض ملائكة يمشون مطمئنين لنزلنا عليهم من السماء ملكا رسولا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Had there been angels walking the earth, well settled, We would have surely sent down for them an angel from heaven as a messenger.”

text_simple: قل كفى بالله شهيدا بيني وبينكم انه كان بعباده خبيرا بصيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, “Sufficient is Allah as a Witness between me and you. He is certainly All-Knowing, All-Seeing of His servants.”

text_simple: ومن يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد لهم اولياء من دونه ونحشرهم يوم القيامة على وجوههم عميا وبكما وصما ماواهم جهنم كلما خبت زدناهم سعيرا
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever Allah guides is truly guided. And whoever He leaves to stray, you will find no guardians for them besides Him. And We will drag them on their faces on the Day of Judgment—deaf, dumb, and blind. Hell will be their home. Whenever it dies down, We will flare it up for them.

text_simple: ذلك جزاؤهم بانهم كفروا باياتنا وقالوا ااذا كنا عظاما ورفاتا اانا لمبعوثون خلقا جديدا
translation_en_yusufali: That is their reward for rejecting Our signs and asking ˹mockingly˺, “When we are reduced to bones and ashes, will we really be raised as a new creation?”

text_simple: اولم يروا ان الله الذي خلق السماوات والارض قادر على ان يخلق مثلهم وجعل لهم اجلا لا ريب فيه فابى الظالمون الا كفورا
translation_en_yusufali: Have they not realized that Allah, Who created the heavens and the earth, can ˹easily˺ re-create them? He has ˹already˺ set for them a time, about which there is no doubt. But the wrongdoers persist in denial.

text_simple: قل لو انتم تملكون خزائن رحمة ربي اذا لامسكتم خشية الانفاق وكان الانسان قتورا
translation_en_yusufali: Say ˹to them, O  Prophet˺, “Even if you were to possess the ˹infinite˺ treasuries of my Lord’s mercy, then you would certainly withhold ˹them˺, fearing they would run out—for humankind is ever stingy!”

text_simple: ولقد اتينا موسى تسع ايات بينات فاسال بني اسرائيل اذ جاءهم فقال له فرعون اني لاظنك يا موسى مسحورا
translation_en_yusufali: We surely gave Moses nine clear signs. ˹You, O  Prophet, can˺ ask the Children of Israel. When Moses came to them, Pharaoh said to him, “I really think that you, O  Moses, are bewitched.”

text_simple: قال لقد علمت ما انزل هؤلاء الا رب السماوات والارض بصائر واني لاظنك يا فرعون مثبورا
translation_en_yusufali: Moses replied, “You know well that none has sent these ˹signs˺ down except the Lord of the heavens and the earth as insights. And I really think that you, O  Pharaoh, are doomed.”

text_simple: فاراد ان يستفزهم من الارض فاغرقناه ومن معه جميعا
translation_en_yusufali: So Pharaoh wanted to scare the Israelites out of the land ˹of Egypt˺, but We drowned him and all of those with him.

text_simple: وقلنا من بعده لبني اسرائيل اسكنوا الارض فاذا جاء وعد الاخرة جئنا بكم لفيفا
translation_en_yusufali: And We said to the Children of Israel after Pharaoh, “Reside in the land, but when the promise of the Hereafter comes to pass, We will bring you all together.”

text_simple: وبالحق انزلناه وبالحق نزل وما ارسلناك الا مبشرا ونذيرا
translation_en_yusufali: We have sent down the Quran in truth, and with the truth it has come down. We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a deliverer of good news and a warner.

text_simple: وقرانا فرقناه لتقراه على الناس على مكث ونزلناه تنزيلا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹It is˺ a Quran We have revealed in stages so that you may recite it to people at a deliberate pace. And We have sent it down in successive revelations.

text_simple: قل امنوا به او لا تؤمنوا ان الذين اوتوا العلم من قبله اذا يتلى عليهم يخرون للاذقان سجدا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Believe in this ˹Quran˺, or do not. Indeed, when it is recited to those who were gifted with knowledge before it ˹was revealed˺, they fall upon their faces in prostration

text_simple: ويقولون سبحان ربنا ان كان وعد ربنا لمفعولا
translation_en_yusufali: and say, ‘Glory be to our Lord! Surely the promise of our Lord has been fulfilled.’

text_simple: ويخرون للاذقان يبكون ويزيدهم خشوعا
translation_en_yusufali: And they fall down upon their faces weeping, and it increases them in humility.”

text_simple: قل ادعوا الله او ادعوا الرحمن ايا ما تدعوا فله الاسماء الحسنى ولا تجهر بصلاتك ولا تخافت بها وابتغ بين ذلك سبيلا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Call upon Allah or call upon the Most Compassionate—whichever you call, He has the Most Beautiful Names.” Do not recite your prayers too loudly or silently, but seek a way between.

text_simple: وقل الحمد لله الذي لم يتخذ ولدا ولم يكن له شريك في الملك ولم يكن له ولي من الذل وكبره تكبيرا
translation_en_yusufali: And say, “All praise is for Allah, Who has never had ˹any˺ offspring; nor does He have a partner in ˹governing˺ the kingdom; nor is He pathetic, needing a protector. And revere Him immensely.”

text_simple: الحمد لله الذي انزل على عبده الكتاب ولم يجعل له عوجا
translation_en_yusufali: All praise is for Allah Who has revealed the Book to His servant, allowing no crookedness in it

text_simple: قيما لينذر باسا شديدا من لدنه ويبشر المؤمنين الذين يعملون الصالحات ان لهم اجرا حسنا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹making it˺ perfectly upright, to warn ˹the disbelievers˺ of a severe torment from Him; to give good news to the believers—who do good—that they will have a fine reward

text_simple: ماكثين فيه ابدا
translation_en_yusufali: in which they will remain forever;

text_simple: وينذر الذين قالوا اتخذ الله ولدا
translation_en_yusufali: and to warn those who claim, “Allah has offspring.”

text_simple: ما لهم به من علم ولا لابائهم كبرت كلمة تخرج من افواههم ان يقولون الا كذبا
translation_en_yusufali: They have no knowledge of this, nor did their forefathers. What a terrible claim that comes out of their mouths! They say nothing but lies.

text_simple: فلعلك باخع نفسك على اثارهم ان لم يؤمنوا بهذا الحديث اسفا
translation_en_yusufali: Now, perhaps you ˹O Prophet˺ will grieve yourself to death over their denial, if they ˹continue to˺ disbelieve in this message.

text_simple: انا جعلنا ما على الارض زينة لها لنبلوهم ايهم احسن عملا
translation_en_yusufali: We have indeed made whatever is on earth as an adornment for it, in order to test which of them is best in deeds.

text_simple: وانا لجاعلون ما عليها صعيدا جرزا
translation_en_yusufali: And We will certainly reduce whatever is on it to barren ground.

text_simple: ام حسبت ان اصحاب الكهف والرقيم كانوا من اياتنا عجبا
translation_en_yusufali: Have you ˹O Prophet˺ thought that the people of the cave and the plaque were ˹the only˺ wonders of Our signs?

text_simple: اذ اوى الفتية الى الكهف فقالوا ربنا اتنا من لدنك رحمة وهيئ لنا من امرنا رشدا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Remember˺ when those youths took refuge in the cave, and said, “Our Lord! Grant us mercy from Yourself and guide us rightly through our ordeal.”

text_simple: فضربنا على اذانهم في الكهف سنين عددا
translation_en_yusufali: So We caused them to fall into a dead sleep in the cave for many years

text_simple: ثم بعثناهم لنعلم اي الحزبين احصى لما لبثوا امدا
translation_en_yusufali: then We raised them so We may show which of the two groups would make a better estimation of the length of their stay.

text_simple: نحن نقص عليك نباهم بالحق انهم فتية امنوا بربهم وزدناهم هدى
translation_en_yusufali: We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ their story in truth. They were youths who truly believed in their Lord, and We increased them in guidance.

text_simple: وربطنا على قلوبهم اذ قاموا فقالوا ربنا رب السماوات والارض لن ندعو من دونه الها لقد قلنا اذا شططا
translation_en_yusufali: And We strengthened their hearts when they stood up and declared, “Our Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth. We will never call upon any god besides Him, or we would truly be uttering an outrageous lie.”

text_simple: هؤلاء قومنا اتخذوا من دونه الهة لولا ياتون عليهم بسلطان بين فمن اظلم ممن افترى على الله كذبا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Then they said to one another,˺ “These people of ours have taken gods besides Him. Why do they not produce a clear proof of them? Who then does more wrong than those who fabricate lies against Allah?

text_simple: واذ اعتزلتموهم وما يعبدون الا الله فاووا الى الكهف ينشر لكم ربكم من رحمته ويهيئ لكم من امركم مرفقا
translation_en_yusufali: Since you have distanced yourselves from them and what they worship besides Allah, take refuge in the cave. Your Lord will extend His mercy to you and accommodate you in your ordeal.”

text_simple: وترى الشمس اذا طلعت تزاور عن كهفهم ذات اليمين واذا غربت تقرضهم ذات الشمال وهم في فجوة منه ذلك من ايات الله من يهد الله فهو المهتد ومن يضلل فلن تجد له وليا مرشدا
translation_en_yusufali: And you would have seen the sun, as it rose, inclining away from their cave to the right, and as it set, declining away from them to the left, while they lay in its open space. That is one of the signs of Allah. Whoever Allah guides is truly guided. But whoever He leaves to stray, you will never find for them a guiding mentor.

text_simple: وتحسبهم ايقاظا وهم رقود ونقلبهم ذات اليمين وذات الشمال وكلبهم باسط ذراعيه بالوصيد لو اطلعت عليهم لوليت منهم فرارا ولملئت منهم رعبا
translation_en_yusufali: And you would have thought they were awake, though they were asleep. We turned them over, to the right and left, while their dog stretched his forelegs at the entrance. Had you looked at them, you would have certainly fled away from them, filled with horror.

text_simple: وكذلك بعثناهم ليتساءلوا بينهم قال قائل منهم كم لبثتم قالوا لبثنا يوما او بعض يوم قالوا ربكم اعلم بما لبثتم فابعثوا احدكم بورقكم هذه الى المدينة فلينظر ايها ازكى طعاما فلياتكم برزق منه وليتلطف ولا يشعرن بكم احدا
translation_en_yusufali: And so We awakened them so that they might question one another. One of them exclaimed, “How long have you remained ˹asleep˺?” Some replied, “Perhaps a day, or part of a day.” They said ˹to one another˺, “Your Lord knows best how long you have remained. So send one of you with these silver coins of yours to the city, and let him find which food is the purest, and then bring you provisions from it. Let him be ˹exceptionally˺ cautious, and do not let him give you away.

text_simple: انهم ان يظهروا عليكم يرجموكم او يعيدوكم في ملتهم ولن تفلحوا اذا ابدا
translation_en_yusufali: For, indeed, if they find out about you, they will stone you ˹to death˺, or force you back into their faith, and then you will never succeed.”

text_simple: وكذلك اعثرنا عليهم ليعلموا ان وعد الله حق وان الساعة لا ريب فيها اذ يتنازعون بينهم امرهم فقالوا ابنوا عليهم بنيانا ربهم اعلم بهم قال الذين غلبوا على امرهم لنتخذن عليهم مسجدا
translation_en_yusufali: That is how We caused them to be discovered so that their people might know that Allah’s promise ˹of resurrection˺ is true and that there is no doubt about the Hour. When the people disputed with each other about the case of the youth ˹after their death˺, some proposed, “Build a structure around them. Their Lord knows best about them.” Those who prevailed in the matter said, “We will surely build a place of worship over them.”

text_simple: سيقولون ثلاثة رابعهم كلبهم ويقولون خمسة سادسهم كلبهم رجما بالغيب ويقولون سبعة وثامنهم كلبهم قل ربي اعلم بعدتهم ما يعلمهم الا قليل فلا تمار فيهم الا مراء ظاهرا ولا تستفت فيهم منهم احدا
translation_en_yusufali: Some will say, “They were three, their dog was the fourth,” while others will say, “They were five, their dog was the sixth,” ˹only˺ guessing blindly. And others will say, “They were seven and their dog was the eighth.” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “My Lord knows best their ˹exact˺ number. Only a few people know as well.” So do not argue about them except with sure knowledge, nor consult any of those ˹who debate˺ about them.

text_simple: ولا تقولن لشيء اني فاعل ذلك غدا
translation_en_yusufali: And never say of anything, “I will definitely do this tomorrow,”

text_simple: الا ان يشاء الله واذكر ربك اذا نسيت وقل عسى ان يهدين ربي لاقرب من هذا رشدا
translation_en_yusufali: without adding, “if Allah so wills!” But if you forget, then remember your Lord, and say, “I trust my Lord will guide me to what is more right than this.”

text_simple: ولبثوا في كهفهم ثلاث مائة سنين وازدادوا تسعا
translation_en_yusufali: They had remained in their cave for three hundred years, adding nine.

text_simple: قل الله اعلم بما لبثوا له غيب السماوات والارض ابصر به واسمع ما لهم من دونه من ولي ولا يشرك في حكمه احدا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Allah knows best how long they stayed. With Him ˹alone˺ is ˹the knowledge of˺ the unseen of the heavens and the earth. How perfectly He hears and sees! They have no guardian besides Him, and He shares His command with none.”

text_simple: واتل ما اوحي اليك من كتاب ربك لا مبدل لكلماته ولن تجد من دونه ملتحدا
translation_en_yusufali: Recite what has been revealed to you from the Book of your Lord. None can change His Words, nor can you find any refuge besides Him.

text_simple: واصبر نفسك مع الذين يدعون ربهم بالغداة والعشي يريدون وجهه ولا تعد عيناك عنهم تريد زينة الحياة الدنيا ولا تطع من اغفلنا قلبه عن ذكرنا واتبع هواه وكان امره فرطا
translation_en_yusufali: And patiently stick with those who call upon their Lord morning and evening, seeking His pleasure. Do not let your eyes look beyond them, desiring the luxuries of this worldly life. And do not obey those whose hearts We have made heedless of Our remembrance, who follow ˹only˺ their desires and whose state is ˹total˺ loss.

text_simple: وقل الحق من ربكم فمن شاء فليؤمن ومن شاء فليكفر انا اعتدنا للظالمين نارا احاط بهم سرادقها وان يستغيثوا يغاثوا بماء كالمهل يشوي الوجوه بئس الشراب وساءت مرتفقا
translation_en_yusufali: And say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “˹This is˺ the truth from your Lord. Whoever wills let them believe, and whoever wills let them disbelieve.” Surely We have prepared for the wrongdoers a Fire whose walls will ˹completely˺ surround them. When they cry for aid, they will be aided with water like molten metal, which will burn ˹their˺ faces. What a horrible drink! And what a terrible place to rest!

text_simple: ان الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات انا لا نضيع اجر من احسن عملا
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who believe and do good, We certainly never deny the reward of those who are best in deeds.

text_simple: اولئك لهم جنات عدن تجري من تحتهم الانهار يحلون فيها من اساور من ذهب ويلبسون ثيابا خضرا من سندس واستبرق متكئين فيها على الارائك نعم الثواب وحسنت مرتفقا
translation_en_yusufali: It is they who will have the Gardens of Eternity, with rivers flowing under their feet. There they will be adorned with bracelets of gold, and wear green garments of fine silk and rich brocade, reclining there on ˹canopied˺ couches. What a marvellous reward! And what a fabulous place to rest!

text_simple: واضرب لهم مثلا رجلين جعلنا لاحدهما جنتين من اعناب وحففناهما بنخل وجعلنا بينهما زرعا
translation_en_yusufali: Give them ˹O Prophet˺ an example of two men. To ˹the disbelieving˺ one We gave two gardens of grapevines, which We surrounded with palm trees and placed ˹various˺ crops in between.

text_simple: كلتا الجنتين اتت اكلها ولم تظلم منه شيئا وفجرنا خلالهما نهرا
translation_en_yusufali: Each garden yielded ˹all˺ its produce, never falling short. And We caused a river to flow between them.

text_simple: وكان له ثمر فقال لصاحبه وهو يحاوره انا اكثر منك مالا واعز نفرا
translation_en_yusufali: And he had other resources ˹as well˺. So he boasted to a ˹poor˺ companion of his, while conversing with him, “I am greater than you in wealth and superior in manpower.”

text_simple: ودخل جنته وهو ظالم لنفسه قال ما اظن ان تبيد هذه ابدا
translation_en_yusufali: And he entered his property, while wronging his soul, saying, “I do not think this will ever perish

text_simple: وما اظن الساعة قائمة ولئن رددت الى ربي لاجدن خيرا منها منقلبا
translation_en_yusufali: nor do I think the Hour will ˹ever˺ come. And if in fact I am returned to my Lord, I will definitely get a far better outcome than ˹all˺ this.”

text_simple: قال له صاحبه وهو يحاوره اكفرت بالذي خلقك من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم سواك رجلا
translation_en_yusufali: His ˹believing˺ companion replied, while conversing with him, “Do you disbelieve in the One Who created you from dust, then ˹developed you˺ from a sperm-drop, then formed you into a man?

text_simple: لكنا هو الله ربي ولا اشرك بربي احدا
translation_en_yusufali: But as for me: He is Allah, my Lord, and I will never associate anyone with my Lord ˹in worship˺.

text_simple: ولولا اذ دخلت جنتك قلت ما شاء الله لا قوة الا بالله ان ترن انا اقل منك مالا وولدا
translation_en_yusufali: If only you had said, upon entering your property, ‘This is what Allah has willed! There is no power except with Allah!’ Even though you see me inferior to you in wealth and offspring

text_simple: فعسى ربي ان يؤتين خيرا من جنتك ويرسل عليها حسبانا من السماء فتصبح صعيدا زلقا
translation_en_yusufali: perhaps my Lord will grant me ˹something˺ better than your garden, and send down upon your garden a thunderbolt from the sky, turning it into a barren waste.

text_simple: او يصبح ماؤها غورا فلن تستطيع له طلبا
translation_en_yusufali: Or its water may sink ˹into the earth˺, and then you will never be able to seek it out.”

text_simple: واحيط بثمره فاصبح يقلب كفيه على ما انفق فيها وهي خاوية على عروشها ويقول يا ليتني لم اشرك بربي احدا
translation_en_yusufali: And so all his produce was ˹totally˺ ruined, so he started to wring his hands for all he had spent on it, while it had collapsed on its trellises. He cried, “Alas! I wish I had never associated anyone with my Lord ˹in worship˺!”

text_simple: ولم تكن له فئة ينصرونه من دون الله وما كان منتصرا
translation_en_yusufali: And he had no manpower to help him against Allah, nor could he ˹even˺ help himself.

text_simple: هنالك الولاية لله الحق هو خير ثوابا وخير عقبا
translation_en_yusufali: At this time, support comes ˹only˺ from Allah—the True ˹Lord˺. He is best in reward and best in outcome.

text_simple: واضرب لهم مثل الحياة الدنيا كماء انزلناه من السماء فاختلط به نبات الارض فاصبح هشيما تذروه الرياح وكان الله على كل شيء مقتدرا
translation_en_yusufali: And give them a parable of this worldly life. ˹It is˺ like the plants of the earth, thriving when sustained by the rain We send down from the sky. Then they ˹soon˺ turn into chaff scattered by the wind. And Allah is fully capable of ˹doing˺ all things.

text_simple: المال والبنون زينة الحياة الدنيا والباقيات الصالحات خير عند ربك ثوابا وخير املا
translation_en_yusufali: Wealth and children are the adornment of this worldly life, but the everlasting good deeds are far better with your Lord in reward and in hope.

text_simple: ويوم نسير الجبال وترى الارض بارزة وحشرناهم فلم نغادر منهم احدا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Beware of˺ the Day We will blow the mountains away, and you will see the earth laid bare. And We will gather all ˹humankind˺, leaving none behind.

text_simple: وعرضوا على ربك صفا لقد جئتمونا كما خلقناكم اول مرة بل زعمتم الن نجعل لكم موعدا
translation_en_yusufali: They will be presented before your Lord in rows, ˹and the deniers will be told,˺ “You have surely returned to Us ˹all alone˺ as We created you the first time, although you ˹always˺ claimed that We would never appoint a time for your return.”

text_simple: ووضع الكتاب فترى المجرمين مشفقين مما فيه ويقولون يا ويلتنا مال هذا الكتاب لا يغادر صغيرة ولا كبيرة الا احصاها ووجدوا ما عملوا حاضرا ولا يظلم ربك احدا
translation_en_yusufali: And the record ˹of deeds˺ will be laid ˹open˺, and you will see the wicked in fear of what is ˹written˺ in it. They will cry, “Woe to us! What kind of record is this that does not leave any sin, small or large, unlisted?” They will find whatever they did present ˹before them˺. And your Lord will never wrong anyone.

text_simple: واذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لادم فسجدوا الا ابليس كان من الجن ففسق عن امر ربه افتتخذونه وذريته اولياء من دوني وهم لكم عدو بئس للظالمين بدلا
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs, who was one of the jinn, but he rebelled against the command of his Lord. Would you then take him and his descendants as patrons instead of Me, although they are your enemy? What an evil alternative for the wrongdoers ˹to choose˺!

text_simple: ما اشهدتهم خلق السماوات والارض ولا خلق انفسهم وما كنت متخذ المضلين عضدا
translation_en_yusufali: I never called them to witness the creation of the heavens and the earth or ˹even˺ their own creation, nor would I take the misleaders as helpers.

text_simple: ويوم يقول نادوا شركائي الذين زعمتم فدعوهم فلم يستجيبوا لهم وجعلنا بينهم موبقا
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹beware of˺ the Day He will say, “Call upon those you claimed were My associate-gods.” So they will call them, but will receive no response. And We will make them ˹all˺ share in the same doom.

text_simple: وراى المجرمون النار فظنوا انهم مواقعوها ولم يجدوا عنها مصرفا
translation_en_yusufali: The wicked will see the Fire and realize that they are bound to fall into it, and will find no way to avoid it.

text_simple: ولقد صرفنا في هذا القران للناس من كل مثل وكان الانسان اكثر شيء جدلا
translation_en_yusufali: We have surely set forth in this Quran every ˹kind of˺ lesson for people, but humankind is the most argumentative of all beings.

text_simple: وما منع الناس ان يؤمنوا اذ جاءهم الهدى ويستغفروا ربهم الا ان تاتيهم سنة الاولين او ياتيهم العذاب قبلا
translation_en_yusufali: And nothing prevents people from believing when guidance comes to them and from seeking their Lord’s forgiveness except ˹their demand˺ to meet the same fate of earlier deniers or that the torment would confront them face to face.

text_simple: وما نرسل المرسلين الا مبشرين ومنذرين ويجادل الذين كفروا بالباطل ليدحضوا به الحق واتخذوا اياتي وما انذروا هزوا
translation_en_yusufali: We do not send the messengers except as deliverers of good news and warners. But the disbelievers argue in falsehood, ˹hoping˺ to discredit the truth with it, and make a mockery of My revelations and warnings.

text_simple: ومن اظلم ممن ذكر بايات ربه فاعرض عنها ونسي ما قدمت يداه انا جعلنا على قلوبهم اكنة ان يفقهوه وفي اذانهم وقرا وان تدعهم الى الهدى فلن يهتدوا اذا ابدا
translation_en_yusufali: And who does more wrong than those who, when reminded of their Lord’s revelations, turn away from them and forget what their own hands have done? We have certainly cast veils over their hearts—leaving them unable to comprehend this ˹Quran˺—and deafness in their ears. And if you ˹O Prophet˺ invite them to ˹true˺ guidance, they will never be ˹rightly˺ guided.

text_simple: وربك الغفور ذو الرحمة لو يؤاخذهم بما كسبوا لعجل لهم العذاب بل لهم موعد لن يجدوا من دونه موئلا
translation_en_yusufali: Your Lord is the All-Forgiving, Full of Mercy. If He were to seize them ˹immediately˺ for what they commit, He would have certainly hastened their punishment. But they have an appointed time, from which they will find no refuge.

text_simple: وتلك القرى اهلكناهم لما ظلموا وجعلنا لمهلكهم موعدا
translation_en_yusufali: Those ˹are the˺ societies We destroyed when they persisted in wrong, and We had set a time for their destruction.

text_simple: واذ قال موسى لفتاه لا ابرح حتى ابلغ مجمع البحرين او امضي حقبا
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when Moses said to his young assistant, “I will never give up until I reach the junction of the two seas, even if I travel for ages.”

text_simple: فلما بلغا مجمع بينهما نسيا حوتهما فاتخذ سبيله في البحر سربا
translation_en_yusufali: But when they ˹finally˺ reached the point where the seas met, they forgot their ˹salted˺ fish, and it made its way into the sea, slipping away ˹wondrously˺.

text_simple: فلما جاوزا قال لفتاه اتنا غداءنا لقد لقينا من سفرنا هذا نصبا
translation_en_yusufali: When they had passed further, he said to his assistant, “Bring us our meal! We have certainly been exhausted by today’s journey.”

text_simple: قال ارايت اذ اوينا الى الصخرة فاني نسيت الحوت وما انسانيه الا الشيطان ان اذكره واتخذ سبيله في البحر عجبا
translation_en_yusufali: He replied, “Do you remember when we rested by the rock? ˹That is when˺ I forgot the fish. None made me forget to mention this except Satan. And the fish made its way into the sea miraculously.”

text_simple: قال ذلك ما كنا نبغ فارتدا على اثارهما قصصا
translation_en_yusufali: Moses responded, “That is ˹exactly˺ what we were looking for.” So they returned, retracing their footsteps.

text_simple: فوجدا عبدا من عبادنا اتيناه رحمة من عندنا وعلمناه من لدنا علما
translation_en_yusufali: There they found a servant of Ours, to whom We had granted mercy from Us and enlightened with knowledge of Our Own.

text_simple: قال له موسى هل اتبعك على ان تعلمن مما علمت رشدا
translation_en_yusufali: Moses said to him, “May I follow you, provided that you teach me some of the right guidance you have been taught?”

text_simple: قال انك لن تستطيع معي صبرا
translation_en_yusufali: He said, “You certainly cannot be patient ˹enough˺ with me.

text_simple: وكيف تصبر على ما لم تحط به خبرا
translation_en_yusufali: And how can you be patient with what is beyond your ˹realm of˺ knowledge?”

text_simple: قال ستجدني ان شاء الله صابرا ولا اعصي لك امرا
translation_en_yusufali: Moses assured ˹him˺, “You will find me patient, Allah willing, and I will not disobey any of your orders.”

text_simple: قال فان اتبعتني فلا تسالني عن شيء حتى احدث لك منه ذكرا
translation_en_yusufali: He responded, “Then if you follow me, do not question me about anything until I ˹myself˺ clarify it for you.”

text_simple: فانطلقا حتى اذا ركبا في السفينة خرقها قال اخرقتها لتغرق اهلها لقد جئت شيئا امرا
translation_en_yusufali: So they set out, but after they had boarded a ship, the man made a hole in it. Moses protested, “Have you done this to drown its people? You have certainly done a terrible thing!”

text_simple: قال الم اقل انك لن تستطيع معي صبرا
translation_en_yusufali: He replied, “Did I not say that you cannot have patience with me?”

text_simple: قال لا تؤاخذني بما نسيت ولا ترهقني من امري عسرا
translation_en_yusufali: Moses pleaded, “Excuse me for forgetting, and do not be hard on me.”

text_simple: فانطلقا حتى اذا لقيا غلاما فقتله قال اقتلت نفسا زكية بغير نفس لقد جئت شيئا نكرا
translation_en_yusufali: So they proceeded until they came across a boy, and the man killed him. Moses protested, “Have you killed an innocent soul, who killed no one? You have certainly done a horrible thing.”

text_simple: قال الم اقل لك انك لن تستطيع معي صبرا
translation_en_yusufali: He answered, “Did I not tell you that you cannot have patience with me?”

text_simple: قال ان سالتك عن شيء بعدها فلا تصاحبني قد بلغت من لدني عذرا
translation_en_yusufali: Moses replied, “If I ever question you about anything after this, then do not keep me in your company, for by then I would have given you enough of an excuse.”

text_simple: فانطلقا حتى اذا اتيا اهل قرية استطعما اهلها فابوا ان يضيفوهما فوجدا فيها جدارا يريد ان ينقض فاقامه قال لو شئت لاتخذت عليه اجرا
translation_en_yusufali: So they moved on until they came to the people of a town. They asked them for food, but the people refused to give them hospitality. There they found a wall ready to collapse, so the man set it right. Moses protested, “If you wanted, you could have demanded a fee for this.”

text_simple: قال هذا فراق بيني وبينك سانبئك بتاويل ما لم تستطع عليه صبرا
translation_en_yusufali: He replied, “This is the parting of our ways. I will explain to you what you could not bear patiently.

text_simple: اما السفينة فكانت لمساكين يعملون في البحر فاردت ان اعيبها وكان وراءهم ملك ياخذ كل سفينة غصبا
translation_en_yusufali: “As for the ship, it belonged to some poor people, working at sea. So I intended to damage it, for there was a ˹tyrant˺ king ahead of them who seizes every ˹good˺ ship by force.

text_simple: واما الغلام فكان ابواه مؤمنين فخشينا ان يرهقهما طغيانا وكفرا
translation_en_yusufali: “And as for the boy, his parents were ˹true˺ believers, and we feared that he would pressure them into defiance and disbelief.

text_simple: فاردنا ان يبدلهما ربهما خيرا منه زكاة واقرب رحما
translation_en_yusufali: So we hoped that their Lord would give them another, more virtuous and caring in his place.

text_simple: واما الجدار فكان لغلامين يتيمين في المدينة وكان تحته كنز لهما وكان ابوهما صالحا فاراد ربك ان يبلغا اشدهما ويستخرجا كنزهما رحمة من ربك وما فعلته عن امري ذلك تاويل ما لم تسطع عليه صبرا
translation_en_yusufali: “And as for the wall, it belonged to two orphan boys in the city, and under the wall was a treasure that belonged to them, and their father had been a righteous man. So your Lord willed that these children should come of age and retrieve their treasure, as a mercy from your Lord. I did not do it ˹all˺ on my own. This is the explanation of what you could not bear patiently.”

text_simple: ويسالونك عن ذي القرنين قل ساتلو عليكم منه ذكرا
translation_en_yusufali: They ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about Ⱬul-Qarnain. Say, “I will relate to you something of his narrative.”

text_simple: انا مكنا له في الارض واتيناه من كل شيء سببا
translation_en_yusufali: Surely We established him in the land, and gave him the means to all things.

text_simple: فاتبع سببا
translation_en_yusufali: So he travelled a course

text_simple: حتى اذا بلغ مغرب الشمس وجدها تغرب في عين حمئة ووجد عندها قوما قلنا يا ذا القرنين اما ان تعذب واما ان تتخذ فيهم حسنا
translation_en_yusufali: until he reached the setting ˹point˺ of the sun, which appeared to him to be setting in a spring of murky water, where he found some people. We said, “O Ⱬul-Qarnain! Either punish them or treat them kindly.”

text_simple: قال اما من ظلم فسوف نعذبه ثم يرد الى ربه فيعذبه عذابا نكرا
translation_en_yusufali: He responded, “Whoever does wrong will be punished by us, then will be returned to their Lord, Who will punish them with a horrible torment.

text_simple: واما من امن وعمل صالحا فله جزاء الحسنى وسنقول له من امرنا يسرا
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who believe and do good, they will have the finest reward, and we will assign them easy commands.”

text_simple: ثم اتبع سببا
translation_en_yusufali: Then he travelled a ˹different˺ course

text_simple: حتى اذا بلغ مطلع الشمس وجدها تطلع على قوم لم نجعل لهم من دونها سترا
translation_en_yusufali: until he reached the rising ˹point˺ of the sun. He found it rising on a people for whom We had provided no shelter from it.

text_simple: كذلك وقد احطنا بما لديه خبرا
translation_en_yusufali: So it was. And We truly had full knowledge of him.

text_simple: ثم اتبع سببا
translation_en_yusufali: Then he travelled a ˹third˺ course

text_simple: حتى اذا بلغ بين السدين وجد من دونهما قوما لا يكادون يفقهون قولا
translation_en_yusufali: until he reached ˹a pass˺ between two mountains. He found in front of them a people who could hardly understand ˹his˺ language.

text_simple: قالوا يا ذا القرنين ان ياجوج وماجوج مفسدون في الارض فهل نجعل لك خرجا على ان تجعل بيننا وبينهم سدا
translation_en_yusufali: They pleaded, “O Ⱬul-Qarnain! Surely Gog and Magog are spreading corruption throughout the land. Should we pay you tribute, provided that you build a wall between us and them?”

text_simple: قال ما مكني فيه ربي خير فاعينوني بقوة اجعل بينكم وبينهم ردما
translation_en_yusufali: He responded, “What my Lord has provided for me is far better. But assist me with resources, and I will build a barrier between you and them.

text_simple: اتوني زبر الحديد حتى اذا ساوى بين الصدفين قال انفخوا حتى اذا جعله نارا قال اتوني افرغ عليه قطرا
translation_en_yusufali: Bring me blocks of iron!” Then, when he had filled up ˹the gap˺ between the two mountains, he ordered, “Blow!” When the iron became red hot, he said, “Bring me molten copper to pour over it.”

text_simple: فما اسطاعوا ان يظهروه وما استطاعوا له نقبا
translation_en_yusufali: And so the enemies could neither scale nor tunnel through it.

text_simple: قال هذا رحمة من ربي فاذا جاء وعد ربي جعله دكاء وكان وعد ربي حقا
translation_en_yusufali: He declared, “This is a mercy from my Lord. But when the promise of my Lord comes to pass, He will level it to the ground. And my Lord’s promise is ever true.”

text_simple: وتركنا بعضهم يومئذ يموج في بعض ونفخ في الصور فجمعناهم جمعا
translation_en_yusufali: On that Day, We will let them surge ˹like waves˺ over one another. Later, the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather all ˹people˺ together.

text_simple: وعرضنا جهنم يومئذ للكافرين عرضا
translation_en_yusufali: On that Day We will display Hell clearly for the disbelievers

text_simple: الذين كانت اعينهم في غطاء عن ذكري وكانوا لا يستطيعون سمعا
translation_en_yusufali: those who turned a blind eye to My Reminder and could not stand listening ˹to it˺.

text_simple: افحسب الذين كفروا ان يتخذوا عبادي من دوني اولياء انا اعتدنا جهنم للكافرين نزلا
translation_en_yusufali: Do the disbelievers think they can ˹simply˺ take My servants as lords instead of Me? We have surely prepared Hell as an accommodation for the disbelievers.

text_simple: قل هل ننبئكم بالاخسرين اعمالا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Shall we inform you of who will lose the most deeds?

text_simple: الذين ضل سعيهم في الحياة الدنيا وهم يحسبون انهم يحسنون صنعا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹They are˺ those whose efforts are in vain in this worldly life, while they think they are doing good!”

text_simple: اولئك الذين كفروا بايات ربهم ولقائه فحبطت اعمالهم فلا نقيم لهم يوم القيامة وزنا
translation_en_yusufali: It is they who reject the signs of their Lord and their meeting with Him, rendering their deeds void, so We will not give their deeds any weight on Judgment Day.

text_simple: ذلك جزاؤهم جهنم بما كفروا واتخذوا اياتي ورسلي هزوا
translation_en_yusufali: That is their reward: Hell, for their disbelief and mockery of My signs and messengers.

text_simple: ان الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات كانت لهم جنات الفردوس نزلا
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, those who believe and do good will have the Gardens of Paradise as an accommodation

text_simple: خالدين فيها لا يبغون عنها حولا
translation_en_yusufali: where they will be forever, never desiring anywhere else.

text_simple: قل لو كان البحر مدادا لكلمات ربي لنفد البحر قبل ان تنفد كلمات ربي ولو جئنا بمثله مددا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “If the ocean were ink for ˹writing˺ the Words of my Lord, it would certainly run out before the Words of my Lord were finished, even if We refilled it with its equal.”

text_simple: قل انما انا بشر مثلكم يوحى الي انما الهكم اله واحد فمن كان يرجو لقاء ربه فليعمل عملا صالحا ولا يشرك بعبادة ربه احدا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a man like you, ˹but˺ it has been revealed to me that your God is only One God. So whoever hopes for the meeting with their Lord, let them do good deeds and associate none in the worship of their Lord.”

text_simple: كهيعص
translation_en_yusufali: Kãf-Ha-Ya-’Aĩn- Ṣãd.

text_simple: ذكر رحمت ربك عبده زكريا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹This is˺ a reminder of your Lord’s mercy to His servant Zachariah

text_simple: اذ نادى ربه نداء خفيا
translation_en_yusufali: when he cried out to his Lord privately

text_simple: قال رب اني وهن العظم مني واشتعل الراس شيبا ولم اكن بدعائك رب شقيا
translation_en_yusufali: saying, “My Lord! Surely my bones have become brittle, and grey hair has spread across my head, but I have never been disappointed in my prayer to You, my Lord!

text_simple: واني خفت الموالي من ورائي وكانت امراتي عاقرا فهب لي من لدنك وليا
translation_en_yusufali: And I am concerned about ˹the faith of˺ my relatives after me, since my wife is barren. So grant me, by Your grace, an heir

text_simple: يرثني ويرث من ال يعقوب واجعله رب رضيا
translation_en_yusufali: who will inherit ˹prophethood˺ from me and the family of Jacob, and make him, O  Lord, pleasing ˹to You˺!”

text_simple: يا زكريا انا نبشرك بغلام اسمه يحيى لم نجعل له من قبل سميا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹The angels announced,˺ “O Zachariah! Indeed, We give you the good news of ˹the birth of˺ a son, whose name will be John—a name We have not given to anyone before.”

text_simple: قال رب انى يكون لي غلام وكانت امراتي عاقرا وقد بلغت من الكبر عتيا
translation_en_yusufali: He wondered, “My Lord! How can I have a son when my wife is barren, and I have become extremely old?”

text_simple: قال كذلك قال ربك هو علي هين وقد خلقتك من قبل ولم تك شيئا
translation_en_yusufali: An angel replied, “So will it be! Your Lord says, ‘It is easy for Me, just as I created you before, when you were nothing!’”

text_simple: قال رب اجعل لي اية قال ايتك الا تكلم الناس ثلاث ليال سويا
translation_en_yusufali: Zachariah said, “My Lord! Grant me a sign.” He responded, “Your sign is that you will not ˹be able to˺ speak to people for three nights, despite being healthy.”

text_simple: فخرج على قومه من المحراب فاوحى اليهم ان سبحوا بكرة وعشيا
translation_en_yusufali: So he came out to his people from the sanctuary, signalling to them to glorify ˹Allah˺ morning and evening.

text_simple: يا يحيى خذ الكتاب بقوة واتيناه الحكم صبيا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹It was later said,˺ “O John! Hold firmly to the Scriptures.” And We granted him wisdom while ˹he was still˺ a child

text_simple: وحنانا من لدنا وزكاة وكان تقيا
translation_en_yusufali: as well as purity and compassion from Us. And he was God-fearing

text_simple: وبرا بوالديه ولم يكن جبارا عصيا
translation_en_yusufali: and kind to his parents. He was neither arrogant nor disobedient.

text_simple: وسلام عليه يوم ولد ويوم يموت ويوم يبعث حيا
translation_en_yusufali: Peace be upon him the day he was born, and the day of his death, and the day he will be raised back to life!

text_simple: واذكر في الكتاب مريم اذ انتبذت من اهلها مكانا شرقيا
translation_en_yusufali: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Mary when she withdrew from her family to a place in the east

text_simple: فاتخذت من دونهم حجابا فارسلنا اليها روحنا فتمثل لها بشرا سويا
translation_en_yusufali: screening herself off from them. Then We sent to her Our angel, ˹Gabriel,˺ appearing before her as a man, perfectly formed.

text_simple: قالت اني اعوذ بالرحمن منك ان كنت تقيا
translation_en_yusufali: She appealed, “I truly seek refuge in the Most Compassionate from you! ˹So leave me alone˺ if you are God-fearing.”

text_simple: قال انما انا رسول ربك لاهب لك غلاما زكيا
translation_en_yusufali: He responded, “I am only a messenger from your Lord, ˹sent˺ to bless you with a pure son.”

text_simple: قالت انى يكون لي غلام ولم يمسسني بشر ولم اك بغيا
translation_en_yusufali: She wondered, “How can I have a son when no man has ever touched me, nor am I unchaste?”

text_simple: قال كذلك قال ربك هو علي هين ولنجعله اية للناس ورحمة منا وكان امرا مقضيا
translation_en_yusufali: He replied, “So will it be! Your Lord says, ‘It is easy for Me. And so will We make him a sign for humanity and a mercy from Us.’ It is a matter ˹already˺ decreed.”

text_simple: فحملته فانتبذت به مكانا قصيا
translation_en_yusufali: So she conceived him and withdrew with him to a remote place.

text_simple: فاجاءها المخاض الى جذع النخلة قالت يا ليتني مت قبل هذا وكنت نسيا منسيا
translation_en_yusufali: Then the pains of labour drove her to the trunk of a palm tree. She cried, “Alas! I wish I had died before this, and was a thing long forgotten!”

text_simple: فناداها من تحتها الا تحزني قد جعل ربك تحتك سريا
translation_en_yusufali: So a voice reassured her from below her, “Do not grieve! Your Lord has provided a stream at your feet.

text_simple: وهزي اليك بجذع النخلة تساقط عليك رطبا جنيا
translation_en_yusufali: And shake the trunk of this palm tree towards you, it will drop fresh, ripe dates upon you.

text_simple: فكلي واشربي وقري عينا فاما ترين من البشر احدا فقولي اني نذرت للرحمن صوما فلن اكلم اليوم انسيا
translation_en_yusufali: So eat and drink, and put your heart at ease. But if you see any of the people, say, ‘I have vowed silence to the Most Compassionate, so I am not talking to anyone today.’”

text_simple: فاتت به قومها تحمله قالوا يا مريم لقد جئت شيئا فريا
translation_en_yusufali: Then she returned to her people, carrying him. They said ˹in shock˺, “O Mary! You have certainly done a horrible thing!

text_simple: يا اخت هارون ما كان ابوك امرا سوء وما كانت امك بغيا
translation_en_yusufali: O  sister of Aaron! Your father was not an indecent man, nor was your mother unchaste.”

text_simple: فاشارت اليه قالوا كيف نكلم من كان في المهد صبيا
translation_en_yusufali: So she pointed to the baby. They exclaimed, “How can we talk to someone who is an infant in the cradle?”

text_simple: قال اني عبد الله اتاني الكتاب وجعلني نبيا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Jesus˺ declared, “I am truly a servant of Allah. He has destined me to be given the Scripture and to be a prophet.

text_simple: وجعلني مباركا اين ما كنت واوصاني بالصلاة والزكاة ما دمت حيا
translation_en_yusufali: He has made me a blessing wherever I go, and bid me to establish prayer and give alms-tax as long as I live

text_simple: وبرا بوالدتي ولم يجعلني جبارا شقيا
translation_en_yusufali: and to be kind to my mother. He has not made me arrogant or defiant.

text_simple: والسلام علي يوم ولدت ويوم اموت ويوم ابعث حيا
translation_en_yusufali: Peace be upon me the day I was born, the day I die, and the day I will be raised back to life!”

text_simple: ذلك عيسى ابن مريم قول الحق الذي فيه يمترون
translation_en_yusufali: That is Jesus, son of Mary. ˹And this is˺ a word of truth, about which they dispute.

text_simple: ما كان لله ان يتخذ من ولد سبحانه اذا قضى امرا فانما يقول له كن فيكون
translation_en_yusufali: It is not for Allah to take a son! Glory be to Him. When He decrees a matter, He simply tells it, “Be!” And it is!

text_simple: وان الله ربي وربكم فاعبدوه هذا صراط مستقيم
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Jesus also declared,˺ “Surely Allah is my Lord and your Lord, so worship Him ˹alone˺. This is the Straight Path.”

text_simple: فاختلف الاحزاب من بينهم فويل للذين كفروا من مشهد يوم عظيم
translation_en_yusufali: Yet their ˹various˺ groups have differed among themselves ˹about him˺, so woe to the disbelievers when they face a tremendous Day!

text_simple: اسمع بهم وابصر يوم ياتوننا لكن الظالمون اليوم في ضلال مبين
translation_en_yusufali: How clearly will they hear and see on the Day they will come to Us! But today the wrongdoers are clearly astray.

text_simple: وانذرهم يوم الحسرة اذ قضي الامر وهم في غفلة وهم لا يؤمنون
translation_en_yusufali: And warn them ˹O Prophet˺ of the Day of Regret, when all matters will be settled, while they are ˹engrossed˺ in heedlessness and disbelief.

text_simple: انا نحن نرث الارض ومن عليها والينا يرجعون
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, it is We Who will succeed the earth and whoever is on it. And to Us they will ˹all˺ be returned.

text_simple: واذكر في الكتاب ابراهيم انه كان صديقا نبيا
translation_en_yusufali: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Abraham. He was surely a man of truth and a prophet.

text_simple: اذ قال لابيه يا ابت لم تعبد ما لا يسمع ولا يبصر ولا يغني عنك شيئا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Remember˺ when he said to his father, “O dear father! Why do you worship what can neither hear nor see, nor benefit you at all?

text_simple: يا ابت اني قد جاءني من العلم ما لم ياتك فاتبعني اهدك صراطا سويا
translation_en_yusufali: O  dear father! I have certainly received some knowledge which you have not received, so follow me and I will guide you to the Straight Path.

text_simple: يا ابت لا تعبد الشيطان ان الشيطان كان للرحمن عصيا
translation_en_yusufali: O  dear father! Do not worship Satan. Surely Satan is ever rebellious against the Most Compassionate.

text_simple: يا ابت اني اخاف ان يمسك عذاب من الرحمن فتكون للشيطان وليا
translation_en_yusufali: O  dear father! I truly fear that you will be touched by a torment from the Most Compassionate, and become Satan’s companion ˹in Hell˺.”

text_simple: قال اراغب انت عن الهتي يا ابراهيم لئن لم تنته لارجمنك واهجرني مليا
translation_en_yusufali: He threatened, “How dare you reject my idols, O  Abraham! If you do not desist, I will certainly stone you ˹to death˺. So be gone from me for a long time!”

text_simple: قال سلام عليك ساستغفر لك ربي انه كان بي حفيا
translation_en_yusufali: Abraham responded, “Peace be upon you! I will pray to my Lord for your forgiveness. He has truly been Most Gracious to me.

text_simple: واعتزلكم وما تدعون من دون الله وادعو ربي عسى الا اكون بدعاء ربي شقيا
translation_en_yusufali: As I distance myself from ˹all of˺ you and from whatever you invoke besides Allah, I will ˹continue to˺ call upon my Lord ˹alone˺, trusting that I will never be disappointed in invoking my Lord.”

text_simple: فلما اعتزلهم وما يعبدون من دون الله وهبنا له اسحاق ويعقوب وكلا جعلنا نبيا
translation_en_yusufali: So after he had left them and what they worshipped besides Allah, We granted him Isaac and Jacob, and made each of them a prophet.

text_simple: ووهبنا لهم من رحمتنا وجعلنا لهم لسان صدق عليا
translation_en_yusufali: We showered them with Our mercy, and blessed them with honourable mention.

text_simple: واذكر في الكتاب موسى انه كان مخلصا وكان رسولا نبيا
translation_en_yusufali: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Moses. He was truly a chosen man, and was a messenger and a prophet.

text_simple: وناديناه من جانب الطور الايمن وقربناه نجيا
translation_en_yusufali: We called him from the right side of Mount Ṭûr, and drew him near, speaking ˹with him˺ directly.

text_simple: ووهبنا له من رحمتنا اخاه هارون نبيا
translation_en_yusufali: And We appointed for him—out of Our grace—his brother, Aaron, as a prophet.

text_simple: واذكر في الكتاب اسماعيل انه كان صادق الوعد وكان رسولا نبيا
translation_en_yusufali: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Ishmael. He was truly a man of his word, and was a messenger and a prophet.

text_simple: وكان يامر اهله بالصلاة والزكاة وكان عند ربه مرضيا
translation_en_yusufali: He used to urge his people to pray and give alms-tax. And his Lord was well pleased with him.

text_simple: واذكر في الكتاب ادريس انه كان صديقا نبيا
translation_en_yusufali: And mention in the Book ˹O Prophet, the story of˺ Enoch. He was surely a man of truth and a prophet.

text_simple: ورفعناه مكانا عليا
translation_en_yusufali: And We elevated him to an honourable status.

text_simple: اولئك الذين انعم الله عليهم من النبيين من ذرية ادم وممن حملنا مع نوح ومن ذرية ابراهيم واسرائيل وممن هدينا واجتبينا اذا تتلى عليهم ايات الرحمن خروا سجدا وبكيا
