translation_en_yusufali: Those were ˹some of˺ the prophets who Allah has blessed from among the descendants of Adam, and of those We carried with Noah ˹in the Ark˺, and of the descendants of Abraham and Israel, and of those We ˹rightly˺ guided and chose. Whenever the revelations of the Most Compassionate were recited to them, they fell down, prostrating and weeping.

text_simple: فخلف من بعدهم خلف اضاعوا الصلاة واتبعوا الشهوات فسوف يلقون غيا
translation_en_yusufali: But they were succeeded by generations who neglected prayer and followed their lusts and so will soon face the evil consequences.

text_simple: الا من تاب وامن وعمل صالحا فاولئك يدخلون الجنة ولا يظلمون شيئا
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who repent, believe, and do good, it is they who will be admitted into Paradise, never being denied any reward.

text_simple: جنات عدن التي وعد الرحمن عباده بالغيب انه كان وعده ماتيا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹They will be in˺ the Gardens of Eternity, promised in trust by the Most Compassionate to His servants. Surely His promise will be fulfilled.

text_simple: لا يسمعون فيها لغوا الا سلاما ولهم رزقهم فيها بكرة وعشيا
translation_en_yusufali: There they will never hear any idle talk—only ˹greetings of˺ peace. And there they will have their provisions morning and evening.

text_simple: تلك الجنة التي نورث من عبادنا من كان تقيا
translation_en_yusufali: That is Paradise, which We will grant to whoever is devout among Our servants.

text_simple: وما نتنزل الا بامر ربك له ما بين ايدينا وما خلفنا وما بين ذلك وما كان ربك نسيا
translation_en_yusufali: “We only descend by the command of your Lord. To Him belongs whatever is before us, and whatever is behind us, and everything in between. And your Lord is never forgetful.

text_simple: رب السماوات والارض وما بينهما فاعبده واصطبر لعبادته هل تعلم له سميا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹He is the˺ Lord of the heavens, and the earth, and everything in between. So worship Him ˹alone˺, and be steadfast in His worship. Do you know of anyone equal to Him ˹in His attributes˺?”

text_simple: ويقول الانسان ااذا ما مت لسوف اخرج حيا
translation_en_yusufali: Yet ˹some˺ people ask ˹mockingly˺, “After I die, will I really be raised to life again?”

text_simple: اولا يذكر الانسان انا خلقناه من قبل ولم يك شيئا
translation_en_yusufali: Do ˹such˺ people not remember that We created them before, when they were nothing?

text_simple: فوربك لنحشرنهم والشياطين ثم لنحضرنهم حول جهنم جثيا
translation_en_yusufali: By your Lord ˹O Prophet˺! We will surely gather them along with the devils, and then set them around Hell on their knees.

text_simple: ثم لننزعن من كل شيعة ايهم اشد على الرحمن عتيا
translation_en_yusufali: Then We will certainly begin by dragging out of every group the ones most defiant to the Most Compassionate.

text_simple: ثم لنحن اعلم بالذين هم اولى بها صليا
translation_en_yusufali: And We truly know best who is most deserving of burning in it.

text_simple: وان منكم الا واردها كان على ربك حتما مقضيا
translation_en_yusufali: There is none of you who will not pass over it. ˹This is˺ a decree your Lord must fulfil.

text_simple: ثم ننجي الذين اتقوا ونذر الظالمين فيها جثيا
translation_en_yusufali: Then We will deliver those who were devout, leaving the wrongdoers there on their knees.

text_simple: واذا تتلى عليهم اياتنا بينات قال الذين كفروا للذين امنوا اي الفريقين خير مقاما واحسن نديا
translation_en_yusufali: When Our clear revelations are recited to them, the disbelievers ask the believers ˹mockingly˺, “Which of the two of us is better in status and superior in assembly?”

text_simple: وكم اهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هم احسن اثاثا ورئيا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Imagine, O  Prophet˺ how many peoples We have destroyed before them, who were far better in luxury and splendour!

text_simple: قل من كان في الضلالة فليمدد له الرحمن مدا حتى اذا راوا ما يوعدون اما العذاب واما الساعة فسيعلمون من هو شر مكانا واضعف جندا
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Whoever is ˹entrenched˺ in misguidance, the Most Compassionate will allow them plenty of time, until—behold!—they face what they are threatened with: either the torment or the Hour. Only then will they realize who is worse in position and inferior in manpower.”

text_simple: ويزيد الله الذين اهتدوا هدى والباقيات الصالحات خير عند ربك ثوابا وخير مردا
translation_en_yusufali: And Allah increases in guidance those who are ˹rightly˺ guided. And the everlasting good deeds are far better with your Lord in reward and in outcome.

text_simple: افرايت الذي كفر باياتنا وقال لاوتين مالا وولدا
translation_en_yusufali: Have you seen ˹O Prophet˺ the one who rejects Our revelations yet boasts, “I will definitely be granted ˹plenty of˺ wealth and children ˹if there is an afterlife˺.”?

text_simple: اطلع الغيب ام اتخذ عند الرحمن عهدا
translation_en_yusufali: Has he looked into the unseen or taken a pledge from the Most Compassionate?

text_simple: كلا سنكتب ما يقول ونمد له من العذاب مدا
translation_en_yusufali: Not at all! We certainly record whatever he claims and will increase his punishment extensively.

text_simple: ونرثه ما يقول وياتينا فردا
translation_en_yusufali: And We will inherit what he boasts of, and he will come before Us all by himself.

text_simple: واتخذوا من دون الله الهة ليكونوا لهم عزا
translation_en_yusufali: They have taken other gods, instead of Allah, seeking strength ˹and protection˺ through them.

text_simple: كلا سيكفرون بعبادتهم ويكونون عليهم ضدا
translation_en_yusufali: But no! Those ˹gods˺ will deny their worship and turn against them.

text_simple: الم تر انا ارسلنا الشياطين على الكافرين تؤزهم ازا
translation_en_yusufali: Do you ˹O Prophet˺ not see that We have sent the devils against the disbelievers, constantly inciting them?

text_simple: فلا تعجل عليهم انما نعد لهم عدا
translation_en_yusufali: So do not be in haste against them, for indeed We are ˹closely˺ counting down their days.

text_simple: يوم نحشر المتقين الى الرحمن وفدا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Watch for˺ the Day We will gather the righteous before the Most Compassionate as an honoured delegation

text_simple: ونسوق المجرمين الى جهنم وردا
translation_en_yusufali: and drive the wicked to Hell like a thirsty herd.

text_simple: لا يملكون الشفاعة الا من اتخذ عند الرحمن عهدا
translation_en_yusufali: None will have the right to intercede, except those who have taken a covenant from the Most Compassionate.

text_simple: وقالوا اتخذ الرحمن ولدا
translation_en_yusufali: They say, “The Most Compassionate has offspring.”

text_simple: لقد جئتم شيئا ادا
translation_en_yusufali: You have certainly made an outrageous claim

text_simple: تكاد السماوات يتفطرن منه وتنشق الارض وتخر الجبال هدا
translation_en_yusufali: by which the heavens are about to burst, the earth to split apart, and the mountains to crumble to pieces

text_simple: ان دعوا للرحمن ولدا
translation_en_yusufali: in protest of attributing children to the Most Compassionate.

text_simple: وما ينبغي للرحمن ان يتخذ ولدا
translation_en_yusufali: It does not befit ˹the majesty of˺ the Most Compassionate to have children.

text_simple: ان كل من في السماوات والارض الا اتي الرحمن عبدا
translation_en_yusufali: There is none in the heavens or the earth who will not return to the Most Compassionate in full submission.

text_simple: لقد احصاهم وعدهم عدا
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, He fully knows them and has counted them precisely.

text_simple: وكلهم اتيه يوم القيامة فردا
translation_en_yusufali: And each of them will return to Him on the Day of Judgment all alone.

text_simple: ان الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات سيجعل لهم الرحمن ودا
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who believe and do good, the Most Compassionate will ˹certainly˺ bless them with ˹genuine˺ love.

text_simple: فانما يسرناه بلسانك لتبشر به المتقين وتنذر به قوما لدا
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, We have made this ˹Quran˺ easy in your own language ˹O Prophet˺ so with it you may give good news to the righteous and warn those who are contentious.

text_simple: وكم اهلكنا قبلهم من قرن هل تحس منهم من احد او تسمع لهم ركزا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Imagine˺ how many peoples We have destroyed before them! Do you ˹still˺ see any of them, or ˹even˺ hear from them the slightest sound?

text_simple: طه
translation_en_yusufali: Ṭâ-Hâ.

text_simple: ما انزلنا عليك القران لتشقى
translation_en_yusufali: We have not revealed the Quran to you ˹O Prophet˺ to cause you distress

text_simple: الا تذكرة لمن يخشى
translation_en_yusufali: but as a reminder to those in awe ˹of Allah˺.

text_simple: تنزيلا ممن خلق الارض والسماوات العلى
translation_en_yusufali: ˹It is˺ a revelation from the One Who created the earth and the high heavens—

text_simple: الرحمن على العرش استوى
translation_en_yusufali: the Most Compassionate, ˹Who is˺ established on the Throne.

text_simple: له ما في السماوات وما في الارض وما بينهما وما تحت الثرى
translation_en_yusufali: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth and whatever is in between and whatever is underground.

text_simple: وان تجهر بالقول فانه يعلم السر واخفى
translation_en_yusufali: Whether you speak openly ˹or not˺, He certainly knows what is secret and what is even more hidden.

text_simple: الله لا اله الا هو له الاسماء الحسنى
translation_en_yusufali: Allah—there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. He has the Most Beautiful Names.

text_simple: وهل اتاك حديث موسى
translation_en_yusufali: Has the story of Moses reached you ˹O Prophet˺?

text_simple: اذ راى نارا فقال لاهله امكثوا اني انست نارا لعلي اتيكم منها بقبس او اجد على النار هدى
translation_en_yusufali: When he saw a fire, he said to his family, “Wait here, ˹for˺ I have spotted a fire. Perhaps I can bring you a torch from it, or find some guidance at the fire.”

text_simple: فلما اتاها نودي يا موسى
translation_en_yusufali: But when he approached it, he was called, “O Moses!

text_simple: اني انا ربك فاخلع نعليك انك بالواد المقدس طوى
translation_en_yusufali: It is truly I. I am your Lord! So take off your sandals, for you are in the sacred valley of Ṭuwa.

text_simple: وانا اخترتك فاستمع لما يوحى
translation_en_yusufali: I have chosen you, so listen to what is revealed:

text_simple: انني انا الله لا اله الا انا فاعبدني واقم الصلاة لذكري
translation_en_yusufali: ‘It is truly I. I am Allah! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Me. So worship Me ˹alone˺, and establish prayer for My remembrance.

text_simple: ان الساعة اتية اكاد اخفيها لتجزى كل نفس بما تسعى
translation_en_yusufali: The Hour is sure to come. My Will is to keep it hidden, so that every soul may be rewarded according to their efforts.

text_simple: فلا يصدنك عنها من لا يؤمن بها واتبع هواه فتردى
translation_en_yusufali: So do not let those who disbelieve in it and follow their desires distract you from it, or you will be doomed.’”

text_simple: وما تلك بيمينك يا موسى
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Allah added,˺ “And what is that in your right hand, O  Moses?”

text_simple: قال هي عصاي اتوكا عليها واهش بها على غنمي ولي فيها مارب اخرى
translation_en_yusufali: He replied, “It is my staff! I lean on it, and with it I beat down ˹branches˺ for my sheep, and have other uses for it.”

text_simple: قال القها يا موسى
translation_en_yusufali: Allah said, “Throw it down, O  Moses!”

text_simple: فالقاها فاذا هي حية تسعى
translation_en_yusufali: So he did, then—behold!—it became a serpent, slithering.

text_simple: قال خذها ولا تخف سنعيدها سيرتها الاولى
translation_en_yusufali: Allah said, “Take it, and have no fear. We will return it to its former state.

text_simple: واضمم يدك الى جناحك تخرج بيضاء من غير سوء اية اخرى
translation_en_yusufali: And put your hand under your armpit, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished, as another sign

text_simple: لنريك من اياتنا الكبرى
translation_en_yusufali: so that We may show you some of Our greatest signs.

text_simple: اذهب الى فرعون انه طغى
translation_en_yusufali: Go to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed ˹all bounds˺.”

text_simple: قال رب اشرح لي صدري
translation_en_yusufali: Moses prayed, “My Lord! Uplift my heart for me

text_simple: ويسر لي امري
translation_en_yusufali: and make my task easy

text_simple: واحلل عقدة من لساني
translation_en_yusufali: and remove the impediment from my tongue

text_simple: يفقهوا قولي
translation_en_yusufali: so people may understand my speech

text_simple: واجعل لي وزيرا من اهلي
translation_en_yusufali: and grant me a helper from my family

text_simple: هارون اخي
translation_en_yusufali: Aaron, my brother.

text_simple: اشدد به ازري
translation_en_yusufali: Strengthen me through him

text_simple: واشركه في امري
translation_en_yusufali: and let him share my task

text_simple: كي نسبحك كثيرا
translation_en_yusufali: so that we may glorify You much

text_simple: ونذكرك كثيرا
translation_en_yusufali: and remember You much

text_simple: انك كنت بنا بصيرا
translation_en_yusufali: for truly You have ˹always˺ been overseeing us.”

text_simple: قال قد اوتيت سؤلك يا موسى
translation_en_yusufali: Allah responded, “All that you requested has been granted, O  Moses!

text_simple: ولقد مننا عليك مرة اخرى
translation_en_yusufali: And surely We had shown You favour before

text_simple: اذ اوحينا الى امك ما يوحى
translation_en_yusufali: when We inspired your mother with this:

text_simple: ان اقذفيه في التابوت فاقذفيه في اليم فليلقه اليم بالساحل ياخذه عدو لي وعدو له والقيت عليك محبة مني ولتصنع على عيني
translation_en_yusufali: ‘Put him into a chest, then put it into the river. The river will wash it ashore, and he will be taken by ˹Pharaoh,˺ an enemy of Mine and his.’ And I blessed you with lovability from Me ˹O Moses˺ so that you would be brought up under My ˹watchful˺ Eye.

text_simple: اذ تمشي اختك فتقول هل ادلكم على من يكفله فرجعناك الى امك كي تقر عينها ولا تحزن وقتلت نفسا فنجيناك من الغم وفتناك فتونا فلبثت سنين في اهل مدين ثم جئت على قدر يا موسى
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Remember˺ when your sister came along and proposed, ‘Shall I direct you to someone who will nurse him?’ So We reunited you with your mother so that her heart would be put at ease, and she would not grieve. ˹Later˺ you killed a man ˹by mistake˺, but We saved you from sorrow, as well as other tests We put you through. Then you stayed for a number of years among the people of Midian. Then you came here as pre-destined, O  Moses!

text_simple: واصطنعتك لنفسي
translation_en_yusufali: And I have selected you for My service.

text_simple: اذهب انت واخوك باياتي ولا تنيا في ذكري
translation_en_yusufali: Go forth, you and your brother, with My signs and never falter in remembering Me.

text_simple: اذهبا الى فرعون انه طغى
translation_en_yusufali: Go, both of you, to Pharaoh, for he has truly transgressed ˹all bounds˺.

text_simple: فقولا له قولا لينا لعله يتذكر او يخشى
translation_en_yusufali: Speak to him gently, so perhaps he may be mindful ˹of Me˺ or fearful ˹of My punishment˺.”

text_simple: قالا ربنا اننا نخاف ان يفرط علينا او ان يطغى
translation_en_yusufali: They both pleaded, “Our Lord! We fear that he may be quick to harm us or act tyrannically.”

text_simple: قال لا تخافا انني معكما اسمع وارى
translation_en_yusufali: Allah reassured ˹them˺, “Have no fear! I am with you, hearing and seeing.

text_simple: فاتياه فقولا انا رسولا ربك فارسل معنا بني اسرائيل ولا تعذبهم قد جئناك باية من ربك والسلام على من اتبع الهدى
translation_en_yusufali: So go to him and say, ‘Indeed we are both messengers from your Lord, so let the Children of Israel go with us, and do not oppress them. We have come to you with a sign from your Lord. And salvation will be for whoever follows the ˹right˺ guidance.

text_simple: انا قد اوحي الينا ان العذاب على من كذب وتولى
translation_en_yusufali: It has indeed been revealed to us that the punishment will be upon whoever denies ˹the truth˺ and turns away.’”

text_simple: قال فمن ربكما يا موسى
translation_en_yusufali: Pharaoh asked, “Who then is the Lord of you two, O  Moses?”

text_simple: قال ربنا الذي اعطى كل شيء خلقه ثم هدى
translation_en_yusufali: He answered, “Our Lord is the One Who has given everything its ˹distinctive˺ form, then guided ˹it˺.”

text_simple: قال فما بال القرون الاولى
translation_en_yusufali: Pharaoh asked, “And what about previous peoples?”

text_simple: قال علمها عند ربي في كتاب لا يضل ربي ولا ينسى
translation_en_yusufali: He replied, “That knowledge is with my Lord in a Record. My Lord neither falters nor forgets ˹anything˺.”

text_simple: الذي جعل لكم الارض مهدا وسلك لكم فيها سبلا وانزل من السماء ماء فاخرجنا به ازواجا من نبات شتى
translation_en_yusufali: ˹He is the One˺ Who has laid out the earth for ˹all of˺ you, and set in it pathways for you, and sends down rain from the sky, causing various types of plants to grow

text_simple: كلوا وارعوا انعامكم ان في ذلك لايات لاولي النهى
translation_en_yusufali: ˹so˺ eat and graze your cattle. Surely in this are signs for people of sound judgment.

text_simple: منها خلقناكم وفيها نعيدكم ومنها نخرجكم تارة اخرى
translation_en_yusufali: From the earth We created you, and into it We will return you, and from it We will bring you back again.

text_simple: ولقد اريناه اياتنا كلها فكذب وابى
translation_en_yusufali: And We certainly showed Pharaoh all of Our signs, but he denied them and refused ˹to believe˺.

text_simple: قال اجئتنا لتخرجنا من ارضنا بسحرك يا موسى
translation_en_yusufali: He said, “Have you come to drive us out of our land with your magic, O  Moses?

text_simple: فلناتينك بسحر مثله فاجعل بيننا وبينك موعدا لا نخلفه نحن ولا انت مكانا سوى
translation_en_yusufali: We can surely meet you with similar magic. So set for us an appointment that neither of us will fail to keep, in a central place.”

text_simple: قال موعدكم يوم الزينة وان يحشر الناس ضحى
translation_en_yusufali: Moses said, “Your appointment is on the Day of the Festival, and let the people be gathered mid-morning.”

text_simple: فتولى فرعون فجمع كيده ثم اتى
translation_en_yusufali: Pharaoh then withdrew, orchestrated his scheme, then returned.

text_simple: قال لهم موسى ويلكم لا تفتروا على الله كذبا فيسحتكم بعذاب وقد خاب من افترى
translation_en_yusufali: Moses warned the magicians, “Woe to you! Do not fabricate a lie against Allah, or He will wipe you out with a torment. Whoever fabricates ˹lies˺ is bound to fail.”

text_simple: فتنازعوا امرهم بينهم واسروا النجوى
translation_en_yusufali: So the magicians disputed the matter among themselves, conversing privately.

text_simple: قالوا ان هذان لساحران يريدان ان يخرجاكم من ارضكم بسحرهما ويذهبا بطريقتكم المثلى
translation_en_yusufali: They concluded, “These two are only magicians who want to drive you out of your land with their magic, and do away with your most cherished traditions.

text_simple: فاجمعوا كيدكم ثم ائتوا صفا وقد افلح اليوم من استعلى
translation_en_yusufali: So orchestrate your plan, then come forward in ˹perfect˺ ranks. And whoever prevails today will certainly be successful.”

text_simple: قالوا يا موسى اما ان تلقي واما ان نكون اول من القى
translation_en_yusufali: They said, “O Moses! Either you cast, or let us be the first to cast.”

text_simple: قال بل القوا فاذا حبالهم وعصيهم يخيل اليه من سحرهم انها تسعى
translation_en_yusufali: Moses responded, “No, you go first.” And suddenly their ropes and staffs appeared to him—by their magic—to be slithering.

text_simple: فاوجس في نفسه خيفة موسى
translation_en_yusufali: So Moses concealed fear within himself.

text_simple: قلنا لا تخف انك انت الاعلى
translation_en_yusufali: We reassured ˹him˺, “Do not fear! It is certainly you who will prevail.

text_simple: والق ما في يمينك تلقف ما صنعوا انما صنعوا كيد ساحر ولا يفلح الساحر حيث اتى
translation_en_yusufali: Cast what is in your right hand, and it will swallow up what they have made, for what they have made is no more than a magic trick. And magicians can never succeed wherever they go.”

text_simple: فالقي السحرة سجدا قالوا امنا برب هارون وموسى
translation_en_yusufali: So the magicians fell down in prostration, declaring, “We believe in the Lord of Aaron and Moses.”

text_simple: قال امنتم له قبل ان اذن لكم انه لكبيركم الذي علمكم السحر فلاقطعن ايديكم وارجلكم من خلاف ولاصلبنكم في جذوع النخل ولتعلمن اينا اشد عذابا وابقى
translation_en_yusufali: Pharaoh threatened, “How dare you believe in him before I give you permission? He must be your master who taught you magic. I will certainly cut off your hands and feet on opposite sides, and crucify you on the trunks of palm trees. You will really see whose punishment is more severe and more lasting.”

text_simple: قالوا لن نؤثرك على ما جاءنا من البينات والذي فطرنا فاقض ما انت قاض انما تقضي هذه الحياة الدنيا
translation_en_yusufali: They responded, “By the One Who created us! We will never prefer you over the clear proofs that have come to us. So do whatever you want! Your authority only covers the ˹fleeting˺ life of this world.

text_simple: انا امنا بربنا ليغفر لنا خطايانا وما اكرهتنا عليه من السحر والله خير وابقى
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, we have believed in our Lord so He may forgive our sins and that magic you have forced us to practice. And Allah is far superior ˹in reward˺ and more lasting ˹in punishment˺.”

text_simple: انه من يات ربه مجرما فان له جهنم لا يموت فيها ولا يحيى
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever comes to their Lord as an evildoer will certainly have Hell, where they can neither live nor die.

text_simple: ومن ياته مؤمنا قد عمل الصالحات فاولئك لهم الدرجات العلى
translation_en_yusufali: But whoever comes to Him as a believer, having done good, they will have the highest ranks:

text_simple: جنات عدن تجري من تحتها الانهار خالدين فيها وذلك جزاء من تزكى
translation_en_yusufali: the Gardens of Eternity, under which rivers flow, where they will stay forever. That is the reward of those who purify themselves.

text_simple: ولقد اوحينا الى موسى ان اسر بعبادي فاضرب لهم طريقا في البحر يبسا لا تخاف دركا ولا تخشى
translation_en_yusufali: And We surely inspired Moses, ˹saying,˺ “Leave with My servants ˹at night˺ and strike a dry passage for them across the sea. Have no fear of being overtaken, nor be concerned ˹of drowning˺.”

text_simple: فاتبعهم فرعون بجنوده فغشيهم من اليم ما غشيهم
translation_en_yusufali: Then Pharaoh pursued them with his soldiers—but how overwhelming were the waters that submerged them!

text_simple: واضل فرعون قومه وما هدى
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹so˺ Pharaoh led his people astray, and did not guide ˹them rightly˺.

text_simple: يا بني اسرائيل قد انجيناكم من عدوكم وواعدناكم جانب الطور الايمن ونزلنا عليكم المن والسلوى
translation_en_yusufali: O Children of Israel! We saved you from your enemy, and made an appointment with you on the right side of Mount Ṭûr, and sent down to you manna and quails

text_simple: كلوا من طيبات ما رزقناكم ولا تطغوا فيه فيحل عليكم غضبي ومن يحلل عليه غضبي فقد هوى
translation_en_yusufali: ˹saying,˺ “Eat from the good things We have provided for you, but do not transgress in them, or My wrath will befall you. And whoever My wrath befalls is certainly doomed.

text_simple: واني لغفار لمن تاب وامن وعمل صالحا ثم اهتدى
translation_en_yusufali: But I am truly Most Forgiving to whoever repents, believes, and does good, then persists on ˹true˺ guidance.”

text_simple: وما اعجلك عن قومك يا موسى
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Allah asked,˺ “Why have you come with such haste ahead of your people, O  Moses?”

text_simple: قال هم اولاء على اثري وعجلت اليك رب لترضى
translation_en_yusufali: He replied, “They are close on my tracks. And I have hastened to You, my Lord, so You will be pleased.”

text_simple: قال فانا قد فتنا قومك من بعدك واضلهم السامري
translation_en_yusufali: Allah responded, “We have indeed tested your people in your absence, and the Sâmiri has led them astray.”

text_simple: فرجع موسى الى قومه غضبان اسفا قال يا قوم الم يعدكم ربكم وعدا حسنا افطال عليكم العهد ام اردتم ان يحل عليكم غضب من ربكم فاخلفتم موعدي
translation_en_yusufali: So Moses returned to his people, furious and sorrowful. He said, “O my people! Had your Lord not made you a good promise? Has my absence been too long for you? Or have you wished for wrath from your Lord to befall you, so you broke your promise to me?”

text_simple: قالوا ما اخلفنا موعدك بملكنا ولكنا حملنا اوزارا من زينة القوم فقذفناها فكذلك القى السامري
translation_en_yusufali: They argued, “We did not break our promise to you of our own free will, but we were made to carry the burden of the people’s ˹golden˺ jewellery, then we threw it ˹into the fire˺, and so did the Sâmiri.”

text_simple: فاخرج لهم عجلا جسدا له خوار فقالوا هذا الهكم واله موسى فنسي
translation_en_yusufali: Then he moulded for them an idol of a calf that made a lowing sound. They said, “This is your god and the god of Moses, but Moses forgot ˹where it was˺!”

text_simple: افلا يرون الا يرجع اليهم قولا ولا يملك لهم ضرا ولا نفعا
translation_en_yusufali: Did they not see that it did not respond to them, nor could it protect or benefit them?

text_simple: ولقد قال لهم هارون من قبل يا قوم انما فتنتم به وان ربكم الرحمن فاتبعوني واطيعوا امري
translation_en_yusufali: Aaron had already warned them beforehand, “O my people! You are only being tested by this, for indeed your ˹one true˺ Lord is the Most Compassionate. So follow me and obey my orders.”

text_simple: قالوا لن نبرح عليه عاكفين حتى يرجع الينا موسى
translation_en_yusufali: They replied, “We will not cease to worship it until Moses returns to us.”

text_simple: قال يا هارون ما منعك اذ رايتهم ضلوا
translation_en_yusufali: Moses scolded ˹his brother˺, “O Aaron! What prevented you, when you saw them going astray

text_simple: الا تتبعن افعصيت امري
translation_en_yusufali: from following after me? How could you disobey my orders?”

text_simple: قال يا ابن ام لا تاخذ بلحيتي ولا براسي اني خشيت ان تقول فرقت بين بني اسرائيل ولم ترقب قولي
translation_en_yusufali: Aaron pleaded, “O son of my mother! Do not seize me by my beard or ˹the hair of˺ my head. I really feared that you would say, ‘You have caused division among the Children of Israel, and did not observe my word.’”

text_simple: قال فما خطبك يا سامري
translation_en_yusufali: Moses then asked, “What did you think you were doing, O  Sâmiri?”

text_simple: قال بصرت بما لم يبصروا به فقبضت قبضة من اثر الرسول فنبذتها وكذلك سولت لي نفسي
translation_en_yusufali: He said, “I saw what they did not see, so I took a handful ˹of dust˺ from the hoof-prints of ˹the horse of˺ the messenger-angel ˹Gabriel˺ then cast it ˹on the moulded calf˺. This is what my lower-self tempted me into.”

text_simple: قال فاذهب فان لك في الحياة ان تقول لا مساس وان لك موعدا لن تخلفه وانظر الى الهك الذي ظلت عليه عاكفا لنحرقنه ثم لننسفنه في اليم نسفا
translation_en_yusufali: Moses said, “Go away then! And for ˹the rest of your˺ life you will surely be crying, ‘Do not touch ˹me˺!’ Then you will certainly have a fate that you cannot escape. Now look at your god to which you have been devoted: we will burn it up, then scatter it in the sea completely.”

text_simple: انما الهكم الله الذي لا اله الا هو وسع كل شيء علما
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Then Moses addressed his people,˺ “Your only god is Allah, there is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. He encompasses everything in ˹His˺ knowledge.”

text_simple: كذلك نقص عليك من انباء ما قد سبق وقد اتيناك من لدنا ذكرا
translation_en_yusufali: This is how We relate to you ˹O Prophet˺ some of the stories of the past. And We have certainly granted you a Reminder from Us.

text_simple: من اعرض عنه فانه يحمل يوم القيامة وزرا
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever turns away from it will surely bear the burden ˹of sin˺ on the Day of Judgment

text_simple: خالدين فيه وساء لهم يوم القيامة حملا
translation_en_yusufali: suffering its consequences forever. What an evil burden they will carry on Judgment Day!

text_simple: يوم ينفخ في الصور ونحشر المجرمين يومئذ زرقا
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Beware of˺ the Day the Trumpet will be blown, and We will gather the wicked on that Day blue-faced ˹from horror and thirst˺.

text_simple: يتخافتون بينهم ان لبثتم الا عشرا
translation_en_yusufali: They will whisper among themselves, “You stayed no more than ten days ˹on the earth˺.”

text_simple: نحن اعلم بما يقولون اذ يقول امثلهم طريقة ان لبثتم الا يوما
translation_en_yusufali: We know best what they will say—the most reasonable of them will say, “You stayed no more than a day.”

text_simple: ويسالونك عن الجبال فقل ينسفها ربي نسفا
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹if˺ they ask you ˹O Prophet˺ about the mountains, ˹then˺ say, “My Lord will wipe them out completely

text_simple: فيذرها قاعا صفصفا
translation_en_yusufali: leaving the earth level and bare

text_simple: لا ترى فيها عوجا ولا امتا
translation_en_yusufali: with neither depressions nor elevations to be seen.”

text_simple: يومئذ يتبعون الداعي لا عوج له وخشعت الاصوات للرحمن فلا تسمع الا همسا
translation_en_yusufali: On that Day all will follow the caller ˹for assembly˺, ˹and˺ none will dare to deviate. All voices will be hushed before the Most Compassionate. Only whispers will be heard.

text_simple: يومئذ لا تنفع الشفاعة الا من اذن له الرحمن ورضي له قولا
translation_en_yusufali: On that Day no intercession will be of any benefit, except by those granted permission by the Most Compassionate and whose words are agreeable to Him.

text_simple: يعلم ما بين ايديهم وما خلفهم ولا يحيطون به علما
translation_en_yusufali: He ˹fully˺ knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them, but they cannot encompass Him in ˹their˺ knowledge.

text_simple: وعنت الوجوه للحي القيوم وقد خاب من حمل ظلما
translation_en_yusufali: And all faces will be humbled before the Ever-Living, All-Sustaining. And those burdened with wrongdoing will be in loss.

text_simple: ومن يعمل من الصالحات وهو مؤمن فلا يخاف ظلما ولا هضما
translation_en_yusufali: But whoever does good and is a believer will have no fear of being wronged or denied ˹their reward˺.

text_simple: وكذلك انزلناه قرانا عربيا وصرفنا فيه من الوعيد لعلهم يتقون او يحدث لهم ذكرا
translation_en_yusufali: And so We have sent it down as an Arabic Quran and varied the warnings in it, so perhaps they will shun evil or it may cause them to be mindful.

text_simple: فتعالى الله الملك الحق ولا تعجل بالقران من قبل ان يقضى اليك وحيه وقل رب زدني علما
translation_en_yusufali: Exalted is Allah, the True King! Do not rush to recite ˹a revelation of˺ the Quran ˹O Prophet˺ before it is ˹properly˺ conveyed to you, and pray, “My Lord! Increase me in knowledge.”

text_simple: ولقد عهدنا الى ادم من قبل فنسي ولم نجد له عزما
translation_en_yusufali: And indeed, We once made a covenant with Adam, but he forgot, and ˹so˺ We did not find determination in him.

text_simple: واذ قلنا للملائكة اسجدوا لادم فسجدوا الا ابليس ابى
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when We said to the angels, “Prostrate before Adam,” so they all did—but not Iblîs, who refused ˹arrogantly˺.

text_simple: فقلنا يا ادم ان هذا عدو لك ولزوجك فلا يخرجنكما من الجنة فتشقى
translation_en_yusufali: So We cautioned, “O Adam! This is surely an enemy to you and to your wife. So do not let him drive you both out of Paradise, for you ˹O Adam˺ would then suffer ˹hardship˺.

text_simple: ان لك الا تجوع فيها ولا تعرى
translation_en_yusufali: Here it is guaranteed that you will never go hungry or unclothed

text_simple: وانك لا تظما فيها ولا تضحى
translation_en_yusufali: nor will you ˹ever˺ suffer from thirst or ˹the sun’s˺ heat.”

text_simple: فوسوس اليه الشيطان قال يا ادم هل ادلك على شجرة الخلد وملك لا يبلى
translation_en_yusufali: But Satan whispered to him, saying, “O Adam! Shall I show you the Tree of Immortality and a kingdom that does not fade away?”

text_simple: فاكلا منها فبدت لهما سواتهما وطفقا يخصفان عليهما من ورق الجنة وعصى ادم ربه فغوى
translation_en_yusufali: So they both ate from the tree and then their nakedness was exposed to them, prompting them to cover themselves with leaves from Paradise. So Adam disobeyed his Lord, and ˹so˺ lost his way.

text_simple: ثم اجتباه ربه فتاب عليه وهدى
translation_en_yusufali: Then his Lord chose him ˹for His grace˺, accepted his repentance, and guided him ˹rightly˺.

text_simple: قال اهبطا منها جميعا بعضكم لبعض عدو فاما ياتينكم مني هدى فمن اتبع هداي فلا يضل ولا يشقى
translation_en_yusufali: Allah said, “Descend, both of you, from here together ˹with Satan˺ as enemies to each other. Then when guidance comes to you from Me, whoever follows My guidance will neither go astray ˹in this life˺ nor suffer ˹in the next˺.

text_simple: ومن اعرض عن ذكري فان له معيشة ضنكا ونحشره يوم القيامة اعمى
translation_en_yusufali: But whoever turns away from My Reminder will certainly have a miserable life, then We will raise them up blind on the Day of Judgment.”

text_simple: قال رب لم حشرتني اعمى وقد كنت بصيرا
translation_en_yusufali: They will cry, “My Lord! Why have you raised me up blind, although I used to see?”

text_simple: قال كذلك اتتك اياتنا فنسيتها وكذلك اليوم تنسى
translation_en_yusufali: Allah will respond, “It is so, just as Our revelations came to you and you neglected them, so Today you are neglected.”

text_simple: وكذلك نجزي من اسرف ولم يؤمن بايات ربه ولعذاب الاخرة اشد وابقى
translation_en_yusufali: This is how We reward whoever transgresses and does not believe in the revelations of their Lord. And the punishment of the Hereafter is far more severe and more lasting.

text_simple: افلم يهد لهم كم اهلكنا قبلهم من القرون يمشون في مساكنهم ان في ذلك لايات لاولي النهى
translation_en_yusufali: Is it not yet clear to them how many peoples We destroyed before them, whose ruins they still pass by? Surely in this are signs for people of sound judgment.

text_simple: ولولا كلمة سبقت من ربك لكان لزاما واجل مسمى
translation_en_yusufali: Had it not been for a prior decree from your Lord ˹O Prophet˺ and a term already set, their ˹instant˺ doom would have been inevitable.

text_simple: فاصبر على ما يقولون وسبح بحمد ربك قبل طلوع الشمس وقبل غروبها ومن اناء الليل فسبح واطراف النهار لعلك ترضى
translation_en_yusufali: So be patient ˹O Prophet˺ with what they say. And glorify the praises of your Lord before sunrise and before sunset, and glorify Him in the hours of the night and at both ends of the day, so that you may be pleased ˹with the reward˺.

text_simple: ولا تمدن عينيك الى ما متعنا به ازواجا منهم زهرة الحياة الدنيا لنفتنهم فيه ورزق ربك خير وابقى
translation_en_yusufali: Do not let your eyes crave what We have allowed some of the disbelievers to enjoy; the ˹fleeting˺ splendour of this worldly life, which We test them with. But your Lord’s provision ˹in the Hereafter˺ is far better and more lasting.

text_simple: وامر اهلك بالصلاة واصطبر عليها لا نسالك رزقا نحن نرزقك والعاقبة للتقوى
translation_en_yusufali: Bid your people to pray, and be diligent in ˹observing˺ it. We do not ask you to provide. It is We Who provide for you. And the ultimate outcome is ˹only˺ for ˹the people of˺ righteousness.

text_simple: وقالوا لولا ياتينا باية من ربه اولم تاتهم بينة ما في الصحف الاولى
translation_en_yusufali: They demand, “If only he could bring us a sign from his Lord!” Have they not ˹already˺ received a confirmation of what is in earlier Scriptures?

text_simple: ولو انا اهلكناهم بعذاب من قبله لقالوا ربنا لولا ارسلت الينا رسولا فنتبع اياتك من قبل ان نذل ونخزى
translation_en_yusufali: Had We destroyed them with a torment before this ˹Prophet came˺, they would have surely argued, “Our Lord! If only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations before being humiliated and put to shame.”

text_simple: قل كل متربص فتربصوا فستعلمون من اصحاب الصراط السوي ومن اهتدى
translation_en_yusufali: Say ˹to them, O  Prophet˺, “Each ˹of us˺ is waiting, so keep waiting! You will soon know who is on the Straight Path and is ˹rightly˺ guided.”

text_simple: اقترب للناس حسابهم وهم في غفلة معرضون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹The time of˺ people’s judgment has drawn near, yet they are heedlessly turning away.

text_simple: ما ياتيهم من ذكر من ربهم محدث الا استمعوه وهم يلعبون
translation_en_yusufali: Whatever new reminder comes to them from their Lord, they only listen to it jokingly

text_simple: لاهية قلوبهم واسروا النجوى الذين ظلموا هل هذا الا بشر مثلكم افتاتون السحر وانتم تبصرون
translation_en_yusufali: with their hearts ˹totally˺ distracted. The evildoers would converse secretly, ˹saying,˺ “Is this ˹one˺ not human like yourselves? Would you fall for ˹this˺ witchcraft, even though you can ˹clearly˺ see?”

text_simple: قال ربي يعلم القول في السماء والارض وهو السميع العليم
translation_en_yusufali: The Prophet responded, “My Lord ˹fully˺ knows every word spoken in the heavens and the earth. For He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.”

text_simple: بل قالوا اضغاث احلام بل افتراه بل هو شاعر فلياتنا باية كما ارسل الاولون
translation_en_yusufali: Yet they say, “This ˹Quran˺ is a set of confused dreams! No, he has fabricated it! No, he must be a poet! So let him bring us a ˹tangible˺ sign like those ˹prophets˺ sent before.”

text_simple: ما امنت قبلهم من قرية اهلكناها افهم يؤمنون
translation_en_yusufali: Not a ˹single˺ society We destroyed before them ever believed ˹after receiving the signs˺. Will these ˹pagans˺ then believe?

text_simple: وما ارسلنا قبلك الا رجالا نوحي اليهم فاسالوا اهل الذكر ان كنتم لا تعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: We did not send ˹messengers˺ before you ˹O Prophet˺ except mere men inspired by Us. If you ˹polytheists˺ do not know ˹this already˺, then ask those who have knowledge ˹of the Scriptures˺.

text_simple: وما جعلناهم جسدا لا ياكلون الطعام وما كانوا خالدين
translation_en_yusufali: We did not give those messengers ˹supernatural˺ bodies that did not need food, nor were they immortal.

text_simple: ثم صدقناهم الوعد فانجيناهم ومن نشاء واهلكنا المسرفين
translation_en_yusufali: Then We fulfilled Our promise to them, saving them along with whoever We willed and destroying the transgressors.

text_simple: لقد انزلنا اليكم كتابا فيه ذكركم افلا تعقلون
translation_en_yusufali: We have surely revealed to you a Book, in which there is glory for you. Will you not then understand?

text_simple: وكم قصمنا من قرية كانت ظالمة وانشانا بعدها قوما اخرين
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies of wrongdoers We have destroyed, raising up other people after them!

text_simple: فلما احسوا باسنا اذا هم منها يركضون
translation_en_yusufali: When the wrongdoers sensed ˹the arrival of˺ Our torment, they started to run away from their cities.

text_simple: لا تركضوا وارجعوا الى ما اترفتم فيه ومساكنكم لعلكم تسالون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹They were told,˺ “Do not run away! Return to your luxuries and your homes, so you may be questioned ˹about your fate˺.”

text_simple: قالوا يا ويلنا انا كنا ظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: They cried, “Woe to us! We have surely been wrongdoers.”

text_simple: فما زالت تلك دعواهم حتى جعلناهم حصيدا خامدين
translation_en_yusufali: They kept repeating their cry until We mowed them down, ˹leaving them˺ lifeless.

text_simple: وما خلقنا السماء والارض وما بينهما لاعبين
translation_en_yusufali: We did not create the heavens and the earth and everything in between for sport.

text_simple: لو اردنا ان نتخذ لهوا لاتخذناه من لدنا ان كنا فاعلين
translation_en_yusufali: Had We intended to take ˹some˺ amusement, We could have found it in Our presence, if that had been Our Will.

text_simple: بل نقذف بالحق على الباطل فيدمغه فاذا هو زاهق ولكم الويل مما تصفون
translation_en_yusufali: In fact, We hurl the truth against falsehood, leaving it crushed, and it quickly vanishes. And woe be to you for what you claim!

text_simple: وله من في السماوات والارض ومن عنده لا يستكبرون عن عبادته ولا يستحسرون
translation_en_yusufali: To Him belong all those in the heavens and the earth. And those nearest to Him are not too proud to worship Him, nor do they tire.

text_simple: يسبحون الليل والنهار لا يفترون
translation_en_yusufali: They glorify ˹Him˺ day and night, never wavering.

text_simple: ام اتخذوا الهة من الارض هم ينشرون
translation_en_yusufali: Or have they taken gods from the earth, who can raise the dead?

text_simple: لو كان فيهما الهة الا الله لفسدتا فسبحان الله رب العرش عما يصفون
translation_en_yusufali: Had there been other gods besides Allah in the heavens or the earth, both ˹realms˺ would have surely been corrupted. So Glorified is Allah, Lord of the Throne, far above what they claim.

text_simple: لا يسال عما يفعل وهم يسالون
translation_en_yusufali: He cannot be questioned about what He does, but they will ˹all˺ be questioned.

text_simple: ام اتخذوا من دونه الهة قل هاتوا برهانكم هذا ذكر من معي وذكر من قبلي بل اكثرهم لا يعلمون الحق فهم معرضون
translation_en_yusufali: Or have they taken other gods besides Him? Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Show ˹me˺ your proof. Here is ˹the Quran,˺ the Reminder for those with me; along with ˹earlier Scriptures,˺ the Reminder for those before me.” But most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away.

text_simple: وما ارسلنا من قبلك من رسول الا نوحي اليه انه لا اله الا انا فاعبدون
translation_en_yusufali: We never sent a messenger before you ˹O Prophet˺ without revealing to him: “There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Me, so worship Me ˹alone˺.”

text_simple: وقالوا اتخذ الرحمن ولدا سبحانه بل عباد مكرمون
translation_en_yusufali: And they say, “The Most Compassionate has offspring!” Glory be to Him! In fact, those ˹angels˺ are only ˹His˺ honoured servants

text_simple: لا يسبقونه بالقول وهم بامره يعملون
translation_en_yusufali: who do not speak until He has spoken, ˹only˺ acting at His command.

text_simple: يعلم ما بين ايديهم وما خلفهم ولا يشفعون الا لمن ارتضى وهم من خشيته مشفقون
translation_en_yusufali: He ˹fully˺ knows what is ahead of them and what is behind them. They do not intercede except for whom He approves, and they tremble in awe of Him.

text_simple: ومن يقل منهم اني اله من دونه فذلك نجزيه جهنم كذلك نجزي الظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever of them were to say, “I am a god besides Him,” they would be rewarded with Hell by Us. This is how We reward the wrongdoers.

text_simple: اولم ير الذين كفروا ان السماوات والارض كانتا رتقا ففتقناهما وجعلنا من الماء كل شيء حي افلا يؤمنون
translation_en_yusufali: Do the disbelievers not realize that the heavens and earth were ˹once˺ one mass then We split them apart? And We created from water every living thing. Will they not then believe?

text_simple: وجعلنا في الارض رواسي ان تميد بهم وجعلنا فيها فجاجا سبلا لعلهم يهتدون
translation_en_yusufali: And We have placed firm mountains upon the earth so it does not shake with them, and made in it broad pathways so they may find their way.

text_simple: وجعلنا السماء سقفا محفوظا وهم عن اياتها معرضون
translation_en_yusufali: And We have made the sky a well-protected canopy, still they turn away from its signs.

text_simple: وهو الذي خلق الليل والنهار والشمس والقمر كل في فلك يسبحون
translation_en_yusufali: And He is the One Who created the day and the night, the sun and the moon—each travelling in an orbit.

text_simple: وما جعلنا لبشر من قبلك الخلد افان مت فهم الخالدون
translation_en_yusufali: We have not granted immortality to any human before you ˹O Prophet˺: so if you die, will they live forever?

text_simple: كل نفس ذائقة الموت ونبلوكم بالشر والخير فتنة والينا ترجعون
translation_en_yusufali: Every soul will taste death. And We test you ˹O humanity˺ with good and evil as a trial, then to Us you will ˹all˺ be returned.

text_simple: واذا راك الذين كفروا ان يتخذونك الا هزوا اهذا الذي يذكر الهتكم وهم بذكر الرحمن هم كافرون
translation_en_yusufali: When the disbelievers see you ˹O Prophet˺, they only make fun of you, ˹saying,˺ “Is this the one who speaks ˹ill˺ of your gods?” while they disbelieve at the mention of the Most Compassionate.

text_simple: خلق الانسان من عجل ساريكم اياتي فلا تستعجلون
translation_en_yusufali: Humankind is made of haste. I will soon show you My signs, so do not ask Me to hasten them.

text_simple: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صادقين
translation_en_yusufali: They ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass if what you say is true?”

text_simple: لو يعلم الذين كفروا حين لا يكفون عن وجوههم النار ولا عن ظهورهم ولا هم ينصرون
translation_en_yusufali: If only the disbelievers knew that a time will come when they will not be able to keep the Fire off their faces or backs, nor will they be helped.

text_simple: بل تاتيهم بغتة فتبهتهم فلا يستطيعون ردها ولا هم ينظرون
translation_en_yusufali: In fact, the Hour will take them by surprise, leaving them stunned. So they will not be able to avert it, nor will it be delayed from them.

text_simple: ولقد استهزئ برسل من قبلك فحاق بالذين سخروا منهم ما كانوا به يستهزئون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Other˺ messengers had already been ridiculed before you ˹O Prophet˺, but those who mocked them were overtaken by what they used to ridicule.

text_simple: قل من يكلؤكم بالليل والنهار من الرحمن بل هم عن ذكر ربهم معرضون
translation_en_yusufali: Ask ˹them, O  Prophet,˺ “Who can defend you by day or by night against the Most Compassionate?” Still they turn away from the remembrance of their Lord.

text_simple: ام لهم الهة تمنعهم من دوننا لا يستطيعون نصر انفسهم ولا هم منا يصحبون
translation_en_yusufali: Or do they have gods—other than Us—that can protect them? They cannot ˹even˺ protect themselves, nor will they be aided against Us.

text_simple: بل متعنا هؤلاء واباءهم حتى طال عليهم العمر افلا يرون انا ناتي الارض ننقصها من اطرافها افهم الغالبون
translation_en_yusufali: In fact, We have allowed enjoyment for these ˹Meccans˺ and their forefathers for such a long time ˹that they took it for granted˺. Do they not see that We gradually reduce ˹their˺ land from its borders? Is it they who will then prevail?

text_simple: قل انما انذركم بالوحي ولا يسمع الصم الدعاء اذا ما ينذرون
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I warn you only by revelation.” But the deaf cannot hear the call when they are warned!

text_simple: ولئن مستهم نفحة من عذاب ربك ليقولن يا ويلنا انا كنا ظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: If they were touched by even a breath of your Lord’s torment, they would certainly cry, “Woe to us! We have really been wrongdoers.”

text_simple: ونضع الموازين القسط ليوم القيامة فلا تظلم نفس شيئا وان كان مثقال حبة من خردل اتينا بها وكفى بنا حاسبين
translation_en_yusufali: We will set up the scales of justice on the Day of Judgment, so no soul will be wronged in the least. And ˹even˺ if a deed is the weight of a mustard seed, We will bring it forth. And sufficient are We as a ˹vigilant˺ Reckoner.

text_simple: ولقد اتينا موسى وهارون الفرقان وضياء وذكرا للمتقين
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, We granted Moses and Aaron the standard ˹to distinguish between right and wrong˺—a light and a reminder for the righteous

text_simple: الذين يخشون ربهم بالغيب وهم من الساعة مشفقون
translation_en_yusufali: who are in awe of their Lord without seeing Him, and are fearful of the Hour.

text_simple: وهذا ذكر مبارك انزلناه افانتم له منكرون
translation_en_yusufali: And this ˹Quran˺ is a blessed reminder which We have revealed. Will you ˹pagans˺ then deny it?

text_simple: ولقد اتينا ابراهيم رشده من قبل وكنا به عالمين
translation_en_yusufali: And indeed, We had granted Abraham sound judgment early on, for We knew him well ˹to be worthy of it˺.

text_simple: اذ قال لابيه وقومه ما هذه التماثيل التي انتم لها عاكفون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Remember˺ when he questioned his father and his people, “What are these statues to which you are so devoted?”

text_simple: قالوا وجدنا اباءنا لها عابدين
translation_en_yusufali: They replied, “We found our forefathers worshipping them.”

text_simple: قال لقد كنتم انتم واباؤكم في ضلال مبين
translation_en_yusufali: He responded, “Indeed, you and your forefathers have been clearly astray.”

text_simple: قالوا اجئتنا بالحق ام انت من اللاعبين
translation_en_yusufali: They asked, “Have you come to us with the truth, or is this a joke?”

text_simple: قال بل ربكم رب السماوات والارض الذي فطرهن وانا على ذلكم من الشاهدين
translation_en_yusufali: He replied, “In fact, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, Who created them ˹both˺. And to that I bear witness.”

text_simple: وتالله لاكيدن اصنامكم بعد ان تولوا مدبرين
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Then he said to himself,˺ “By Allah! I will surely plot against your idols after you have turned your backs and gone away.”

text_simple: فجعلهم جذاذا الا كبيرا لهم لعلهم اليه يرجعون
translation_en_yusufali: So he smashed them into pieces, except the biggest of them, so they might turn to it ˹for answers˺.

text_simple: قالوا من فعل هذا بالهتنا انه لمن الظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: They protested, “Who dared do this to our gods? It must be an evildoer!”

text_simple: قالوا سمعنا فتى يذكرهم يقال له ابراهيم
translation_en_yusufali: Some said, “We heard a young man, called Abraham, speaking ˹ill˺ of them.”

text_simple: قالوا فاتوا به على اعين الناس لعلهم يشهدون
translation_en_yusufali: They demanded, “Bring him before the eyes of the people, so that they may witness ˹his trial˺.”

text_simple: قالوا اانت فعلت هذا بالهتنا يا ابراهيم
translation_en_yusufali: They asked, “Was it you who did this to our gods, O  Abraham?”

text_simple: قال بل فعله كبيرهم هذا فاسالوهم ان كانوا ينطقون
translation_en_yusufali: He replied ˹sarcastically˺, “No, this one—the biggest of them—did it! So ask them, if they can talk!”

text_simple: فرجعوا الى انفسهم فقالوا انكم انتم الظالمون
translation_en_yusufali: So they came back to their senses, saying ˹to one another˺, “You yourselves are truly the wrongdoers!”

text_simple: ثم نكسوا على رءوسهم لقد علمت ما هؤلاء ينطقون
translation_en_yusufali: Then they ˹quickly˺ regressed to their ˹original˺ mind-set, ˹arguing,˺ “You already know that those ˹idols˺ cannot talk.”

text_simple: قال افتعبدون من دون الله ما لا ينفعكم شيئا ولا يضركم
translation_en_yusufali: He rebuked ˹them˺, “Do you then worship—instead of Allah—what can neither benefit nor harm you in any way?

text_simple: اف لكم ولما تعبدون من دون الله افلا تعقلون
translation_en_yusufali: Shame on you and whatever you worship instead of Allah! Do you not have any sense?”

text_simple: قالوا حرقوه وانصروا الهتكم ان كنتم فاعلين
translation_en_yusufali: They concluded, “Burn him up to avenge your gods, if you must act.”

text_simple: قلنا يا نار كوني بردا وسلاما على ابراهيم
translation_en_yusufali: We ordered, “O fire! Be cool and safe for Abraham!”

text_simple: وارادوا به كيدا فجعلناهم الاخسرين
translation_en_yusufali: They had sought to harm him, but We made them the worst losers.

text_simple: ونجيناه ولوطا الى الارض التي باركنا فيها للعالمين
translation_en_yusufali: Then We delivered him, along with Lot, to the land We had showered with blessings for all people.

text_simple: ووهبنا له اسحاق ويعقوب نافلة وكلا جعلنا صالحين
translation_en_yusufali: And We blessed him with Isaac ˹as a son˺ and Jacob ˹as a grandson˺, as an additional favour—making all of them righteous.

text_simple: وجعلناهم ائمة يهدون بامرنا واوحينا اليهم فعل الخيرات واقام الصلاة وايتاء الزكاة وكانوا لنا عابدين
translation_en_yusufali: We ˹also˺ made them leaders, guiding by Our command, and inspired them to do good deeds, establish prayer, and pay alms-tax. And they were devoted to Our worship.

text_simple: ولوطا اتيناه حكما وعلما ونجيناه من القرية التي كانت تعمل الخبائث انهم كانوا قوم سوء فاسقين
translation_en_yusufali: And to Lot We gave wisdom and knowledge, and delivered him from the society engrossed in shameful practices. They were certainly an evil, rebellious people.

text_simple: وادخلناه في رحمتنا انه من الصالحين
translation_en_yusufali: And We admitted him into Our mercy, ˹for˺ he was truly one of the righteous.

text_simple: ونوحا اذ نادى من قبل فاستجبنا له فنجيناه واهله من الكرب العظيم
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when Noah had cried out to Us earlier, so We responded to him and delivered him and his family from the great distress.

text_simple: ونصرناه من القوم الذين كذبوا باياتنا انهم كانوا قوم سوء فاغرقناهم اجمعين
translation_en_yusufali: And We made him prevail over those who had rejected Our signs. They were truly an evil people, so We drowned them all.

text_simple: وداوود وسليمان اذ يحكمان في الحرث اذ نفشت فيه غنم القوم وكنا لحكمهم شاهدين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when David and Solomon passed judgment regarding the crops ruined ˹at night˺ by someone’s sheep, and We were witness to their judgments.

text_simple: ففهمناها سليمان وكلا اتينا حكما وعلما وسخرنا مع داوود الجبال يسبحن والطير وكنا فاعلين
translation_en_yusufali: We guided ˹young˺ Solomon to a fairer settlement, and granted each of them wisdom and knowledge. We subjected the mountains as well as the birds to hymn ˹Our praises˺ along with David. It is We Who did ˹it all˺.

text_simple: وعلمناه صنعة لبوس لكم لتحصنكم من باسكم فهل انتم شاكرون
translation_en_yusufali: We taught him the art of making body armour to protect you in battle. Will you then be grateful?

text_simple: ولسليمان الريح عاصفة تجري بامره الى الارض التي باركنا فيها وكنا بكل شيء عالمين
translation_en_yusufali: And to Solomon We subjected the raging winds, blowing by his command to the land We had showered with blessings. It is We Who know everything.

text_simple: ومن الشياطين من يغوصون له ويعملون عملا دون ذلك وكنا لهم حافظين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹We subjected˺ some jinn that dived for him, and performed other duties. It is We Who kept them in check.

text_simple: وايوب اذ نادى ربه اني مسني الضر وانت ارحم الراحمين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when Job cried out to his Lord, “I have been touched with adversity, and You are the Most Merciful of the merciful.”

text_simple: فاستجبنا له فكشفنا ما به من ضر واتيناه اهله ومثلهم معهم رحمة من عندنا وذكرى للعابدين
translation_en_yusufali: So We answered his prayer and removed his adversity, and gave him back his family, twice as many, as a mercy from Us and a lesson for the ˹devoted˺ worshippers.

text_simple: واسماعيل وادريس وذا الكفل كل من الصابرين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ Ishmael, Enoch, and Ⱬul-Kifl. They were all steadfast.

text_simple: وادخلناهم في رحمتنا انهم من الصالحين
translation_en_yusufali: We admitted them into Our mercy, for they were truly of the righteous.

text_simple: وذا النون اذ ذهب مغاضبا فظن ان لن نقدر عليه فنادى في الظلمات ان لا اله الا انت سبحانك اني كنت من الظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when the Man of the Whale stormed off ˹from his city˺ in a rage, thinking We would not restrain him. Then in the ˹veils of˺ darkness he cried out, “There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except You. Glory be to You! I have certainly done wrong.”

text_simple: فاستجبنا له ونجيناه من الغم وكذلك ننجي المؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: So We answered his prayer and rescued him from anguish. And so do We save the ˹true˺ believers.

text_simple: وزكريا اذ نادى ربه رب لا تذرني فردا وانت خير الوارثين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when Zachariah cried out to his Lord, “My Lord! Do not leave me childless, though You are the Best of Successors.”

text_simple: فاستجبنا له ووهبنا له يحيى واصلحنا له زوجه انهم كانوا يسارعون في الخيرات ويدعوننا رغبا ورهبا وكانوا لنا خاشعين
translation_en_yusufali: So We answered his prayer, granted him John, and made his wife fertile. Indeed, they used to race in doing good, and call upon Us with hope and fear, totally humbling themselves before Us.

text_simple: والتي احصنت فرجها فنفخنا فيها من روحنا وجعلناها وابنها اية للعالمين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ the one who guarded her chastity, so We breathed into her through Our angel, ˹Gabriel,˺ making her and her son a sign for all peoples.

text_simple: ان هذه امتكم امة واحدة وانا ربكم فاعبدون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹O prophets!˺ Indeed, this religion of yours is ˹only˺ one, and I am your Lord, so worship Me ˹alone˺.

text_simple: وتقطعوا امرهم بينهم كل الينا راجعون
translation_en_yusufali: Yet the people have divided it into sects. But to Us they will all return.

text_simple: فمن يعمل من الصالحات وهو مؤمن فلا كفران لسعيه وانا له كاتبون
translation_en_yusufali: So whoever does good and is a believer will never be denied ˹the reward for˺ their striving, for We are recording it all.

text_simple: وحرام على قرية اهلكناها انهم لا يرجعون
translation_en_yusufali: It is impossible for a society which We have destroyed to ever rise again

text_simple: حتى اذا فتحت ياجوج وماجوج وهم من كل حدب ينسلون
translation_en_yusufali: until ˹after˺ Gog and Magog have broken loose ˹from the barrier˺, swarming down from every hill

text_simple: واقترب الوعد الحق فاذا هي شاخصة ابصار الذين كفروا يا ويلنا قد كنا في غفلة من هذا بل كنا ظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: ushering in the True Promise. Then—behold!—the disbelievers will stare ˹in horror, crying,˺ “Oh, woe to us! We have truly been heedless of this. In fact, we have been wrongdoers.”

text_simple: انكم وما تعبدون من دون الله حصب جهنم انتم لها واردون
translation_en_yusufali: Certainly you ˹disbelievers˺ and whatever you worship instead of Allah will be the fuel of Hell. You are ˹all˺ bound to enter it.

text_simple: لو كان هؤلاء الهة ما وردوها وكل فيها خالدون
translation_en_yusufali: Had those idols been ˹true˺ gods, they would not have entered it. And they will be there forever.

text_simple: لهم فيها زفير وهم فيها لا يسمعون
translation_en_yusufali: In it they will groan, and will not be able to hear.

text_simple: ان الذين سبقت لهم منا الحسنى اولئك عنها مبعدون
translation_en_yusufali: Surely those for whom We have destined the finest reward will be kept far away from Hell

text_simple: لا يسمعون حسيسها وهم في ما اشتهت انفسهم خالدون
translation_en_yusufali: not even hearing the slightest hissing from it. And they will delight forever in what their souls desire.

text_simple: لا يحزنهم الفزع الاكبر وتتلقاهم الملائكة هذا يومكم الذي كنتم توعدون
translation_en_yusufali: The Supreme Horror ˹of that Day˺ will not disturb them, and the angels will greet them, ˹saying,˺ “This is your Day, which you have been promised.”

text_simple: يوم نطوي السماء كطي السجل للكتب كما بدانا اول خلق نعيده وعدا علينا انا كنا فاعلين
translation_en_yusufali: On that Day We will roll up the heavens like a scroll of writings. Just as We produced the first creation, ˹so˺ shall We reproduce it. That is a promise binding on Us. We truly uphold ˹Our promises˺!

text_simple: ولقد كتبنا في الزبور من بعد الذكر ان الارض يرثها عبادي الصالحون
translation_en_yusufali: Surely, following the ˹heavenly˺ Record, We decreed in the Scriptures: “My righteous servants shall inherit the land.”

text_simple: ان في هذا لبلاغا لقوم عابدين
translation_en_yusufali: Surely this ˹Quran˺ is sufficient ˹as a reminder˺ for those devoted to worship.

text_simple: وما ارسلناك الا رحمة للعالمين
translation_en_yusufali: We have sent you ˹O Prophet˺ only as a mercy for the whole world.

text_simple: قل انما يوحى الي انما الهكم اله واحد فهل انتم مسلمون
translation_en_yusufali: Say, “What has been revealed to me is this: ‘Your God is only One God.’ Will you then submit?”

text_simple: فان تولوا فقل اذنتكم على سواء وان ادري اقريب ام بعيد ما توعدون
translation_en_yusufali: If they turn away, then say, “I have warned you all equally. I do not know if what you are threatened with is near or far.

text_simple: انه يعلم الجهر من القول ويعلم ما تكتمون
translation_en_yusufali: Allah surely knows what you say openly and whatever you hide.

text_simple: وان ادري لعله فتنة لكم ومتاع الى حين
translation_en_yusufali: I do not know if this ˹delay˺ is possibly a test for you and an enjoyment for a while.”

text_simple: قال رب احكم بالحق وربنا الرحمن المستعان على ما تصفون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹In the end,˺ the Prophet said, “My Lord! Judge ˹between us˺ in truth. And our Lord is the Most Compassionate, Whose help is sought against what you claim.”

text_simple: يا ايها الناس اتقوا ربكم ان زلزلة الساعة شيء عظيم
translation_en_yusufali: O humanity! Fear your Lord, for the ˹violent˺ quaking at the Hour is surely a dreadful thing.

text_simple: يوم ترونها تذهل كل مرضعة عما ارضعت وتضع كل ذات حمل حملها وترى الناس سكارى وما هم بسكارى ولكن عذاب الله شديد
translation_en_yusufali: The Day you see it, every nursing mother will abandon what she is nursing, and every pregnant woman will deliver her burden ˹prematurely˺. And you will see people ˹as if they were˺ drunk, though they will not be drunk; but the torment of Allah is ˹terribly˺ severe.

text_simple: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ويتبع كل شيطان مريد
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Still˺ there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, and follow every rebellious devil.

text_simple: كتب عليه انه من تولاه فانه يضله ويهديه الى عذاب السعير
translation_en_yusufali: It has been decreed for such devils that whoever takes them as a guide will be misguided and led by them into the torment of the Blaze.

text_simple: يا ايها الناس ان كنتم في ريب من البعث فانا خلقناكم من تراب ثم من نطفة ثم من علقة ثم من مضغة مخلقة وغير مخلقة لنبين لكم ونقر في الارحام ما نشاء الى اجل مسمى ثم نخرجكم طفلا ثم لتبلغوا اشدكم ومنكم من يتوفى ومنكم من يرد الى ارذل العمر لكيلا يعلم من بعد علم شيئا وترى الارض هامدة فاذا انزلنا عليها الماء اهتزت وربت وانبتت من كل زوج بهيج
translation_en_yusufali: O humanity! If you are in doubt about the Resurrection, then ˹know that˺ We did create you from dust, then from a sperm-drop, then ˹developed you into˺ a clinging clot ˹of blood˺, then a lump of flesh—fully formed or unformed—in order to demonstrate ˹Our power˺ to you. ˹Then˺ We settle whatever ˹embryo˺ We will in the womb for an appointed term, then bring you forth as infants, so that you may reach your prime. Some of you ˹may˺ die ˹young˺, while others are left to reach the most feeble stage of life so that they may know nothing after having known much. And you see the earth lifeless, but as soon as We send down rain upon it, it begins to stir ˹to life˺ and swell, producing every type of pleasant plant.

text_simple: ذلك بان الله هو الحق وانه يحيي الموتى وانه على كل شيء قدير
translation_en_yusufali: That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth, He ˹alone˺ gives life to the dead, and He ˹alone˺ is Most Capable of everything.

text_simple: وان الساعة اتية لا ريب فيها وان الله يبعث من في القبور
translation_en_yusufali: And certainly the Hour is coming, there is no doubt about it. And Allah will surely resurrect those in the graves.

text_simple: ومن الناس من يجادل في الله بغير علم ولا هدى ولا كتاب منير
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Still˺ there are some who dispute about Allah without knowledge, guidance, or an enlightening scripture

text_simple: ثاني عطفه ليضل عن سبيل الله له في الدنيا خزي ونذيقه يوم القيامة عذاب الحريق
translation_en_yusufali: turning away ˹in pride˺ to lead ˹others˺ astray from Allah’s Way. They will suffer disgrace in this world, and on the Day of Judgment We will make them taste the torment of burning.

text_simple: ذلك بما قدمت يداك وان الله ليس بظلام للعبيد
translation_en_yusufali: ˹They will be told,˺ “This is ˹the reward˺ for what your hands have done. And Allah is never unjust to ˹His˺ creation.”

text_simple: ومن الناس من يعبد الله على حرف فان اصابه خير اطمان به وان اصابته فتنة انقلب على وجهه خسر الدنيا والاخرة ذلك هو الخسران المبين
translation_en_yusufali: And there are some who worship Allah on the verge ˹of faith˺: if they are blessed with something good, they are content with it; but if they are afflicted with a trial, they relapse ˹into disbelief˺, losing this world and the Hereafter. That is ˹truly˺ the clearest loss.

text_simple: يدعو من دون الله ما لا يضره وما لا ينفعه ذلك هو الضلال البعيد
translation_en_yusufali: They call besides Allah what can neither harm nor benefit them. That is ˹truly˺ the farthest one can stray.

text_simple: يدعو لمن ضره اقرب من نفعه لبئس المولى ولبئس العشير
translation_en_yusufali: They invoke those whose worship leads to harm, not benefit. What an evil patron and what an evil associate!

text_simple: ان الله يدخل الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار ان الله يفعل ما يريد
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, Allah will admit those who believe and do good into Gardens, under which rivers flow. Surely Allah does what He wills.

text_simple: من كان يظن ان لن ينصره الله في الدنيا والاخرة فليمدد بسبب الى السماء ثم ليقطع فلينظر هل يذهبن كيده ما يغيظ
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever thinks that Allah will not help His Prophet in this world and the Hereafter, let them stretch out a rope to the ceiling and strangle themselves, then let them see if this plan will do away with ˹the cause of˺ their rage.

text_simple: وكذلك انزلناه ايات بينات وان الله يهدي من يريد
translation_en_yusufali: And so We revealed this ˹Quran˺ as clear verses. And Allah certainly guides whoever He wills.

text_simple: ان الذين امنوا والذين هادوا والصابئين والنصارى والمجوس والذين اشركوا ان الله يفصل بينهم يوم القيامة ان الله على كل شيء شهيد
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, the believers, Jews, Sabians, Christians, Magi, and the polytheists—Allah will judge between them ˹all˺ on Judgment Day. Surely Allah is a Witness over all things.

text_simple: الم تر ان الله يسجد له من في السماوات ومن في الارض والشمس والقمر والنجوم والجبال والشجر والدواب وكثير من الناس وكثير حق عليه العذاب ومن يهن الله فما له من مكرم ان الله يفعل ما يشاء
translation_en_yusufali: Do you not see that to Allah bow down ˹in submission˺ all those in the heavens and all those on the earth, as well as the sun, the moon, the stars, the mountains, the trees, and ˹all˺ living beings, as well as many humans, while many are deserving of punishment. And whoever Allah disgraces, none can honour. Surely Allah does what He wills.

text_simple: هذان خصمان اختصموا في ربهم فالذين كفروا قطعت لهم ثياب من نار يصب من فوق رءوسهم الحميم
translation_en_yusufali: These are two opposing groups that disagree about their Lord: as for the disbelievers, garments of Fire will be cut out for them and boiling water will be poured over their heads

text_simple: يصهر به ما في بطونهم والجلود
translation_en_yusufali: melting whatever is in their bellies, along with their skin.

text_simple: ولهم مقامع من حديد
translation_en_yusufali: And awaiting them are maces of iron.

text_simple: كلما ارادوا ان يخرجوا منها من غم اعيدوا فيها وذوقوا عذاب الحريق
translation_en_yusufali: Whenever they try to escape from Hell—out of anguish—they will be forced back into it, ˹and will be told,˺ “Taste the torment of burning!”

text_simple: ان الله يدخل الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات جنات تجري من تحتها الانهار يحلون فيها من اساور من ذهب ولؤلؤا ولباسهم فيها حرير
translation_en_yusufali: ˹But˺ Allah will surely admit those who believe and do good into Gardens, under which rivers flow, where they will be adorned with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their clothing will be silk

text_simple: وهدوا الى الطيب من القول وهدوا الى صراط الحميد
translation_en_yusufali: for they have been guided to the best of speech, and they have been guided to the Commendable Path.

text_simple: ان الذين كفروا ويصدون عن سبيل الله والمسجد الحرام الذي جعلناه للناس سواء العاكف فيه والباد ومن يرد فيه بالحاد بظلم نذقه من عذاب اليم
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, those who persist in disbelief and hinder ˹others˺ from the Way of Allah and from the Sacred Mosque—which We have appointed for all people, residents and visitors alike—along with whoever intends to deviate by doing wrong in it, We will cause them to taste a painful punishment.

text_simple: واذ بوانا لابراهيم مكان البيت ان لا تشرك بي شيئا وطهر بيتي للطائفين والقائمين والركع السجود
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when We assigned to Abraham the site of the House, ˹saying,˺ “Do not associate anything with Me ˹in worship˺ and purify My House for those who circle ˹the Ka’bah˺, stand ˹in prayer˺, and bow and prostrate themselves.

text_simple: واذن في الناس بالحج ياتوك رجالا وعلى كل ضامر ياتين من كل فج عميق
translation_en_yusufali: Call ˹all˺ people to the pilgrimage. They will come to you on foot and on every lean camel from every distant path

text_simple: ليشهدوا منافع لهم ويذكروا اسم الله في ايام معلومات على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الانعام فكلوا منها واطعموا البائس الفقير
translation_en_yusufali: so they may obtain the benefits ˹in store˺ for them, and pronounce the Name of Allah on appointed days over the sacrificial animals He has provided for them. So eat from their meat and feed the desperately poor.

text_simple: ثم ليقضوا تفثهم وليوفوا نذورهم وليطوفوا بالبيت العتيق
translation_en_yusufali: Then let them groom themselves, fulfil their vows, and circle the Ancient House.”

text_simple: ذلك ومن يعظم حرمات الله فهو خير له عند ربه واحلت لكم الانعام الا ما يتلى عليكم فاجتنبوا الرجس من الاوثان واجتنبوا قول الزور
translation_en_yusufali: That is so. And whoever honours the rituals of Allah, it is best for them in the sight of their Lord. The ˹meat of˺ cattle has been made lawful for you, except what has ˹already˺ been recited to you. So shun the impurity of idolatry, and shun words of falsehood.

text_simple: حنفاء لله غير مشركين به ومن يشرك بالله فكانما خر من السماء فتخطفه الطير او تهوي به الريح في مكان سحيق
translation_en_yusufali: Be upright ˹in devotion˺ to Allah, associating none with Him ˹in worship˺. For whoever associates ˹others˺ with Allah is like someone who has fallen from the sky and is either snatched away by birds or swept by the wind to a remote place.

text_simple: ذلك ومن يعظم شعائر الله فانها من تقوى القلوب
translation_en_yusufali: That is so. And whoever honours the symbols of Allah, it is certainly out of the piety of the heart.

text_simple: لكم فيها منافع الى اجل مسمى ثم محلها الى البيت العتيق
translation_en_yusufali: You may benefit from sacrificial animals for an appointed term, then their place of sacrifice is at the Ancient House.

text_simple: ولكل امة جعلنا منسكا ليذكروا اسم الله على ما رزقهم من بهيمة الانعام فالهكم اله واحد فله اسلموا وبشر المخبتين
translation_en_yusufali: For every community We appointed a rite of sacrifice so that they may pronounce the Name of Allah over the sacrificial animals He has provided for them. For your God is only One God, so submit yourselves to Him ˹alone˺. And give good news ˹O Prophet˺ to the humble:

text_simple: الذين اذا ذكر الله وجلت قلوبهم والصابرين على ما اصابهم والمقيمي الصلاة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون
translation_en_yusufali: those whose hearts tremble at the remembrance of Allah, who patiently endure whatever may befall them, and who establish prayer and donate from what We have provided for them.

text_simple: والبدن جعلناها لكم من شعائر الله لكم فيها خير فاذكروا اسم الله عليها صواف فاذا وجبت جنوبها فكلوا منها واطعموا القانع والمعتر كذلك سخرناها لكم لعلكم تشكرون
translation_en_yusufali: We have made sacrificial camels ˹and cattle˺ among the symbols of Allah, in which there is ˹much˺ good for you. So pronounce the Name of Allah over them when they are lined up ˹for sacrifice˺. Once they have fallen ˹lifeless˺ on their sides, you may eat from their meat, and feed the needy—those who do not beg, and those who do. In this way We have subjected these ˹animals˺ to you so that you may be grateful.

text_simple: لن ينال الله لحومها ولا دماؤها ولكن يناله التقوى منكم كذلك سخرها لكم لتكبروا الله على ما هداكم وبشر المحسنين
translation_en_yusufali: Neither their meat nor blood reaches Allah. Rather, it is your piety that reaches Him. This is how He has subjected them to you so that you may proclaim the greatness of Allah for what He has guided you to, and give good news to the good-doers.

text_simple: ان الله يدافع عن الذين امنوا ان الله لا يحب كل خوان كفور
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, Allah defends those who believe. Surely Allah does not like whoever is deceitful, ungrateful.

text_simple: اذن للذين يقاتلون بانهم ظلموا وان الله على نصرهم لقدير
translation_en_yusufali: Permission ˹to fight back˺ is ˹hereby˺ granted to those being fought, for they have been wronged. And Allah is truly Most Capable of helping them ˹prevail˺.

text_simple: الذين اخرجوا من ديارهم بغير حق الا ان يقولوا ربنا الله ولولا دفع الله الناس بعضهم ببعض لهدمت صوامع وبيع وصلوات ومساجد يذكر فيها اسم الله كثيرا ولينصرن الله من ينصره ان الله لقوي عزيز
translation_en_yusufali: ˹They are˺ those who have been expelled from their homes for no reason other than proclaiming: “Our Lord is Allah.” Had Allah not repelled ˹the aggression of˺ some people by means of others, destruction would have surely claimed monasteries, churches, synagogues, and mosques in which Allah’s Name is often mentioned. Allah will certainly help those who stand up for Him. Allah is truly All-Powerful, Almighty.

text_simple: الذين ان مكناهم في الارض اقاموا الصلاة واتوا الزكاة وامروا بالمعروف ونهوا عن المنكر ولله عاقبة الامور
translation_en_yusufali: ˹They are˺ those who, if established in the land by Us, would perform prayer, pay alms-tax, encourage what is good, and forbid what is evil. And with Allah rests the outcome of all affairs.

text_simple: وان يكذبوك فقد كذبت قبلهم قوم نوح وعاد وثمود
translation_en_yusufali: If they deny you ˹O Prophet˺, so did the people of Noah before them, as well as ˹the tribes of˺ ’Ȃd and Thamûd

text_simple: وقوم ابراهيم وقوم لوط
translation_en_yusufali: the people of Abraham, the people of Lot

text_simple: واصحاب مدين وكذب موسى فامليت للكافرين ثم اخذتهم فكيف كان نكير
translation_en_yusufali: and the residents of Midian. And Moses was denied ˹too˺. But I delayed ˹the fate of˺ the disbelievers ˹until their appointed time˺ then seized them. And how severe was My response!

text_simple: فكاين من قرية اهلكناها وهي ظالمة فهي خاوية على عروشها وبئر معطلة وقصر مشيد
translation_en_yusufali: Many are the societies We have destroyed for persisting in wrongdoing, leaving them in total ruin. ˹Many are˺ also the abandoned wells and lofty palaces!

text_simple: افلم يسيروا في الارض فتكون لهم قلوب يعقلون بها او اذان يسمعون بها فانها لا تعمى الابصار ولكن تعمى القلوب التي في الصدور
translation_en_yusufali: Have they not travelled throughout the land so their hearts may reason, and their ears may listen? Indeed, it is not the eyes that are blind, but it is the hearts in the chests that grow blind.

text_simple: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولن يخلف الله وعده وان يوما عند ربك كالف سنة مما تعدون
translation_en_yusufali: They challenge you ˹O Prophet˺ to hasten the torment. And Allah will never fail in His promise. But a day with your Lord is indeed like a thousand years by your counting.

text_simple: وكاين من قرية امليت لها وهي ظالمة ثم اخذتها والي المصير
translation_en_yusufali: Many are the societies whose end We delayed while they did wrong, then seized them. And to Me is the final return.

text_simple: قل يا ايها الناس انما انا لكم نذير مبين
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “O humanity! I am only sent to you with a clear warning.

text_simple: فالذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات لهم مغفرة ورزق كريم
translation_en_yusufali: So those who believe and do good will have forgiveness and an honourable provision.

text_simple: والذين سعوا في اياتنا معاجزين اولئك اصحاب الجحيم
translation_en_yusufali: But those who strive to discredit Our revelations, they will be the residents of the Hellfire.”

text_simple: وما ارسلنا من قبلك من رسول ولا نبي الا اذا تمنى القى الشيطان في امنيته فينسخ الله ما يلقي الشيطان ثم يحكم الله اياته والله عليم حكيم
translation_en_yusufali: Whenever We sent a messenger or a prophet before you ˹O Prophet˺ and he recited ˹Our revelations˺, Satan would influence ˹people’s understanding of˺ his recitation. But ˹eventually˺ Allah would eliminate Satan’s influence. Then Allah would ˹firmly˺ establish His revelations. And Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.

text_simple: ليجعل ما يلقي الشيطان فتنة للذين في قلوبهم مرض والقاسية قلوبهم وان الظالمين لفي شقاق بعيد
translation_en_yusufali: All that so He may make Satan’s influence a trial for those ˹hypocrites˺ whose hearts are sick and those ˹disbelievers˺ whose hearts are hardened. Surely the wrongdoers are totally engrossed in opposition.

text_simple: وليعلم الذين اوتوا العلم انه الحق من ربك فيؤمنوا به فتخبت له قلوبهم وان الله لهاد الذين امنوا الى صراط مستقيم
translation_en_yusufali: ˹This is˺ also so that those gifted with knowledge would know that this ˹revelation˺ is the truth from your Lord, so they have faith in it, and so their hearts would submit humbly to it. And Allah surely guides the believers to the Straight Path.

text_simple: ولا يزال الذين كفروا في مرية منه حتى تاتيهم الساعة بغتة او ياتيهم عذاب يوم عقيم
translation_en_yusufali: Yet the disbelievers will persist in doubt about this ˹revelation˺ until the Hour takes them by surprise, or the torment of a terminating Day comes to them.

text_simple: الملك يومئذ لله يحكم بينهم فالذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات في جنات النعيم
translation_en_yusufali: All authority on that Day is for Allah ˹alone˺. He will judge between them. So those who believe and do good will be in the Gardens of Bliss.

text_simple: والذين كفروا وكذبوا باياتنا فاولئك لهم عذاب مهين
translation_en_yusufali: But those who disbelieve and deny Our revelations, it is they who will suffer a humiliating punishment.

text_simple: والذين هاجروا في سبيل الله ثم قتلوا او ماتوا ليرزقنهم الله رزقا حسنا وان الله لهو خير الرازقين
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who emigrate in the cause of Allah and then are martyred or die, Allah will indeed grant them a good provision. Surely Allah is the Best Provider.

text_simple: ليدخلنهم مدخلا يرضونه وان الله لعليم حليم
translation_en_yusufali: He will certainly admit them into a place they will be pleased with. For Allah is truly All-Knowing, Most Forbearing.

text_simple: ذلك ومن عاقب بمثل ما عوقب به ثم بغي عليه لينصرنه الله ان الله لعفو غفور
translation_en_yusufali: That is so. And whoever retaliates in equivalence to the injury they have received, and then are wronged ˹again˺, Allah will certainly help them. Surely Allah is Ever-Pardoning, All-Forgiving.

text_simple: ذلك بان الله يولج الليل في النهار ويولج النهار في الليل وان الله سميع بصير
translation_en_yusufali: That is because Allah causes the night to merge into the day, and the day into the night. Indeed, Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

text_simple: ذلك بان الله هو الحق وان ما يدعون من دونه هو الباطل وان الله هو العلي الكبير
translation_en_yusufali: That is because Allah ˹alone˺ is the Truth and what they invoke besides Him is falsehood, and Allah ˹alone˺ is truly the Most High, All-Great.

text_simple: الم تر ان الله انزل من السماء ماء فتصبح الارض مخضرة ان الله لطيف خبير
translation_en_yusufali: Do you not see that Allah sends down rain from the sky, then the earth becomes green? Surely Allah is Most Subtle, All-Aware.

text_simple: له ما في السماوات وما في الارض وان الله لهو الغني الحميد
translation_en_yusufali: To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Allah ˹alone˺ is truly the Self-Sufficient, Praiseworthy.

text_simple: الم تر ان الله سخر لكم ما في الارض والفلك تجري في البحر بامره ويمسك السماء ان تقع على الارض الا باذنه ان الله بالناس لرءوف رحيم
translation_en_yusufali: Do you not see that Allah has subjected to you whatever is in the earth as well as the ships ˹that˺ sail through the sea by His command? He keeps the sky from falling down on the earth except by His permission. Surely Allah is Ever Gracious and Most Merciful to humanity.

text_simple: وهو الذي احياكم ثم يميتكم ثم يحييكم ان الانسان لكفور
translation_en_yusufali: And He is the One Who gave you life, then will cause you to die, and then will bring you back to life. ˹But˺ surely humankind is ever ungrateful.

text_simple: لكل امة جعلنا منسكا هم ناسكوه فلا ينازعنك في الامر وادع الى ربك انك لعلى هدى مستقيم
translation_en_yusufali: For every community We appointed a code of life to follow. So do not let them dispute with you ˹O Prophet˺ in this matter. And invite ˹all˺ to your Lord, for you are truly on the Right Guidance.

text_simple: وان جادلوك فقل الله اعلم بما تعملون
translation_en_yusufali: But if they argue with you, then say, “Allah knows best what you do.”

text_simple: الله يحكم بينكم يوم القيامة فيما كنتم فيه تختلفون
translation_en_yusufali: Allah will judge between you ˹all˺ on Judgment Day regarding your differences.

text_simple: الم تعلم ان الله يعلم ما في السماء والارض ان ذلك في كتاب ان ذلك على الله يسير
translation_en_yusufali: Do you not know that Allah ˹fully˺ knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth? Surely it is all ˹written˺ in a Record. That is certainly easy for Allah.

text_simple: ويعبدون من دون الله ما لم ينزل به سلطانا وما ليس لهم به علم وما للظالمين من نصير
