translation_en_yusufali: The people of Noah rejected the messengers

text_simple: اذ قال لهم اخوهم نوح الا تتقون
translation_en_yusufali: when their brother Noah said to them, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?

text_simple: اني لكم رسول امين
translation_en_yusufali: I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.

text_simple: فاتقوا الله واطيعون
translation_en_yusufali: So fear Allah, and obey me.

text_simple: وما اسالكم عليه من اجر ان اجري الا على رب العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.

text_simple: فاتقوا الله واطيعون
translation_en_yusufali: So fear Allah, and obey me.”

text_simple: قالوا انؤمن لك واتبعك الارذلون
translation_en_yusufali: They argued, “How can we believe in you, when you are followed ˹only˺ by the lowest of the low?”

text_simple: قال وما علمي بما كانوا يعملون
translation_en_yusufali: He responded, “And what knowledge do I have of what they do?

text_simple: ان حسابهم الا على ربي لو تشعرون
translation_en_yusufali: Their judgment is with my Lord, if you had any sense!

text_simple: وما انا بطارد المؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: I am not going to expel the believers.

text_simple: ان انا الا نذير مبين
translation_en_yusufali: I am only sent with a clear warning.”

text_simple: قالوا لئن لم تنته يا نوح لتكونن من المرجومين
translation_en_yusufali: They threatened, “If you do not desist, O  Noah, you will surely be stoned ˹to death˺.”

text_simple: قال رب ان قومي كذبون
translation_en_yusufali: Noah prayed, “My Lord! My people have truly rejected me.

text_simple: فافتح بيني وبينهم فتحا ونجني ومن معي من المؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: So judge between me and them decisively, and save me and the believers with me.”

text_simple: فانجيناه ومن معه في الفلك المشحون
translation_en_yusufali: So We saved him and those with him in the fully loaded Ark.

text_simple: ثم اغرقنا بعد الباقين
translation_en_yusufali: Then afterwards We drowned the rest.

text_simple: ان في ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.

text_simple: وان ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم
translation_en_yusufali: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.

text_simple: كذبت عاد المرسلين
translation_en_yusufali: The people of ’Âd rejected the messengers

text_simple: اذ قال لهم اخوهم هود الا تتقون
translation_en_yusufali: when their brother Hûd said to them, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?

text_simple: اني لكم رسول امين
translation_en_yusufali: I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.

text_simple: فاتقوا الله واطيعون
translation_en_yusufali: So fear Allah, and obey me.

text_simple: وما اسالكم عليه من اجر ان اجري الا على رب العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.

text_simple: اتبنون بكل ريع اية تعبثون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Why˺ do you build a landmark on every high place in vanity

text_simple: وتتخذون مصانع لعلكم تخلدون
translation_en_yusufali: and construct castles, as if you are going to live forever

text_simple: واذا بطشتم بطشتم جبارين
translation_en_yusufali: and act so viciously when you attack ˹others˺?

text_simple: فاتقوا الله واطيعون
translation_en_yusufali: So fear Allah, and obey me.

text_simple: واتقوا الذي امدكم بما تعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: Fear the One Who has provided you with ˹the good˺ things you know:

text_simple: امدكم بانعام وبنين
translation_en_yusufali: He provided you with cattle, and children

text_simple: وجنات وعيون
translation_en_yusufali: and gardens, and springs.

text_simple: اني اخاف عليكم عذاب يوم عظيم
translation_en_yusufali: I truly fear for you the torment of a tremendous day.”

text_simple: قالوا سواء علينا اوعظت ام لم تكن من الواعظين
translation_en_yusufali: They responded, “It is all the same to us whether you warn ˹us˺ or not.

text_simple: ان هذا الا خلق الاولين
translation_en_yusufali: This is simply the tradition of our predecessors.

text_simple: وما نحن بمعذبين
translation_en_yusufali: And we will never be punished.”

text_simple: فكذبوه فاهلكناهم ان في ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: So they rejected him, and ˹so˺ We destroyed them. Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.

text_simple: وان ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم
translation_en_yusufali: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.

text_simple: كذبت ثمود المرسلين
translation_en_yusufali: The people of Thamûd rejected the messengers

text_simple: اذ قال لهم اخوهم صالح الا تتقون
translation_en_yusufali: when their brother Ṣâliḥ said to them, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?

text_simple: اني لكم رسول امين
translation_en_yusufali: I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.

text_simple: فاتقوا الله واطيعون
translation_en_yusufali: So fear Allah, and obey me.

text_simple: وما اسالكم عليه من اجر ان اجري الا على رب العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.

text_simple: اتتركون في ما هاهنا امنين
translation_en_yusufali: Do you think you will be ˹forever˺ left secure in what you have here:

text_simple: في جنات وعيون
translation_en_yusufali: amid gardens and springs

text_simple: وزروع ونخل طلعها هضيم
translation_en_yusufali: and ˹various˺ crops, and palm trees ˹loaded˺ with tender fruit;

text_simple: وتنحتون من الجبال بيوتا فارهين
translation_en_yusufali: to carve homes in the mountains with great skill?

text_simple: فاتقوا الله واطيعون
translation_en_yusufali: So fear Allah, and obey me.

text_simple: ولا تطيعوا امر المسرفين
translation_en_yusufali: And do not follow the command of the transgressors

text_simple: الذين يفسدون في الارض ولا يصلحون
translation_en_yusufali: who spread corruption throughout the land, never setting things right.”

text_simple: قالوا انما انت من المسحرين
translation_en_yusufali: They replied, “You are simply bewitched!

text_simple: ما انت الا بشر مثلنا فات باية ان كنت من الصادقين
translation_en_yusufali: You are only a human being like us, so bring forth a sign if what you say is true.”

text_simple: قال هذه ناقة لها شرب ولكم شرب يوم معلوم
translation_en_yusufali: Ṣâliḥ said, “Here is a camel. She will have her turn to drink as you have yours, each on an appointed day.

text_simple: ولا تمسوها بسوء فياخذكم عذاب يوم عظيم
translation_en_yusufali: And do not ever touch her with harm, or you will be overtaken by the torment of a tremendous day.”

text_simple: فعقروها فاصبحوا نادمين
translation_en_yusufali: But they killed her, becoming regretful.

text_simple: فاخذهم العذاب ان في ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: So the punishment overtook them. Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.

text_simple: وان ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم
translation_en_yusufali: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.

text_simple: كذبت قوم لوط المرسلين
translation_en_yusufali: The people of Lot rejected the messengers

text_simple: اذ قال لهم اخوهم لوط الا تتقون
translation_en_yusufali: when their brother Lot said to them, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?

text_simple: اني لكم رسول امين
translation_en_yusufali: I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.

text_simple: فاتقوا الله واطيعون
translation_en_yusufali: So fear Allah, and obey me.

text_simple: وما اسالكم عليه من اجر ان اجري الا على رب العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.

text_simple: اتاتون الذكران من العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: Why do you ˹men˺ lust after fellow men

text_simple: وتذرون ما خلق لكم ربكم من ازواجكم بل انتم قوم عادون
translation_en_yusufali: leaving the wives that your Lord has created for you? In fact, you are a transgressing people.”

text_simple: قالوا لئن لم تنته يا لوط لتكونن من المخرجين
translation_en_yusufali: They threatened, “If you do not desist, O  Lot, you will surely be expelled.”

text_simple: قال اني لعملكم من القالين
translation_en_yusufali: Lot responded, “I am truly one of those who despise your ˹shameful˺ practice.

text_simple: رب نجني واهلي مما يعملون
translation_en_yusufali: My Lord! Save me and my family from ˹the consequences of˺ what they do.”

text_simple: فنجيناه واهله اجمعين
translation_en_yusufali: So We saved him and all of his family

text_simple: الا عجوزا في الغابرين
translation_en_yusufali: except an old woman, who was one of the doomed.

text_simple: ثم دمرنا الاخرين
translation_en_yusufali: Then We utterly destroyed the rest

text_simple: وامطرنا عليهم مطرا فساء مطر المنذرين
translation_en_yusufali: pouring upon them a rain ˹of brimstone˺. How evil was the rain of those who had been warned!

text_simple: ان في ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.

text_simple: وان ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم
translation_en_yusufali: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.

text_simple: كذب اصحاب الايكة المرسلين
translation_en_yusufali: The residents of the Forest rejected the messengers

text_simple: اذ قال لهم شعيب الا تتقون
translation_en_yusufali: when Shu’aib said to them, “Will you not fear ˹Allah˺?

text_simple: اني لكم رسول امين
translation_en_yusufali: I am truly a trustworthy messenger to you.

text_simple: فاتقوا الله واطيعون
translation_en_yusufali: So fear Allah, and obey me.

text_simple: وما اسالكم عليه من اجر ان اجري الا على رب العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: I do not ask you for any reward for this ˹message˺. My reward is only from the Lord of all worlds.

text_simple: اوفوا الكيل ولا تكونوا من المخسرين
translation_en_yusufali: Give full measure, and cause no loss ˹to others˺.

text_simple: وزنوا بالقسطاس المستقيم
translation_en_yusufali: Weigh with an even balance

text_simple: ولا تبخسوا الناس اشياءهم ولا تعثوا في الارض مفسدين
translation_en_yusufali: and do not defraud people of their property. Nor go about spreading corruption in the land.

text_simple: واتقوا الذي خلقكم والجبلة الاولين
translation_en_yusufali: And fear the One Who created you and ˹all˺ earlier peoples.”

text_simple: قالوا انما انت من المسحرين
translation_en_yusufali: They replied, “You are simply bewitched!

text_simple: وما انت الا بشر مثلنا وان نظنك لمن الكاذبين
translation_en_yusufali: Also, you are only a human being like us, and we think you are indeed a liar.

text_simple: فاسقط علينا كسفا من السماء ان كنت من الصادقين
translation_en_yusufali: So cause ˹deadly˺ pieces of the sky to fall upon us, if what you say is true.”

text_simple: قال ربي اعلم بما تعملون
translation_en_yusufali: Shu’aib responded, “My Lord knows best whatever you do.”

text_simple: فكذبوه فاخذهم عذاب يوم الظلة انه كان عذاب يوم عظيم
translation_en_yusufali: So they rejected him, and ˹so˺ were overtaken by the torment of the day of the ˹deadly˺ cloud. That was really a torment of a tremendous day.

text_simple: ان في ذلك لاية وما كان اكثرهم مؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: Surely in this is a sign. Yet most of them would not believe.

text_simple: وان ربك لهو العزيز الرحيم
translation_en_yusufali: And your Lord is certainly the Almighty, Most Merciful.

text_simple: وانه لتنزيل رب العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: This is certainly a revelation from the Lord of all worlds

text_simple: نزل به الروح الامين
translation_en_yusufali: which the trustworthy spirit ˹Gabriel˺ brought down

text_simple: على قلبك لتكون من المنذرين
translation_en_yusufali: into your heart ˹O Prophet˺—so that you may be one of the warners—

text_simple: بلسان عربي مبين
translation_en_yusufali: in a clear Arabic tongue.

text_simple: وانه لفي زبر الاولين
translation_en_yusufali: And it has indeed been ˹foretold˺ in the Scriptures of those before.

text_simple: اولم يكن لهم اية ان يعلمه علماء بني اسرائيل
translation_en_yusufali: Was it not sufficient proof for the deniers that it has been recognized by the knowledgeable among the Children of Israel?

text_simple: ولو نزلناه على بعض الاعجمين
translation_en_yusufali: Had We revealed it to a non-Arab

text_simple: فقراه عليهم ما كانوا به مؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: who would then recite it to the deniers ˹in fluent Arabic˺, still they would not have believed in it!

text_simple: كذلك سلكناه في قلوب المجرمين
translation_en_yusufali: This is how We allow denial ˹to steep˺ into the hearts of the wicked.

text_simple: لا يؤمنون به حتى يروا العذاب الاليم
translation_en_yusufali: They will not believe in it until they see the painful punishment

text_simple: فياتيهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون
translation_en_yusufali: which will take them by surprise when they least expect ˹it˺.

text_simple: فيقولوا هل نحن منظرون
translation_en_yusufali: Then they will cry, “Can we be allowed more time?”

text_simple: افبعذابنا يستعجلون
translation_en_yusufali: Do they ˹really˺ seek to hasten Our torment?

text_simple: افرايت ان متعناهم سنين
translation_en_yusufali: Imagine ˹O Prophet˺ if We allowed them enjoyment for years

text_simple: ثم جاءهم ما كانوا يوعدون
translation_en_yusufali: then there came to them what they had been threatened with:

text_simple: ما اغنى عنهم ما كانوا يمتعون
translation_en_yusufali: would that enjoyment be of any benefit to them ˹at all˺?

text_simple: وما اهلكنا من قرية الا لها منذرون
translation_en_yusufali: We have never destroyed a society without warners

text_simple: ذكرى وما كنا ظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: to remind ˹them˺, for We would never wrong ˹anyone˺.

text_simple: وما تنزلت به الشياطين
translation_en_yusufali: It was not the devils who brought this ˹Quran˺ down:

text_simple: وما ينبغي لهم وما يستطيعون
translation_en_yusufali: it is not for them ˹to do so˺, nor can they

text_simple: انهم عن السمع لمعزولون
translation_en_yusufali: for they are strictly barred from ˹even˺ overhearing ˹it˺.

text_simple: فلا تدع مع الله الها اخر فتكون من المعذبين
translation_en_yusufali: So do not ever call upon any other god besides Allah, or you will be one of the punished.

text_simple: وانذر عشيرتك الاقربين
translation_en_yusufali: And warn ˹all, starting with˺ your closest relatives

text_simple: واخفض جناحك لمن اتبعك من المؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: and be gracious to the believers who follow you.

text_simple: فان عصوك فقل اني بريء مما تعملون
translation_en_yusufali: But if they disobey you, say, “I am certainly free of what you do.”

text_simple: وتوكل على العزيز الرحيم
translation_en_yusufali: Put your trust in the Almighty, Most Merciful

text_simple: الذي يراك حين تقوم
translation_en_yusufali: Who sees you when you rise ˹for prayer at night˺

text_simple: وتقلبك في الساجدين
translation_en_yusufali: as well as your movements ˹in prayer˺ along with ˹fellow˺ worshippers.

text_simple: انه هو السميع العليم
translation_en_yusufali: He ˹alone˺ is indeed the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

text_simple: هل انبئكم على من تنزل الشياطين
translation_en_yusufali: Shall I inform you of whom the devils ˹actually˺ descend upon?

text_simple: تنزل على كل افاك اثيم
translation_en_yusufali: They descend upon every sinful liar

text_simple: يلقون السمع واكثرهم كاذبون
translation_en_yusufali: who gives an ˹attentive˺ ear ˹to half-truths˺, mostly passing on sheer lies.

text_simple: والشعراء يتبعهم الغاوون
translation_en_yusufali: As for poets, they are followed ˹merely˺ by deviants.

text_simple: الم تر انهم في كل واد يهيمون
translation_en_yusufali: Do you not see how they rant in every field

text_simple: وانهم يقولون ما لا يفعلون
translation_en_yusufali: only saying what they never do?

text_simple: الا الذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات وذكروا الله كثيرا وانتصروا من بعد ما ظلموا وسيعلم الذين ظلموا اي منقلب ينقلبون
translation_en_yusufali: Except those who believe, do good, remember Allah often, and ˹poetically˺ avenge ˹the believers˺ after being wrongfully slandered. The wrongdoers will come to know what ˹evil˺ end they will meet.

text_simple: طس تلك ايات القران وكتاب مبين
translation_en_yusufali: Ṭâ-Sĩn. These are the verses of the Quran; the clear Book.

text_simple: هدى وبشرى للمؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: ˹It is˺ a guide and good news for the believers:

text_simple: الذين يقيمون الصلاة ويؤتون الزكاة وهم بالاخرة هم يوقنون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹those˺ who establish prayer, pay alms-tax, and have sure faith in the Hereafter.

text_simple: ان الذين لا يؤمنون بالاخرة زينا لهم اعمالهم فهم يعمهون
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who do not believe in the Hereafter, We have certainly made their ˹evil˺ deeds appealing to them, so they wander blindly.

text_simple: اولئك الذين لهم سوء العذاب وهم في الاخرة هم الاخسرون
translation_en_yusufali: It is they who will suffer a dreadful torment, and in the Hereafter they will ˹truly˺ be the greatest losers.

text_simple: وانك لتلقى القران من لدن حكيم عليم
translation_en_yusufali: And indeed, you ˹O Prophet˺ are receiving the Quran from the One ˹Who is˺ All-Wise, All-Knowing.

text_simple: اذ قال موسى لاهله اني انست نارا ساتيكم منها بخبر او اتيكم بشهاب قبس لعلكم تصطلون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Remember˺ when Moses said to his family, “I have spotted a fire. I will either bring you some directions from there, or a burning torch so you may warm yourselves.”

text_simple: فلما جاءها نودي ان بورك من في النار ومن حولها وسبحان الله رب العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: But when he came to it, he was called ˹by Allah˺, “Blessed is the one at the fire, and whoever is around it! Glory be to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.

text_simple: يا موسى انه انا الله العزيز الحكيم
translation_en_yusufali: O  Moses! It is truly I. I am Allah—the Almighty, All-Wise.

text_simple: والق عصاك فلما راها تهتز كانها جان ولى مدبرا ولم يعقب يا موسى لا تخف اني لا يخاف لدي المرسلون
translation_en_yusufali: Now, throw down your staff!” But when he saw it slithering like a snake, he ran away without looking back. ˹Allah reassured him,˺ “O Moses! Do not be afraid! Messengers should have no fear in My presence.

text_simple: الا من ظلم ثم بدل حسنا بعد سوء فاني غفور رحيم
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Fear is˺ only for those who do wrong. But if they later mend ˹their˺ evil ˹ways˺ with good, then I am certainly All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

text_simple: وادخل يدك في جيبك تخرج بيضاء من غير سوء في تسع ايات الى فرعون وقومه انهم كانوا قوما فاسقين
translation_en_yusufali: Now put your hand through ˹the opening of˺ your collar, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished. ˹These are two˺ of nine signs for Pharaoh and his people. They have truly been a rebellious people.”

text_simple: فلما جاءتهم اياتنا مبصرة قالوا هذا سحر مبين
translation_en_yusufali: But when Our enlightening signs came to them, they said, “This is pure magic.”

text_simple: وجحدوا بها واستيقنتها انفسهم ظلما وعلوا فانظر كيف كان عاقبة المفسدين
translation_en_yusufali: And, although their hearts were convinced the signs were true, they still denied them wrongfully and arrogantly. See then what was the end of the corruptors!

text_simple: ولقد اتينا داوود وسليمان علما وقالا الحمد لله الذي فضلنا على كثير من عباده المؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, We granted knowledge to David and Solomon. And they said ˹in acknowledgment˺, “All praise is for Allah Who has privileged us over many of His faithful servants.”

text_simple: وورث سليمان داوود وقال يا ايها الناس علمنا منطق الطير واوتينا من كل شيء ان هذا لهو الفضل المبين
translation_en_yusufali: And David was succeeded by Solomon, who said, “O people! We have been taught the language of birds, and been given everything ˹we need˺. This is indeed a great privilege.”

text_simple: وحشر لسليمان جنوده من الجن والانس والطير فهم يوزعون
translation_en_yusufali: Solomon’s forces of jinn, humans, and birds were rallied for him, perfectly organized.

text_simple: حتى اذا اتوا على واد النمل قالت نملة يا ايها النمل ادخلوا مساكنكم لا يحطمنكم سليمان وجنوده وهم لا يشعرون
translation_en_yusufali: And when they came across a valley of ants, an ant warned, “O ants! Go quickly into your homes so Solomon and his armies do not crush you, unknowingly.”

text_simple: فتبسم ضاحكا من قولها وقال رب اوزعني ان اشكر نعمتك التي انعمت علي وعلى والدي وان اعمل صالحا ترضاه وادخلني برحمتك في عبادك الصالحين
translation_en_yusufali: So Solomon smiled in amusement at her words, and prayed, “My Lord! Inspire me to ˹always˺ be thankful for Your favours which You have blessed me and my parents with, and to do good deeds that please you. Admit me, by Your mercy, into ˹the company of˺ Your righteous servants.”

text_simple: وتفقد الطير فقال ما لي لا ارى الهدهد ام كان من الغائبين
translation_en_yusufali: ˹One day˺ he inspected the birds, and wondered, “Why is it that I cannot see the hoopoe? Or could he be absent?

text_simple: لاعذبنه عذابا شديدا او لاذبحنه او لياتيني بسلطان مبين
translation_en_yusufali: I will surely subject him to a severe punishment, or ˹even˺ slaughter him, unless he brings me a compelling excuse.”

text_simple: فمكث غير بعيد فقال احطت بما لم تحط به وجئتك من سبا بنبا يقين
translation_en_yusufali: It was not long before the bird came and said, “I have found out something you do not know. I have just come to you from Sheba with sure news.

text_simple: اني وجدت امراة تملكهم واوتيت من كل شيء ولها عرش عظيم
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, I found a woman ruling over them, who has been given everything ˹she needs˺, and who has a magnificent throne.

text_simple: وجدتها وقومها يسجدون للشمس من دون الله وزين لهم الشيطان اعمالهم فصدهم عن السبيل فهم لا يهتدون
translation_en_yusufali: I found her and her people prostrating to the sun instead of Allah. For Satan has made their deeds appealing to them—hindering them from the ˹Right˺ Way and leaving them unguided—

text_simple: الا يسجدوا لله الذي يخرج الخبء في السماوات والارض ويعلم ما تخفون وما تعلنون
translation_en_yusufali: so they do not prostrate to Allah, Who brings forth what is hidden in the heavens and the earth, and knows what you ˹all˺ conceal and what you reveal.

text_simple: الله لا اله الا هو رب العرش العظيم
translation_en_yusufali: ˹He is˺ Allah! There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him, the Lord of the Mighty Throne.”

text_simple: قال سننظر اصدقت ام كنت من الكاذبين
translation_en_yusufali: Solomon said, “We will see whether you are telling the truth or lying.

text_simple: اذهب بكتابي هذا فالقه اليهم ثم تول عنهم فانظر ماذا يرجعون
translation_en_yusufali: Go with this letter of mine and deliver it to them, then stand aside and see how they will respond.”

text_simple: قالت يا ايها الملا اني القي الي كتاب كريم
translation_en_yusufali: The Queen ˹later˺ announced, “O chiefs! Indeed, a noble letter has been delivered to me.

text_simple: انه من سليمان وانه بسم الله الرحمن الرحيم
translation_en_yusufali: It is from Solomon, and it reads: ‘In the Name of Allah—the Most Compassionate, Most Merciful.

text_simple: الا تعلوا علي واتوني مسلمين
translation_en_yusufali: Do not be arrogant with me, but come to me, fully submitting ˹to Allah˺.’”

text_simple: قالت يا ايها الملا افتوني في امري ما كنت قاطعة امرا حتى تشهدون
translation_en_yusufali: She said, “O chiefs! Advise me in this matter of mine, for I would never make any decision without you.”

text_simple: قالوا نحن اولو قوة واولو باس شديد والامر اليك فانظري ماذا تامرين
translation_en_yusufali: They responded, “We are a people of strength and great ˹military˺ might, but the decision is yours, so decide what you will command.”

text_simple: قالت ان الملوك اذا دخلوا قرية افسدوها وجعلوا اعزة اهلها اذلة وكذلك يفعلون
translation_en_yusufali: She reasoned, “Indeed, when kings invade a land, they ruin it and debase its nobles. They really do so!

text_simple: واني مرسلة اليهم بهدية فناظرة بم يرجع المرسلون
translation_en_yusufali: But I will certainly send him a gift, and see what ˹response˺ my envoys will return with.”

text_simple: فلما جاء سليمان قال اتمدونن بمال فما اتاني الله خير مما اتاكم بل انتم بهديتكم تفرحون
translation_en_yusufali: When the chief-envoy came to him, Solomon said, “Do you offer me wealth? What Allah has granted me is far greater than what He has granted you. No! It is you who rejoice in ˹receiving˺ gifts.

text_simple: ارجع اليهم فلناتينهم بجنود لا قبل لهم بها ولنخرجنهم منها اذلة وهم صاغرون
translation_en_yusufali: Go back to them, for we will certainly mobilize against them forces which they can never resist, and we will drive them out from there in disgrace, fully humbled.”

text_simple: قال يا ايها الملا ايكم ياتيني بعرشها قبل ان ياتوني مسلمين
translation_en_yusufali: Solomon asked, “O chiefs! Which of you can bring me her throne before they come to me in ˹full˺ submission?”

text_simple: قال عفريت من الجن انا اتيك به قبل ان تقوم من مقامك واني عليه لقوي امين
translation_en_yusufali: One mighty jinn responded, “I can bring it to you before you rise from this council of yours. And I am quite strong and trustworthy for this ˹task˺.”

text_simple: قال الذي عنده علم من الكتاب انا اتيك به قبل ان يرتد اليك طرفك فلما راه مستقرا عنده قال هذا من فضل ربي ليبلوني ااشكر ام اكفر ومن شكر فانما يشكر لنفسه ومن كفر فان ربي غني كريم
translation_en_yusufali: But the one who had knowledge of the Scripture said, “I can bring it to you in the blink of an eye.” So when Solomon saw it placed before him, he exclaimed, “This is by the grace of my Lord to test me whether I am grateful or ungrateful. And whoever is grateful, it is only for their own good. But whoever is ungrateful, surely my Lord is Self-Sufficient, Most Generous.”

text_simple: قال نكروا لها عرشها ننظر اتهتدي ام تكون من الذين لا يهتدون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Then˺ Solomon said, “Disguise her throne for her so we may see whether she will recognize ˹it˺ or she will not be able to.”

text_simple: فلما جاءت قيل اهكذا عرشك قالت كانه هو واوتينا العلم من قبلها وكنا مسلمين
translation_en_yusufali: So when she arrived, it was said ˹to her˺, “Is your throne like this?” She replied, “It looks to be the same. We have ˹already˺ received knowledge ˹of Solomon’s prophethood˺ before this ˹miracle˺, and have submitted ˹to Allah˺.”

text_simple: وصدها ما كانت تعبد من دون الله انها كانت من قوم كافرين
translation_en_yusufali: But she had been hindered by what she used to worship instead of Allah, for she was indeed from a disbelieving people.

text_simple: قيل لها ادخلي الصرح فلما راته حسبته لجة وكشفت عن ساقيها قال انه صرح ممرد من قوارير قالت رب اني ظلمت نفسي واسلمت مع سليمان لله رب العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: Then she was told, “Enter the palace.” But when she saw the hall, she thought it was a body of water, so she bared her legs. Solomon said. “It is just a palace paved with crystal.” ˹At last˺ she declared, “My Lord! I have certainly wronged my soul. Now I ˹fully˺ submit myself along with Solomon to Allah, the Lord of all worlds.”

text_simple: ولقد ارسلنا الى ثمود اخاهم صالحا ان اعبدوا الله فاذا هم فريقان يختصمون
translation_en_yusufali: And We certainly sent to the people of Thamûd their brother Ṣâliḥ, proclaiming, “Worship Allah,” but they suddenly split into two opposing groups.

text_simple: قال يا قوم لم تستعجلون بالسيئة قبل الحسنة لولا تستغفرون الله لعلكم ترحمون
translation_en_yusufali: He urged ˹the disbelieving group˺, “O my people! Why do you ˹seek to˺ hasten the torment rather than grace? If only you sought Allah’s forgiveness so you may be shown mercy!”

text_simple: قالوا اطيرنا بك وبمن معك قال طائركم عند الله بل انتم قوم تفتنون
translation_en_yusufali: They replied, “You and your followers are a bad omen for us.” He responded, “Your omens are destined by Allah. In fact, you are ˹only˺ a people being tested.”

text_simple: وكان في المدينة تسعة رهط يفسدون في الارض ولا يصلحون
translation_en_yusufali: And there were in the city nine ˹elite˺ men who spread corruption in the land, never doing what is right.

text_simple: قالوا تقاسموا بالله لنبيتنه واهله ثم لنقولن لوليه ما شهدنا مهلك اهله وانا لصادقون
translation_en_yusufali: They vowed, “Let us swear by Allah that we will take him and his family down by night. Then we will certainly say to his ˹closest˺ heirs, ‘We did not witness the murder of his family. We are definitely telling the truth.’”

text_simple: ومكروا مكرا ومكرنا مكرا وهم لا يشعرون
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹so˺ they made a plan, but We too made a plan, while they were unaware.

text_simple: فانظر كيف كان عاقبة مكرهم انا دمرناهم وقومهم اجمعين
translation_en_yusufali: See then what the consequences of their plan were: We ˹utterly˺ destroyed them and their people all together.

text_simple: فتلك بيوتهم خاوية بما ظلموا ان في ذلك لاية لقوم يعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: So their homes are there, ˹but completely˺ ruined because of their wrongdoing. Surely in this is a lesson for people of knowledge.

text_simple: وانجينا الذين امنوا وكانوا يتقون
translation_en_yusufali: And We delivered those who were faithful and were mindful ˹of Allah˺.

text_simple: ولوطا اذ قال لقومه اتاتون الفاحشة وانتم تبصرون
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ Lot, when he rebuked ˹the men of˺ his people, “Do you commit that shameful deed while you can see ˹one another˺?

text_simple: ائنكم لتاتون الرجال شهوة من دون النساء بل انتم قوم تجهلون
translation_en_yusufali: Do you really lust after men instead of women? In fact, you are ˹only˺ a people acting ignorantly.”

text_simple: فما كان جواب قومه الا ان قالوا اخرجوا ال لوط من قريتكم انهم اناس يتطهرون
translation_en_yusufali: But his people’s only response was to say, “Expel Lot’s followers from your land! They are a people who wish to remain chaste!”

text_simple: فانجيناه واهله الا امراته قدرناها من الغابرين
translation_en_yusufali: So We delivered him and his family, except his wife. We had destined her to be one of the doomed.

text_simple: وامطرنا عليهم مطرا فساء مطر المنذرين
translation_en_yusufali: And We poured upon them a rain ˹of brimstone˺. How evil was the rain of those who had been warned!

text_simple: قل الحمد لله وسلام على عباده الذين اصطفى الله خير اما يشركون
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Praise be to Allah, and peace be upon the servants He has chosen.” ˹Ask the disbelievers,˺ “Which is better: Allah or whatever ˹gods˺ they associate ˹with Him˺?”

text_simple: امن خلق السماوات والارض وانزل لكم من السماء ماء فانبتنا به حدائق ذات بهجة ما كان لكم ان تنبتوا شجرها االه مع الله بل هم قوم يعدلون
translation_en_yusufali: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who created the heavens and the earth, and sends down rain for you from the sky, by which We cause delightful gardens to grow? You could never cause their trees to grow. Was it another god besides Allah?” Absolutely not! But they are a people who set up equals ˹to Allah˺!

text_simple: امن جعل الارض قرارا وجعل خلالها انهارا وجعل لها رواسي وجعل بين البحرين حاجزا االه مع الله بل اكثرهم لا يعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who made the earth a place of settlement, caused rivers to flow through it, placed firm mountains upon it, and set a barrier between ˹fresh and salt˺ bodies of water? Was it another god besides Allah?” Absolutely not! But most of them do not know.

text_simple: امن يجيب المضطر اذا دعاه ويكشف السوء ويجعلكم خلفاء الارض االه مع الله قليلا ما تذكرون
translation_en_yusufali: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who responds to the distressed when they cry to Him, relieving ˹their˺ affliction, and ˹Who˺ makes you successors in the earth? Is it another god besides Allah? Yet you are hardly mindful!”

text_simple: امن يهديكم في ظلمات البر والبحر ومن يرسل الرياح بشرا بين يدي رحمته االه مع الله تعالى الله عما يشركون
translation_en_yusufali: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who guides you in the darkness of the land and sea, and sends the winds ushering in His mercy? Is it another god besides Allah? Exalted is Allah above what they associate ˹with Him˺!

text_simple: امن يبدا الخلق ثم يعيده ومن يرزقكم من السماء والارض االه مع الله قل هاتوا برهانكم ان كنتم صادقين
translation_en_yusufali: Or ˹ask them,˺ “Who originates the creation then resurrects it, and gives you provisions from the heavens and the earth? Is it another god besides Allah?” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Show ˹me˺ your proof, if what you say is true.”

text_simple: قل لا يعلم من في السماوات والارض الغيب الا الله وما يشعرون ايان يبعثون
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “None in the heavens and the earth has knowledge of the unseen except Allah. Nor do they know when they will be resurrected.

text_simple: بل ادارك علمهم في الاخرة بل هم في شك منها بل هم منها عمون
translation_en_yusufali: No! Their knowledge of the Hereafter amounts to ignorance. In fact, they are in doubt about it. In truth, they are ˹totally˺ blind to it.

text_simple: وقال الذين كفروا ااذا كنا ترابا واباؤنا ائنا لمخرجون
translation_en_yusufali: The disbelievers ask, “When we and our fathers are reduced to dust, will we really be brought forth ˹alive˺?

text_simple: لقد وعدنا هذا نحن واباؤنا من قبل ان هذا الا اساطير الاولين
translation_en_yusufali: We have already been promised this, as well as our forefathers earlier. This is nothing but ancient fables!”

text_simple: قل سيروا في الارض فانظروا كيف كان عاقبة المجرمين
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Travel throughout the land and see the fate of the wicked.”

text_simple: ولا تحزن عليهم ولا تكن في ضيق مما يمكرون
translation_en_yusufali: Do not grieve for them, nor be distressed by their schemes.

text_simple: ويقولون متى هذا الوعد ان كنتم صادقين
translation_en_yusufali: They ask ˹the believers˺, “When will this threat come to pass, if what you say is true?”

text_simple: قل عسى ان يكون ردف لكم بعض الذي تستعجلون
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Perhaps some of what you seek to hasten is close at hand.”

text_simple: وان ربك لذو فضل على الناس ولكن اكثرهم لا يشكرون
translation_en_yusufali: Surely your Lord is ever Bountiful to humanity, but most of them are ungrateful.

text_simple: وان ربك ليعلم ما تكن صدورهم وما يعلنون
translation_en_yusufali: And surely your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they reveal.

text_simple: وما من غائبة في السماء والارض الا في كتاب مبين
translation_en_yusufali: For there is nothing hidden in the heavens or the earth without being ˹written˺ in a perfect Record.

text_simple: ان هذا القران يقص على بني اسرائيل اكثر الذي هم فيه يختلفون
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, this Quran clarifies for the Children of Israel most of what they differ over.

text_simple: وانه لهدى ورحمة للمؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: And it is truly a guide and mercy for the believers.

text_simple: ان ربك يقضي بينهم بحكمه وهو العزيز العليم
translation_en_yusufali: Your Lord will certainly judge between them by His justice, for He is the Almighty, All-Knowing.

text_simple: فتوكل على الله انك على الحق المبين
translation_en_yusufali: So put your trust in Allah, for you are surely upon the ˹Path of˺ clear truth.

text_simple: انك لا تسمع الموتى ولا تسمع الصم الدعاء اذا ولوا مدبرين
translation_en_yusufali: You certainly cannot make the dead hear ˹the truth˺. Nor can you make the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs and walk away.

text_simple: وما انت بهادي العمي عن ضلالتهم ان تسمع الا من يؤمن باياتنا فهم مسلمون
translation_en_yusufali: Nor can you lead the blind out of their misguidance. You can make none hear ˹the truth˺ except those who believe in Our revelations, ˹fully˺ submitting ˹to Allah˺.

text_simple: واذا وقع القول عليهم اخرجنا لهم دابة من الارض تكلمهم ان الناس كانوا باياتنا لا يوقنون
translation_en_yusufali: And when the decree ˹of the Hour˺ comes to pass against them, We will bring forth for them a beast from the earth, telling them that the people had no sure faith in Our revelations.

text_simple: ويوم نحشر من كل امة فوجا ممن يكذب باياتنا فهم يوزعون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Watch for˺ the Day We will gather from every faith-community a group of those who denied Our revelations, and they will be driven in ranks.

text_simple: حتى اذا جاءوا قال اكذبتم باياتي ولم تحيطوا بها علما اماذا كنتم تعملون
translation_en_yusufali: When they ˹finally˺ come before their Lord, He will ask ˹them˺, “Did you deny My revelations without ˹even˺ comprehending them? Or what ˹exactly˺ did you do?”

text_simple: ووقع القول عليهم بما ظلموا فهم لا ينطقون
translation_en_yusufali: And the decree ˹of torment˺ will be justified against them for their wrongdoing, leaving them speechless.

text_simple: الم يروا انا جعلنا الليل ليسكنوا فيه والنهار مبصرا ان في ذلك لايات لقوم يؤمنون
translation_en_yusufali: Do they not see that We made the night for them to rest in and the day bright? Surely in this are signs for those who believe.

text_simple: ويوم ينفخ في الصور ففزع من في السماوات ومن في الارض الا من شاء الله وكل اتوه داخرين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹beware of˺ the Day the Trumpet will be blown, and all those in the heavens and all those on the earth will be horrified ˹to the point of death˺, except those Allah wills ˹to spare˺. And all will come before Him, fully humbled.

text_simple: وترى الجبال تحسبها جامدة وهي تمر مر السحاب صنع الله الذي اتقن كل شيء انه خبير بما تفعلون
translation_en_yusufali: Now you see the mountains, thinking they are firmly fixed, but they are travelling ˹just˺ like clouds. ˹That is˺ the design of Allah, Who has perfected everything. Surely He is All-Aware of what you do.

text_simple: من جاء بالحسنة فله خير منها وهم من فزع يومئذ امنون
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever comes with a good deed will be rewarded with what is better, and they will be secure from the horror on that Day.

text_simple: ومن جاء بالسيئة فكبت وجوههم في النار هل تجزون الا ما كنتم تعملون
translation_en_yusufali: And whoever comes with an evil deed will be hurled face-first into the Fire. Are you rewarded except for what you used to do?

text_simple: انما امرت ان اعبد رب هذه البلدة الذي حرمها وله كل شيء وامرت ان اكون من المسلمين
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I have only been commanded to worship the Lord of this city ˹of Mecca˺, Who has made it sacred, and to Him belongs everything. And I am commanded to be one of those who ˹fully˺ submit ˹to Him˺

text_simple: وان اتلو القران فمن اهتدى فانما يهتدي لنفسه ومن ضل فقل انما انا من المنذرين
translation_en_yusufali: and to recite the Quran.” Then whoever chooses to be guided, it is only for their own good. But whoever chooses to stray, say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “I am only a warner.”

text_simple: وقل الحمد لله سيريكم اياته فتعرفونها وما ربك بغافل عما تعملون
translation_en_yusufali: And say, “All praise is for Allah! He will show you His signs, and you will recognize them. And your Lord is never unaware of what you do.”

text_simple: طسم
translation_en_yusufali: Ṭâ-Sĩn-Mĩm.

text_simple: تلك ايات الكتاب المبين
translation_en_yusufali: These are the verses of the clear Book.

text_simple: نتلو عليك من نبا موسى وفرعون بالحق لقوم يؤمنون
translation_en_yusufali: We narrate to you ˹O Prophet˺ part of the story of Moses and Pharaoh in truth for people who believe.

text_simple: ان فرعون علا في الارض وجعل اهلها شيعا يستضعف طائفة منهم يذبح ابناءهم ويستحيي نساءهم انه كان من المفسدين
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, Pharaoh ˹arrogantly˺ elevated himself in the land and divided its people into ˹subservient˺ groups, one of which he persecuted, slaughtering their sons and keeping their women. He was truly one of the corruptors.

text_simple: ونريد ان نمن على الذين استضعفوا في الارض ونجعلهم ائمة ونجعلهم الوارثين
translation_en_yusufali: But it was Our Will to favour those who were oppressed in the land, making them models ˹of faith˺ as well as successors;

text_simple: ونمكن لهم في الارض ونري فرعون وهامان وجنودهما منهم ما كانوا يحذرون
translation_en_yusufali: and to establish them in the land; and through them show Pharaoh, Hamân, and their soldiers ˹the fulfilment of˺ what they feared.

text_simple: واوحينا الى ام موسى ان ارضعيه فاذا خفت عليه فالقيه في اليم ولا تخافي ولا تحزني انا رادوه اليك وجاعلوه من المرسلين
translation_en_yusufali: We inspired the mother of Moses: “Nurse him, but when you fear for him, put him then into the river, and do not fear or grieve. We will certainly return him to you, and make him one of the messengers.”

text_simple: فالتقطه ال فرعون ليكون لهم عدوا وحزنا ان فرعون وهامان وجنودهما كانوا خاطئين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹it so happened that˺ Pharaoh’s people picked him up, only to become their enemy and source of grief. Surely Pharaoh, Hamân, and their soldiers were sinful.

text_simple: وقالت امرات فرعون قرت عين لي ولك لا تقتلوه عسى ان ينفعنا او نتخذه ولدا وهم لا يشعرون
translation_en_yusufali: Pharaoh’s wife said ˹to him˺, “˹This baby is˺ a source of joy for me and you. Do not kill him. Perhaps he may be useful to us or we may adopt him as a son.” They were unaware ˹of what was to come˺.

text_simple: واصبح فؤاد ام موسى فارغا ان كادت لتبدي به لولا ان ربطنا على قلبها لتكون من المؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: And the heart of Moses’ mother ached so much that she almost gave away his identity, had We not reassured her heart in order for her to have faith ˹in Allah’s promise˺.

text_simple: وقالت لاخته قصيه فبصرت به عن جنب وهم لا يشعرون
translation_en_yusufali: And she said to his sister, “Keep track of him!” So she watched him from a distance, while they were unaware.

text_simple: وحرمنا عليه المراضع من قبل فقالت هل ادلكم على اهل بيت يكفلونه لكم وهم له ناصحون
translation_en_yusufali: And We had caused him to refuse all wet-nurses at first, so his sister suggested, “Shall I direct you to a family who will bring him up for you and take good care of him?”

text_simple: فرددناه الى امه كي تقر عينها ولا تحزن ولتعلم ان وعد الله حق ولكن اكثرهم لا يعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: This is how We returned him to his mother so that her heart would be put at ease, and not grieve, and that she would know that Allah’s promise is ˹always˺ true. But most people do not know.

text_simple: ولما بلغ اشده واستوى اتيناه حكما وعلما وكذلك نجزي المحسنين
translation_en_yusufali: And when he reached full strength and maturity, We gave him wisdom and knowledge. This is how We reward the good-doers.

text_simple: ودخل المدينة على حين غفلة من اهلها فوجد فيها رجلين يقتتلان هذا من شيعته وهذا من عدوه فاستغاثه الذي من شيعته على الذي من عدوه فوكزه موسى فقضى عليه قال هذا من عمل الشيطان انه عدو مضل مبين
translation_en_yusufali: ˹One day˺ he entered the city unnoticed by its people. There he found two men fighting: one of his own people, and the other of his enemies. The man from his people called to him for help against his foe. So Moses punched him, causing his death. Moses cried, “This is from Satan’s handiwork. He is certainly a sworn, misleading enemy.”

text_simple: قال رب اني ظلمت نفسي فاغفر لي فغفر له انه هو الغفور الرحيم
translation_en_yusufali: He pleaded, “My Lord! I have definitely wronged my soul, so forgive me.” So He forgave him, ˹for˺ He is indeed the All-Forgiving, Most Merciful.

text_simple: قال رب بما انعمت علي فلن اكون ظهيرا للمجرمين
translation_en_yusufali: Moses pledged, “My Lord! For all Your favours upon me, I will never side with the wicked.”

text_simple: فاصبح في المدينة خائفا يترقب فاذا الذي استنصره بالامس يستصرخه قال له موسى انك لغوي مبين
translation_en_yusufali: And so Moses became fearful, watching out in the city, when suddenly the one who sought his help the day before cried out to him again for help. Moses rebuked him, “Indeed, you are clearly a trouble-maker.”

text_simple: فلما ان اراد ان يبطش بالذي هو عدو لهما قال يا موسى اتريد ان تقتلني كما قتلت نفسا بالامس ان تريد الا ان تكون جبارا في الارض وما تريد ان تكون من المصلحين
translation_en_yusufali: Then when Moses was about to lay his hands on their foe, the enemy said, “O Moses! Do you intend to kill me as you killed a man yesterday? You only want to be a tyrant in the land. You do not intend to make peace!”

text_simple: وجاء رجل من اقصى المدينة يسعى قال يا موسى ان الملا ياتمرون بك ليقتلوك فاخرج اني لك من الناصحين
translation_en_yusufali: And there came a man, rushing from the farthest end of the city. He said, “O Moses! The chiefs are actually conspiring against you to put you to death, so leave ˹the city˺. I really advise you ˹to do so˺.”

text_simple: فخرج منها خائفا يترقب قال رب نجني من القوم الظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: So Moses left the city in a state of fear and caution, praying, “My Lord! Deliver me from the wrongdoing people.”

text_simple: ولما توجه تلقاء مدين قال عسى ربي ان يهديني سواء السبيل
translation_en_yusufali: And as he made his way towards Midian, he said, “I trust my Lord will guide me to the right way.”

text_simple: ولما ورد ماء مدين وجد عليه امة من الناس يسقون ووجد من دونهم امراتين تذودان قال ما خطبكما قالتا لا نسقي حتى يصدر الرعاء وابونا شيخ كبير
translation_en_yusufali: When he arrived at the well of Midian, he found a group of people watering ˹their herds˺. Apart from them, he noticed two women holding back ˹their herd˺. He asked ˹them˺, “What is the problem?” They replied, “We cannot water ˹our animals˺ until the ˹other˺ shepherds are done, for our father is a very old man.”

text_simple: فسقى لهما ثم تولى الى الظل فقال رب اني لما انزلت الي من خير فقير
translation_en_yusufali: So he watered ˹their herd˺ for them, then withdrew to the shade and prayed, “My Lord! I am truly in ˹desperate˺ need of whatever provision You may have in store for me.”

text_simple: فجاءته احداهما تمشي على استحياء قالت ان ابي يدعوك ليجزيك اجر ما سقيت لنا فلما جاءه وقص عليه القصص قال لا تخف نجوت من القوم الظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: Then one of the two women came to him, walking bashfully. She said, “My father is inviting you so he may reward you for watering ˹our animals˺ for us.” When Moses came to him and told him his whole story, the old man said, “Have no fear! You are ˹now˺ safe from the wrongdoing people.”

text_simple: قالت احداهما يا ابت استاجره ان خير من استاجرت القوي الامين
translation_en_yusufali: One of the two daughters suggested, “O my dear father! Hire him. The best man for employment is definitely the strong and trustworthy ˹one˺.”

text_simple: قال اني اريد ان انكحك احدى ابنتي هاتين على ان تاجرني ثماني حجج فان اتممت عشرا فمن عندك وما اريد ان اشق عليك ستجدني ان شاء الله من الصالحين
translation_en_yusufali: The old man proposed, “I wish to marry one of these two daughters of mine to you, provided that you stay in my service for eight years. If you complete ten, it will be ˹a favour˺ from you, but I do not wish to make it difficult for you. Allah willing, you will find me an agreeable man.”

text_simple: قال ذلك بيني وبينك ايما الاجلين قضيت فلا عدوان علي والله على ما نقول وكيل
translation_en_yusufali: Moses responded, “˹Then˺ it is ˹settled˺ between you and I. Whichever term I fulfill, there will be no ˹further˺ obligation on me. And Allah is a Witness to what we say.”

text_simple: فلما قضى موسى الاجل وسار باهله انس من جانب الطور نارا قال لاهله امكثوا اني انست نارا لعلي اتيكم منها بخبر او جذوة من النار لعلكم تصطلون
translation_en_yusufali: When Moses had completed the term and was travelling with his family, he spotted a fire on the side of Mount Ṭûr. He said to his family, “Stay here, ˹for˺ I have spotted a fire. Perhaps from there I can bring you some directions or a torch from the fire so you may warm yourselves.”

text_simple: فلما اتاها نودي من شاطئ الواد الايمن في البقعة المباركة من الشجرة ان يا موسى اني انا الله رب العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: But when he came to it, he was called from the bush in the sacred ground to the right side of the valley: “O Moses! It is truly I. I am Allah—the Lord of all worlds.

text_simple: وان الق عصاك فلما راها تهتز كانها جان ولى مدبرا ولم يعقب يا موسى اقبل ولا تخف انك من الامنين
translation_en_yusufali: Now, throw down your staff!” But when he saw it slithering like a snake, he ran away without looking back. ˹Allah reassured him,˺ “O Moses! Draw near, and have no fear. You are perfectly secure.

text_simple: اسلك يدك في جيبك تخرج بيضاء من غير سوء واضمم اليك جناحك من الرهب فذانك برهانان من ربك الى فرعون وملئه انهم كانوا قوما فاسقين
translation_en_yusufali: Now put your hand through ˹the opening of˺ your collar, it will come out ˹shining˺ white, unblemished. And cross your arms tightly to calm your fears. These are two proofs from your Lord to Pharaoh and his chiefs. They have truly been a rebellious people.”

text_simple: قال رب اني قتلت منهم نفسا فاخاف ان يقتلون
translation_en_yusufali: Moses appealed, “My Lord! I have indeed killed a man from them, so I fear they may kill me.

text_simple: واخي هارون هو افصح مني لسانا فارسله معي ردءا يصدقني اني اخاف ان يكذبون
translation_en_yusufali: And my brother Aaron is more eloquent than I, so send him with me as a helper to support what I say, for I truly fear they may reject me.”

text_simple: قال سنشد عضدك باخيك ونجعل لكما سلطانا فلا يصلون اليكما باياتنا انتما ومن اتبعكما الغالبون
translation_en_yusufali: Allah responded, “We will assist you with your brother and grant you both authority, so they cannot harm you. With Our signs, you and those who follow you will ˹certainly˺ prevail.”

text_simple: فلما جاءهم موسى باياتنا بينات قالوا ما هذا الا سحر مفترى وما سمعنا بهذا في ابائنا الاولين
translation_en_yusufali: But when Moses came to them with Our clear signs, they said ˹arrogantly˺, “This is nothing but conjured magic ˹tricks˺. We have never heard of this in ˹the history of˺ our forefathers.”

text_simple: وقال موسى ربي اعلم بمن جاء بالهدى من عنده ومن تكون له عاقبة الدار انه لا يفلح الظالمون
translation_en_yusufali: Moses responded, “My Lord knows best who has come with ˹true˺ guidance from Him and will fare best in the end. Indeed, the wrongdoers will never succeed.”

text_simple: وقال فرعون يا ايها الملا ما علمت لكم من اله غيري فاوقد لي يا هامان على الطين فاجعل لي صرحا لعلي اطلع الى اله موسى واني لاظنه من الكاذبين
translation_en_yusufali: Pharaoh declared, “O chiefs! I know of no other god for you but myself. So bake bricks out of clay for me, O  Hamân, and build a high tower so I may look at the God of Moses, although I am sure he is a liar.”

text_simple: واستكبر هو وجنوده في الارض بغير الحق وظنوا انهم الينا لا يرجعون
translation_en_yusufali: And so he and his soldiers behaved arrogantly in the land with no right, thinking they would never be returned to Us.

text_simple: فاخذناه وجنوده فنبذناهم في اليم فانظر كيف كان عاقبة الظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: So We seized him and his soldiers, casting them into the sea. See then what was the end of the wrongdoers!

text_simple: وجعلناهم ائمة يدعون الى النار ويوم القيامة لا ينصرون
translation_en_yusufali: We made them leaders inviting ˹others˺ to the Fire. And on the Day of Judgment they will not be helped.

text_simple: واتبعناهم في هذه الدنيا لعنة ويوم القيامة هم من المقبوحين
translation_en_yusufali: We caused a curse to follow them in this world. And on the Day of Judgment they will be among the outcasts.

text_simple: ولقد اتينا موسى الكتاب من بعد ما اهلكنا القرون الاولى بصائر للناس وهدى ورحمة لعلهم يتذكرون
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, We gave Moses the Scripture—after destroying earlier nations—as an insight for the people, a guide, and mercy so perhaps they would be mindful.

text_simple: وما كنت بجانب الغربي اذ قضينا الى موسى الامر وما كنت من الشاهدين
translation_en_yusufali: You were not there ˹O Prophet˺ on the western side of the mountain when We entrusted the Commandments to Moses, nor were you present ˹in his time˺.

text_simple: ولكنا انشانا قرونا فتطاول عليهم العمر وما كنت ثاويا في اهل مدين تتلو عليهم اياتنا ولكنا كنا مرسلين
translation_en_yusufali: But We ˹later˺ raised ˹several˺ generations, and the ages took their toll on them. Nor were you living among the people of Midian, rehearsing Our revelations with them. But it is We Who have sent ˹this revelation to you˺.

text_simple: وما كنت بجانب الطور اذ نادينا ولكن رحمة من ربك لتنذر قوما ما اتاهم من نذير من قبلك لعلهم يتذكرون
translation_en_yusufali: And you were not at the side of Mount Ṭûr when We called out ˹to Moses˺. But ˹you have been sent˺ as a mercy from your Lord to warn a people to whom no warner has come before you, so perhaps they may be mindful.

text_simple: ولولا ان تصيبهم مصيبة بما قدمت ايديهم فيقولوا ربنا لولا ارسلت الينا رسولا فنتبع اياتك ونكون من المؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: Also so they would not say, if struck by an affliction for what their hands have done: “Our Lord! If only You had sent us a messenger, we would have followed Your revelations and become believers.”

text_simple: فلما جاءهم الحق من عندنا قالوا لولا اوتي مثل ما اوتي موسى اولم يكفروا بما اوتي موسى من قبل قالوا سحران تظاهرا وقالوا انا بكل كافرون
translation_en_yusufali: But when the truth came to them from Us, they said, “If only he was given the like of what Moses had been given.” Did they not deny what had been given to Moses earlier? They claimed, “Both ˹Scriptures˺ are works of magic, supporting each other!” Adding, “We truly deny both.”

text_simple: قل فاتوا بكتاب من عند الله هو اهدى منهما اتبعه ان كنتم صادقين
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Bring then a scripture from Allah which is a better guide than these two so I may follow it, if your claim is true.”

text_simple: فان لم يستجيبوا لك فاعلم انما يتبعون اهواءهم ومن اضل ممن اتبع هواه بغير هدى من الله ان الله لا يهدي القوم الظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: So if they fail to respond to you, then know that they only follow their desires. And who could be more astray than those who follow their desires with no guidance from Allah? Surely Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

text_simple: ولقد وصلنا لهم القول لعلهم يتذكرون
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, We have steadily delivered the Word ˹of Allah˺ to the people so they may be mindful.

text_simple: الذين اتيناهم الكتاب من قبله هم به يؤمنون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹As for˺ those ˹faithful˺ to whom We had given the Scripture before this ˹Quran˺, they do believe in it.

text_simple: واذا يتلى عليهم قالوا امنا به انه الحق من ربنا انا كنا من قبله مسلمين
translation_en_yusufali: When it is recited to them, they declare, “We believe in it. This is definitely the truth from our Lord. We had already submitted ˹even˺ before this.”

text_simple: اولئك يؤتون اجرهم مرتين بما صبروا ويدرءون بالحسنة السيئة ومما رزقناهم ينفقون
translation_en_yusufali: These ˹believers˺ will be given a double reward for their perseverance, responding to evil with good, and for donating from what We have provided for them.

text_simple: واذا سمعوا اللغو اعرضوا عنه وقالوا لنا اعمالنا ولكم اعمالكم سلام عليكم لا نبتغي الجاهلين
translation_en_yusufali: When they hear slanderous talk, they turn away from it, saying, “We are accountable for our deeds and you for yours. Peace ˹is our only response˺ to you! We want nothing to do with those who act ignorantly.”

text_simple: انك لا تهدي من احببت ولكن الله يهدي من يشاء وهو اعلم بالمهتدين
translation_en_yusufali: You surely cannot guide whoever you like ˹O Prophet˺, but it is Allah Who guides whoever He wills, and He knows best who are ˹fit to be˺ guided.

text_simple: وقالوا ان نتبع الهدى معك نتخطف من ارضنا اولم نمكن لهم حرما امنا يجبى اليه ثمرات كل شيء رزقا من لدنا ولكن اكثرهم لا يعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: They say ˹to the Prophet˺, “If we were to follow ˹true˺ guidance with you, we would certainly be snatched away from our land.” Have We not established for them a safe haven ˹in Mecca˺ to which fruits of all kinds are brought as a provision from Us? But most of them do not know ˹this favour˺.

text_simple: وكم اهلكنا من قرية بطرت معيشتها فتلك مساكنهم لم تسكن من بعدهم الا قليلا وكنا نحن الوارثين
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Imagine˺ how many societies We have destroyed that had been spoiled by their ˹comfortable˺ living! Those are their residences, never inhabited after them except passingly. And We ˹alone˺ were the Successor.

text_simple: وما كان ربك مهلك القرى حتى يبعث في امها رسولا يتلو عليهم اياتنا وما كنا مهلكي القرى الا واهلها ظالمون
translation_en_yusufali: Your Lord would never destroy a society until He had sent to its capital a messenger, reciting Our revelations to them. Nor would We ever destroy a society unless its people persisted in wrongdoing.

text_simple: وما اوتيتم من شيء فمتاع الحياة الدنيا وزينتها وما عند الله خير وابقى افلا تعقلون
translation_en_yusufali: Whatever ˹pleasure˺ you have been given is no more than ˹a fleeting˺ enjoyment and adornment of this worldly life. But what is with Allah is far better and more lasting. Will you not then understand?

text_simple: افمن وعدناه وعدا حسنا فهو لاقيه كمن متعناه متاع الحياة الدنيا ثم هو يوم القيامة من المحضرين
translation_en_yusufali: Can those to whom We have made a fine promise—which they will see fulfilled—be like those who We have allowed to enjoy the pleasures of this worldly life, but on the Day of Judgment will be brought ˹for punishment˺?

text_simple: ويوم يناديهم فيقول اين شركائي الذين كنتم تزعمون
translation_en_yusufali: ˹Watch for˺ the Day He will call to them, “Where are those you claimed were My associate-gods?”

text_simple: قال الذين حق عليهم القول ربنا هؤلاء الذين اغوينا اغويناهم كما غوينا تبرانا اليك ما كانوا ايانا يعبدون
translation_en_yusufali: Those ˹misleaders˺ against whom the decree ˹of torment˺ is justified will cry, “Our Lord! These ˹followers˺ are the ones we caused to deviate. We led them into deviance, for we ourselves were deviant. We disassociate ourselves ˹from them˺ before You. It was not us that they used to worship.”

text_simple: وقيل ادعوا شركاءكم فدعوهم فلم يستجيبوا لهم وراوا العذاب لو انهم كانوا يهتدون
translation_en_yusufali: It will be said ˹to the disbelievers˺, “Call upon your associate-gods ˹for help˺.” So they will call them, but will receive no response. And they will face the punishment, wishing they had been ˹rightly˺ guided!

text_simple: ويوم يناديهم فيقول ماذا اجبتم المرسلين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹watch for˺ the Day He will call to them, asking, “What response did you give to the messengers?”

text_simple: فعميت عليهم الانباء يومئذ فهم لا يتساءلون
translation_en_yusufali: They will be too dumbstruck on that Day to ask one another ˹for answers˺.

text_simple: فاما من تاب وامن وعمل صالحا فعسى ان يكون من المفلحين
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who repent, believe, and do good ˹in this world˺, it is right to hope that they will be among the successful.

text_simple: وربك يخلق ما يشاء ويختار ما كان لهم الخيرة سبحان الله وتعالى عما يشركون
translation_en_yusufali: Your Lord creates and chooses whatever He wills—the choice is not theirs. Glorified and Exalted is Allah above what they associate ˹with Him˺!

text_simple: وربك يعلم ما تكن صدورهم وما يعلنون
translation_en_yusufali: And your Lord knows what their hearts conceal and what they reveal.

text_simple: وهو الله لا اله الا هو له الحمد في الاولى والاخرة وله الحكم واليه ترجعون
translation_en_yusufali: He is Allah. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. All praise belongs to Him in this life and the next. All authority is His. And to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.

text_simple: قل ارايتم ان جعل الله عليكم الليل سرمدا الى يوم القيامة من اله غير الله ياتيكم بضياء افلا تسمعون
translation_en_yusufali: Ask ˹them, O  Prophet˺, “Imagine if Allah were to make the night perpetual for you until the Day of Judgment, which god other than Allah could bring you sunlight? Will you not then listen?”

text_simple: قل ارايتم ان جعل الله عليكم النهار سرمدا الى يوم القيامة من اله غير الله ياتيكم بليل تسكنون فيه افلا تبصرون
translation_en_yusufali: Ask ˹them also˺, “Imagine if Allah were to make the day perpetual for you until the Day of Judgment, which god other than Allah could bring you night to rest in? Will you not then see?”

text_simple: ومن رحمته جعل لكم الليل والنهار لتسكنوا فيه ولتبتغوا من فضله ولعلكم تشكرون
translation_en_yusufali: It is out of His mercy that He has made for you the day and night so that you may rest ˹in the latter˺ and seek His bounty ˹in the former˺, and perhaps you will be grateful.

text_simple: ويوم يناديهم فيقول اين شركائي الذين كنتم تزعمون
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹watch for˺ the Day He will call to them, “Where are those you claimed were My associate-gods?”

text_simple: ونزعنا من كل امة شهيدا فقلنا هاتوا برهانكم فعلموا ان الحق لله وضل عنهم ما كانوا يفترون
translation_en_yusufali: And We will bring forth a witness from every faith-community and ask ˹the polytheists˺, “Show ˹Us˺ your proof.” Then they will ˹come to˺ know that the truth is with Allah ˹alone˺. And whatever ˹gods˺ they fabricated will fail them.

text_simple: ان قارون كان من قوم موسى فبغى عليهم واتيناه من الكنوز ما ان مفاتحه لتنوء بالعصبة اولي القوة اذ قال له قومه لا تفرح ان الله لا يحب الفرحين
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, Korah was from the people of Moses, but he behaved arrogantly towards them. We had granted him such treasures that even their keys would burden a group of strong men. ˹Some of˺ his people advised him, “Do not be prideful! Surely Allah does not like the prideful.

text_simple: وابتغ فيما اتاك الله الدار الاخرة ولا تنس نصيبك من الدنيا واحسن كما احسن الله اليك ولا تبغ الفساد في الارض ان الله لا يحب المفسدين
translation_en_yusufali: Rather, seek the ˹reward˺ of the Hereafter by means of what Allah has granted you, without forgetting your share of this world. And be good ˹to others˺ as Allah has been good to you. Do not seek to spread corruption in the land, for Allah certainly does not like the corruptors.”

text_simple: قال انما اوتيته على علم عندي اولم يعلم ان الله قد اهلك من قبله من القرون من هو اشد منه قوة واكثر جمعا ولا يسال عن ذنوبهم المجرمون
translation_en_yusufali: He replied, “I have been granted all this because of some knowledge I have.” Did he not know that Allah had already destroyed some from the generations before him who were far superior to him in power and greater in accumulating ˹wealth˺? There will be no need for the wicked to be asked about their sins.

text_simple: فخرج على قومه في زينته قال الذين يريدون الحياة الدنيا يا ليت لنا مثل ما اوتي قارون انه لذو حظ عظيم
translation_en_yusufali: Then he came out before his people in all his glamour. Those who desired the life of this world wished, “If only we could have something like what Korah has been given. He is truly a man of great fortune!”

text_simple: وقال الذين اوتوا العلم ويلكم ثواب الله خير لمن امن وعمل صالحا ولا يلقاها الا الصابرون
translation_en_yusufali: But those gifted with knowledge said, “Shame on you! Allah’s reward is far better for those who believe and do good. But none will attain this except the steadfast.”

text_simple: فخسفنا به وبداره الارض فما كان له من فئة ينصرونه من دون الله وما كان من المنتصرين
translation_en_yusufali: Then We caused the earth to swallow him up, along with his home. There was no one to help him against Allah, nor could he even help himself.

text_simple: واصبح الذين تمنوا مكانه بالامس يقولون ويكان الله يبسط الرزق لمن يشاء من عباده ويقدر لولا ان من الله علينا لخسف بنا ويكانه لا يفلح الكافرون
translation_en_yusufali: And those who had craved his position the previous day began to say, “Ah! It is certainly Allah Who gives abundant or limited provisions to whoever He wills of His servants. Had it not been for the grace of Allah, He could have surely caused the earth to swallow us up! Oh, indeed! The disbelievers will never succeed.”

text_simple: تلك الدار الاخرة نجعلها للذين لا يريدون علوا في الارض ولا فسادا والعاقبة للمتقين
translation_en_yusufali: That ˹eternal˺ Home in the Hereafter We reserve ˹only˺ for those who seek neither tyranny nor corruption on the earth. The ultimate outcome belongs ˹only˺ to the righteous.

text_simple: من جاء بالحسنة فله خير منها ومن جاء بالسيئة فلا يجزى الذين عملوا السيئات الا ما كانوا يعملون
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever comes with a good deed will be rewarded with what is better. And whoever comes with an evil deed, then the evildoers will only be rewarded for what they used to do.

text_simple: ان الذي فرض عليك القران لرادك الى معاد قل ربي اعلم من جاء بالهدى ومن هو في ضلال مبين
translation_en_yusufali: Most certainly, the One Who has ordained the Quran for you will ˹ultimately˺ bring you back home ˹to Mecca˺. Say, “My Lord knows best who has come with ˹true˺ guidance and who is clearly astray.”

text_simple: وما كنت ترجو ان يلقى اليك الكتاب الا رحمة من ربك فلا تكونن ظهيرا للكافرين
translation_en_yusufali: You never expected this Book to be revealed to you, but ˹it came˺ only ˹as˺ a mercy from your Lord. So never side with the disbelievers ˹in their disbelief˺.

text_simple: ولا يصدنك عن ايات الله بعد اذ انزلت اليك وادع الى ربك ولا تكونن من المشركين
translation_en_yusufali: Do not let them turn you away from the revelations of Allah after they have been sent down to you. Rather, invite ˹all˺ to ˹the Way of˺ your Lord, and never be one of the polytheists.

text_simple: ولا تدع مع الله الها اخر لا اله الا هو كل شيء هالك الا وجهه له الحكم واليه ترجعون
translation_en_yusufali: And do not invoke any other god with Allah. There is no god ˹worthy of worship˺ except Him. Everything is bound to perish except He Himself. All authority belongs to Him. And to Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.

text_simple: الم
translation_en_yusufali: Alif-Lãm-Mĩm.

text_simple: احسب الناس ان يتركوا ان يقولوا امنا وهم لا يفتنون
translation_en_yusufali: Do people think once they say, “We believe,” that they will be left without being put to the test?

text_simple: ولقد فتنا الذين من قبلهم فليعلمن الله الذين صدقوا وليعلمن الكاذبين
translation_en_yusufali: We certainly tested those before them. And ˹in this way˺ Allah will clearly distinguish between those who are truthful and those who are liars.

text_simple: ام حسب الذين يعملون السيئات ان يسبقونا ساء ما يحكمون
translation_en_yusufali: Or do the evildoers ˹simply˺ think that they will escape Us? How wrong is their judgment!

text_simple: من كان يرجو لقاء الله فان اجل الله لات وهو السميع العليم
translation_en_yusufali: Whoever hopes for the meeting with Allah, ˹let them know that˺ Allah’s appointed time is sure to come. He is the All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

text_simple: ومن جاهد فانما يجاهد لنفسه ان الله لغني عن العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: And whoever strives ˹in Allah’s cause˺, only does so for their own good. Surely Allah is not in need of ˹any of˺ His creation.

text_simple: والذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات لنكفرن عنهم سيئاتهم ولنجزينهم احسن الذي كانوا يعملون
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who believe and do good, We will certainly absolve them of their sins, and reward them according to the best of what they used to do.

text_simple: ووصينا الانسان بوالديه حسنا وان جاهداك لتشرك بي ما ليس لك به علم فلا تطعهما الي مرجعكم فانبئكم بما كنتم تعملون
translation_en_yusufali: We have commanded people to honour their parents. But if they urge you to associate with Me what you have no knowledge of, then do not obey them. To Me you will ˹all˺ return, and then I will inform you of what you used to do.

text_simple: والذين امنوا وعملوا الصالحات لندخلنهم في الصالحين
translation_en_yusufali: Those who believe and do good will surely be admitted by Us into ˹the company of˺ the righteous.

text_simple: ومن الناس من يقول امنا بالله فاذا اوذي في الله جعل فتنة الناس كعذاب الله ولئن جاء نصر من ربك ليقولن انا كنا معكم اوليس الله باعلم بما في صدور العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: There are some who say, “We believe in Allah,” but when they suffer in the cause of Allah, they mistake ˹this˺ persecution at the hands of people for the punishment of Allah. But when victory comes from your Lord, they surely say ˹to the believers˺, “We have always been with you.” Does Allah not know best what is in the hearts of all beings?

text_simple: وليعلمن الله الذين امنوا وليعلمن المنافقين
translation_en_yusufali: Allah will certainly distinguish between those who have ˹sure˺ faith and the hypocrites.

text_simple: وقال الذين كفروا للذين امنوا اتبعوا سبيلنا ولنحمل خطاياكم وما هم بحاملين من خطاياهم من شيء انهم لكاذبون
translation_en_yusufali: The disbelievers say to the believers, “˹Just˺ follow our way, and we will bear ˹the burden of˺ your sins.” But they would never ˹want to˺ bear any of the believers’ sins. They are simply lying.

text_simple: وليحملن اثقالهم واثقالا مع اثقالهم وليسالن يوم القيامة عما كانوا يفترون
translation_en_yusufali: Yet they will certainly ˹be made to˺ carry their own burdens, as well as other burdens along with their own. And they will surely be questioned on Judgment Day about what they used to fabricate.

text_simple: ولقد ارسلنا نوحا الى قومه فلبث فيهم الف سنة الا خمسين عاما فاخذهم الطوفان وهم ظالمون
translation_en_yusufali: Indeed, We sent Noah to his people, and he remained among them for a thousand years, less fifty. Then the Flood overtook them, while they persisted in wrongdoing.

text_simple: فانجيناه واصحاب السفينة وجعلناها اية للعالمين
translation_en_yusufali: But We delivered him and those in the Ark, making it a sign for all people.

text_simple: وابراهيم اذ قال لقومه اعبدوا الله واتقوه ذلكم خير لكم ان كنتم تعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when Abraham said to his people, “Worship Allah, and fear Him. This is better for you, if only you knew.

text_simple: انما تعبدون من دون الله اوثانا وتخلقون افكا ان الذين تعبدون من دون الله لا يملكون لكم رزقا فابتغوا عند الله الرزق واعبدوه واشكروا له اليه ترجعون
translation_en_yusufali: You worship besides Allah nothing but idols, simply creating lies ˹about them˺. Those you worship besides Allah certainly cannot give you any provision. So seek provision from Allah ˹alone˺, worship Him, and be grateful to Him. To Him you will ˹all˺ be returned.

text_simple: وان تكذبوا فقد كذب امم من قبلكم وما على الرسول الا البلاغ المبين
translation_en_yusufali: If you ˹Meccans˺ persist in denial, so did ˹many˺ communities before you. The Messenger’s duty is only to deliver ˹the message˺ clearly.”

text_simple: اولم يروا كيف يبدئ الله الخلق ثم يعيده ان ذلك على الله يسير
translation_en_yusufali: Have they not seen how Allah originates the creation then resurrects it? That is certainly easy for Allah.

text_simple: قل سيروا في الارض فانظروا كيف بدا الخلق ثم الله ينشئ النشاة الاخرة ان الله على كل شيء قدير
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Travel throughout the land and see how He originated the creation, then Allah will bring it into being one more time. Surely Allah is Most Capable of everything.

text_simple: يعذب من يشاء ويرحم من يشاء واليه تقلبون
translation_en_yusufali: He punishes whoever He wills, and shows mercy to whoever He wills. And you will ˹all˺ be returned to Him.

text_simple: وما انتم بمعجزين في الارض ولا في السماء وما لكم من دون الله من ولي ولا نصير
translation_en_yusufali: And you cannot escape Him on earth or in heaven. Nor have you any protector or helper besides Allah.”

text_simple: والذين كفروا بايات الله ولقائه اولئك يئسوا من رحمتي واولئك لهم عذاب اليم
translation_en_yusufali: As for those who disbelieve in Allah’s signs and the meeting with Him, it is they who will have no hope in His mercy. And it is they who will suffer a painful punishment.

text_simple: فما كان جواب قومه الا ان قالوا اقتلوه او حرقوه فانجاه الله من النار ان في ذلك لايات لقوم يؤمنون
translation_en_yusufali: But the only response of Abraham’s people was to say: “Kill him or burn him!” But Allah saved him from the fire. Surely in this are signs for people who believe.

text_simple: وقال انما اتخذتم من دون الله اوثانا مودة بينكم في الحياة الدنيا ثم يوم القيامة يكفر بعضكم ببعض ويلعن بعضكم بعضا وماواكم النار وما لكم من ناصرين
translation_en_yusufali: He said ˹to his people˺, “You have taken idols ˹for worship˺ instead of Allah, only to keep ˹the bond of˺ harmony among yourselves in this worldly life. But on the Day of Judgment you will disown and curse one another. Your home will be the Fire, and you will have no helper!”

text_simple: فامن له لوط وقال اني مهاجر الى ربي انه هو العزيز الحكيم
translation_en_yusufali: So Lot believed in him. And Abraham said, “I am emigrating ˹in obedience˺ to my Lord. He ˹alone˺ is indeed the Almighty, All-Wise.”

text_simple: ووهبنا له اسحاق ويعقوب وجعلنا في ذريته النبوة والكتاب واتيناه اجره في الدنيا وانه في الاخرة لمن الصالحين
translation_en_yusufali: We blessed him with Isaac and ˹later˺ Jacob, and reserved prophethood and revelation for his descendants. We gave him his reward in this life, and in the Hereafter he will certainly be among the righteous.

text_simple: ولوطا اذ قال لقومه انكم لتاتون الفاحشة ما سبقكم بها من احد من العالمين
translation_en_yusufali: And ˹remember˺ when Lot rebuked ˹the men of˺ his people: “You certainly commit a shameful deed that no man has ever done before you.

text_simple: ائنكم لتاتون الرجال وتقطعون السبيل وتاتون في ناديكم المنكر فما كان جواب قومه الا ان قالوا ائتنا بعذاب الله ان كنت من الصادقين
translation_en_yusufali: Do you really lust after ˹other˺ men, abuse the travellers, and practice immorality ˹openly˺ in your gatherings?” His people’s only response was to say ˹mockingly˺: “Bring Allah’s punishment upon us, if what you say is true.”

text_simple: قال رب انصرني على القوم المفسدين
translation_en_yusufali: Lot prayed, “My Lord! Help me against the people of corruption.”

text_simple: ولما جاءت رسلنا ابراهيم بالبشرى قالوا انا مهلكو اهل هذه القرية ان اهلها كانوا ظالمين
translation_en_yusufali: When Our messenger-angels came to Abraham with the good news ˹of the birth of Isaac˺, they said, “We are going to destroy the people of this city ˹of Sodom˺, for its people have persisted in wrongdoing.”

text_simple: قال ان فيها لوطا قالوا نحن اعلم بمن فيها لننجينه واهله الا امراته كانت من الغابرين
translation_en_yusufali: He said, “But Lot is there!” They responded, “We know best who is there. We will certainly save him and his family—except his wife, who is one of the doomed.”

text_simple: ولما ان جاءت رسلنا لوطا سيء بهم وضاق بهم ذرعا وقالوا لا تخف ولا تحزن انا منجوك واهلك الا امراتك كانت من الغابرين
translation_en_yusufali: And when Our messenger-angels came to Lot, he was distressed and worried by their arrival. They reassured ˹him˺, “Do not fear, nor grieve. We will surely deliver you and your family—except your wife, who is one of the doomed.

text_simple: انا منزلون على اهل هذه القرية رجزا من السماء بما كانوا يفسقون
translation_en_yusufali: We are certainly bringing down a punishment from heaven upon the people of this city for their rebelliousness.”

text_simple: ولقد تركنا منها اية بينة لقوم يعقلون
translation_en_yusufali: And We did leave ˹some of˺ its ruins as a clear lesson for people of understanding.

text_simple: والى مدين اخاهم شعيبا فقال يا قوم اعبدوا الله وارجوا اليوم الاخر ولا تعثوا في الارض مفسدين
translation_en_yusufali: And to the people of Midian ˹We sent˺ their brother Shu’aib. He said, “O my people! Worship Allah, and hope for ˹the reward of˺ the Last Day. And do not go about spreading corruption in the land.”

text_simple: فكذبوه فاخذتهم الرجفة فاصبحوا في دارهم جاثمين
translation_en_yusufali: But they rejected him, so an ˹overwhelming˺ earthquake struck them and they fell lifeless in their homes.

text_simple: وعادا وثمود وقد تبين لكم من مساكنهم وزين لهم الشيطان اعمالهم فصدهم عن السبيل وكانوا مستبصرين
translation_en_yusufali: And the people of ’Ȃd and Thamûd ˹met a similar fate˺, which must be clear to you ˹Meccans˺ from their ruins. Satan made their ˹evil˺ deeds appealing to them, hindering them from the ˹Right˺ Way, although they were capable of reasoning.

text_simple: وقارون وفرعون وهامان ولقد جاءهم موسى بالبينات فاستكبروا في الارض وما كانوا سابقين
translation_en_yusufali: ˹We˺ also ˹destroyed˺ Korah, Pharaoh, and Hamân. Indeed, Moses had come to them with clear proofs, but they behaved arrogantly in the land. Yet they could not escape ˹Us˺.

text_simple: فكلا اخذنا بذنبه فمنهم من ارسلنا عليه حاصبا ومنهم من اخذته الصيحة ومنهم من خسفنا به الارض ومنهم من اغرقنا وما كان الله ليظلمهم ولكن كانوا انفسهم يظلمون
translation_en_yusufali: So We seized each ˹people˺ for their sin: against some of them We sent a storm of stones, some were overtaken by a ˹mighty˺ blast, some We caused the earth to swallow, and some We drowned. Allah would not have wronged them, but it was they who wronged themselves.

text_simple: مثل الذين اتخذوا من دون الله اولياء كمثل العنكبوت اتخذت بيتا وان اوهن البيوت لبيت العنكبوت لو كانوا يعلمون
translation_en_yusufali: The parable of those who take protectors other than Allah is that of a spider spinning a shelter. And the flimsiest of all shelters is certainly that of a spider, if only they knew.

text_simple: ان الله يعلم ما يدعون من دونه من شيء وهو العزيز الحكيم
translation_en_yusufali: Allah surely knows that whatever ˹gods˺ they invoke besides Him are ˹simply˺ nothing. For He is the Almighty, All-Wise.

text_simple: وتلك الامثال نضربها للناس وما يعقلها الا العالمون
translation_en_yusufali: These are the parables We set forth for humanity, but none will understand them except the people of knowledge.

text_simple: خلق الله السماوات والارض بالحق ان في ذلك لاية للمؤمنين
translation_en_yusufali: Allah created the heavens and the earth for a purpose. Surely in this is a sign for the people of faith.

text_simple: اتل ما اوحي اليك من الكتاب واقم الصلاة ان الصلاة تنهى عن الفحشاء والمنكر ولذكر الله اكبر والله يعلم ما تصنعون
translation_en_yusufali: Recite what has been revealed to you of the Book and establish prayer. Indeed, ˹genuine˺ prayer should deter ˹one˺ from indecency and wickedness. The remembrance of Allah is ˹an˺ even greater ˹deterrent˺. And Allah ˹fully˺ knows what you ˹all˺ do.

text_simple: ولا تجادلوا اهل الكتاب الا بالتي هي احسن الا الذين ظلموا منهم وقولوا امنا بالذي انزل الينا وانزل اليكم والهنا والهكم واحد ونحن له مسلمون
translation_en_yusufali: Do not argue with the People of the Book unless gracefully, except with those of them who act wrongfully. And say, “We believe in what has been revealed to us and what was revealed to you. Our God and your God is ˹only˺ One. And to Him we ˹fully˺ submit.”

text_simple: وكذلك انزلنا اليك الكتاب فالذين اتيناهم الكتاب يؤمنون به ومن هؤلاء من يؤمن به وما يجحد باياتنا الا الكافرون
translation_en_yusufali: Similarly ˹to earlier messengers˺, We have revealed to you a Book ˹O Prophet˺. ˹The faithful of˺ those to whom We gave the Scriptures believe in it, as do some of these ˹pagan Arabs˺. And none denies Our revelations except the ˹stubborn˺ disbelievers.

text_simple: وما كنت تتلو من قبله من كتاب ولا تخطه بيمينك اذا لارتاب المبطلون
translation_en_yusufali: You ˹O Prophet˺ could not read any writing ˹even˺ before this ˹revelation˺, nor could you write at all. Otherwise, the people of falsehood would have been suspicious.

text_simple: بل هو ايات بينات في صدور الذين اوتوا العلم وما يجحد باياتنا الا الظالمون
translation_en_yusufali: But this ˹Quran˺ is ˹a set of˺ clear revelations ˹preserved˺ in the hearts of those gifted with knowledge. And none denies Our revelations except the ˹stubborn˺ wrongdoers.

text_simple: وقالوا لولا انزل عليه ايات من ربه قل انما الايات عند الله وانما انا نذير مبين
translation_en_yusufali: They say, “If only ˹some˺ signs had been sent down to him from his Lord!” Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Signs are only with Allah. And I am only sent with a clear warning.”

text_simple: اولم يكفهم انا انزلنا عليك الكتاب يتلى عليهم ان في ذلك لرحمة وذكرى لقوم يؤمنون
translation_en_yusufali: Is it not enough for them that We have sent down to you the Book, ˹which is˺ recited to them. Surely in this ˹Quran˺ is a mercy and reminder for people who believe.

text_simple: قل كفى بالله بيني وبينكم شهيدا يعلم ما في السماوات والارض والذين امنوا بالباطل وكفروا بالله اولئك هم الخاسرون
translation_en_yusufali: Say, ˹O Prophet,˺ “Sufficient is Allah as a Witness between me and you. He ˹fully˺ knows whatever is in the heavens and the earth. And those who believe in falsehood and disbelieve in Allah, it is they who are the ˹true˺ losers.”

text_simple: ويستعجلونك بالعذاب ولولا اجل مسمى لجاءهم العذاب ولياتينهم بغتة وهم لا يشعرون
translation_en_yusufali: They challenge you ˹O Prophet˺ to hasten the punishment. Had it not been for a time already set, the punishment would have certainly come to them ˹at once˺. But it will definitely take them by surprise when they least expect it.

text_simple: يستعجلونك بالعذاب وان جهنم لمحيطة بالكافرين
translation_en_yusufali: They urge you to hasten the punishment. And Hell will certainly encompass the disbelievers

text_simple: يوم يغشاهم العذاب من فوقهم ومن تحت ارجلهم ويقول ذوقوا ما كنتم تعملون
translation_en_yusufali: on the Day the punishment will overwhelm them from above them and from below their feet. And it will be said, “Reap what you sowed.”
